(245) 5 - محمد بن يعقوب عن الحسين بن محمد عن ملى بن محمد عن الحسن بن علي عن أبان بن عثمان عن عبد الرحمن بن أبي عبد الله قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن رجل أرسل كلبه فأخذ صيدا وأكل منه آكل من فضله؟ قال: كل ما قتل الكلب إذا سميت وإن كنت ناسيا فكل منه أيضا وكل فضله.
(246) 6 - عنه عن علي بن الحكم عن موسى بن بكر عن زرارة عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام أنه قال في صيد الكلب إذا أرسله وسمى فليأكل مما أمسك عليه وإن قتل وإن أكل فكل ما بقي.
(247) 7 - محمد بن يعقوب عن علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن ابن أبي عمير عن حماد عن الحلبي عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام انه سئل عن صيد البازي والكلب إذا صاد فقتل صيده وأكل منه آكل فضلهما أم لا؟ فقال: أما ما قتله الطير فلا تأكله إلا أن تذكيه، وأما ما قتله الكلب وقد ذكرت اسم الله عليه فكل وإن أكل منه.

(251) 11 - فأما ما رواه الحسين بن سعيد عن عثمان بن عيسى عن سماعة بن مهران قال:
سألته عما أمسك عليه الكلب المعلم للصيد وهو قول الله تعالى (وما علمتم من الجوارح مكلبين تعلمونهن مما علمكم الله فكلوا مما أمسكن عليكم واذكروا اسم الله عليه)؟ قال: لا بأس أن تأكلوا مما أمسك الكلب مما لم يأكل الكلب فإذا أكل الكلب منه قبل أن تدركه فلا تأكل منه، قال وسألته عن صيد الفهد وهو معلم للصيد؟ فقال: إن أدركته حيا فدكه وكله وإن قتله فلا تأكل منه.
(252) 12 - عنه عن فضالة بن أيوب عن رفاعة بن موسى قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن الكلب يقتل فقال: كل، فقلت آكل منه؟ فقال: إذا اكل منه فلم يمسك عليك إنما أمسك على نفسه.
فالوجه في هذين الخبرين أن نحملهما على أحد وجهين، أحدهما أن نحملهما على أنه إذا كان الكلب معتادا لاكل ما يصطاده فإنه لا يؤكل مما بقي منه وإنما يؤكل بقيته إذا كان ذلك منه شاذا نادرا، والوجه الآخر أن نحملهما على ضرب من التقية لان في الفقهاء من يقول ذلك ويعتل بأنه أمسك على نفسه لا عليك، يدل على ذلك:

(250) 10 - From him, from Ṣafwān, from Ibn Miskān, from Muḥammad al-Ḥalabī who said: I asked Abū ‘Abd Allāh (peace be upon him) about a dog that hunts. If it eats from its prey, can we eat the remainder? He said: Yes.
(251) 11 - As for what al-Ḥusayn b. Sa‘īd narrated from ‘Uthmān b. ‘Īsā, from Samā‘ah b. Mihrān who said:
I asked him about what a trained hunting dog catches, regarding the saying of God, the Most High: “And what you have taught of hunting animals, training them to hunt, you teach them of what God has taught you, so eat of what they catch for you and mention the name of God upon it.” He said: There is no problem if you eat from what the dog catches, so long as the dog has not eaten from it. If the dog eats from it before you reach it, then do not eat from it. He said: And I asked him about hunting with a cheetah that is trained for hunting? He said: If you find it alive, then slaughter it and eat. If it killed it, then do not eat from it.
(252) 12 - From him, from Faḍālah b. Ayyūb, from Rifā‘ah b. Mūsā who said: I asked Abū ‘Abd Allāh (peace be upon him) about a dog that kills [the prey]. He said: Eat. I said: I eat from it? He said: If he eats from it, then he did not catch it for you; he caught it for himself.
The interpretation of these two narrations is to understand them in one of two ways: One is to understand them to mean that if the dog is accustomed to eating what it hunts, then one should not eat from what remains of it. Rather, one should only eat the remainder if that is something rare and unusual from it. The other interpretation is to understand them as a form of taqiyyah (dissimulation), because among the jurists there are those who say that, arguing that it caught it for itself, not for you. Evidence for that is:
(253) 13 - What Muḥammad b. Ya‘qūb narrated from Muḥammad b. Yaḥyā, from Aḥmad b. Muḥammad, from Muḥammad b. Yaḥyā, from Jamīl b. Darrāj who said: Ḥakam b. Ḥakīm al-Ṣayrafī narrated to me, saying: I said to Abū ‘Abd Allāh (peace be upon him): What do you say about a dog that hunts prey and kills it? He said: There is no problem, eat. He said: I said:
They say that if it eats from it, then it only caught it for itself, so do not eat it. He said: Have they not agreed with you that its killing is its act of ritual slaughter (dhakāt)? He said: I said: Yes. He said: Then what do they say about a sheep that a man slaughtered?

text:
أذكاها؟ قال: قلت نعم، قال: فان السبع جاء بعد ما ذكى فأكل بعضها يؤكل البقية؟ فإذا أجابوكم إلى هذا فقل لهم كيف تقولون إذا ذكى هذا وأكل منها لم تأكلوا منها وإذا ذكى هذا وأكل أكلتم.
ويجوز أن يكون المراد بالكلب في الخبرين الفهد وغيره من السباع لان ذلك يسمى كلبا في اللغة وإن لم يقل بعرف الشريعة في قوله تعالى " مكلبين " فيما يصطاده الفهد، وما يصطاده شبيهه لا يؤكل إلا ما أدرك ذكاته على ما سنبينه فيما بعد إن شاء الله تعالى.
45 - باب صيد كلب المجوس (254) 1 الحسين بن سعيد عن النضر بن سويد عن هشام بن سالم عن سليمان بن خالد قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن كلب المجوس يأخذه الرجل المسلم فيسمي حين برسله أيأكل منه مما أمسك عليه؟ فقال: نعم لأنه مكلب وذكر اسم الله عز وجل عليه.
(255) 2 - فأما ما رواه أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن علي بن الحكم عن سيف بن عميرة عن منصور بن حازم عن عبد الرحمن بن سيابة قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام فقلت كلب مجوسي أستعيره أفأصيد به؟ قال: لا تأكل من صيده إلا أن يكون علمه مسلم.
فلا ينافي هذا الخبر الأول لان الوجه في هذا الخبر ان نحمله على أنه إذا لم يعلمه المسلم ولا يسمي عند ارساله فلا يجوز أكل ما يصيده، فاما إذا علمه وسمى فلا بأس على ما تضمنه الخبر الأول، والذي يدل على ذلك:

My father used to issue fatwas, and we used to issue fatwas while we were afraid regarding hunting with falcons and saker falcons. But now, we are not afraid, and we do not consider their prey lawful except if its *dhakat* (religiously prescribed slaughter) is attained. (276) 9 - فأما ما رواه محمد بن يعقوب عن الحسين بن محمد عن معلى بن محمد عن بسطام ابن قرة عن إسحاق بن حسان عن الهيثم بن واقد عن علي بن الحسن العبدي عن أبي هارون عن أبي سعيد الخدري قال: أمر رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله بلالا بأن ينادى أن رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله حرم الجري والضب والحمر الأهلية.
فالوجه في هذا الخبر أن نحمله على التقية لأنه رواه رجال العامة حسب ما يعتقدونه ويروونه عن النبي صلى لله عليه وآله أنه حرم ذلك ولا نعمل نحن إلا على ما تقدم من الاخبار.
48 - باب تحريم أكل لحم الغنم إذا شرب من لبن خنزيرة (277) 1 - محمد بن يحيى عن العباس بن معروف عن الحسن بن محبوب عن حنان بن سدير عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام أنه سئل وأنا حاضر عن جدي رضع من خنزيرة حتى شب واشتد عظمه ثم استفحله رجل في غنم له فخرج له نسل ما تقول في نسله؟
قال: أما ما عرفت من نسله بعينه فلا تقربه، وأما ما لم تعرفه فهو بمنزلة الجبن كل ولا تسأل عنه.
(278) 2 - محمد بن يعقوب عن حميد بن زياد عن عبد الله بن أحمد النهيكي عن ابن أبي عمير

and bats, donkeys, mules, and horses, he said: "Nothing is unlawful except what God has made unlawful in His Mighty Book. The Messenger of God, may God bless him and his family, forbade the eating of donkey meat on the day of Khaybar, but he only forbade them for the sake of their backs, lest they be depleted. Donkeys are not unlawful." Then he said: "Read this verse: 'Say, "I do not find within that which has been revealed to me [anything] forbidden to one who would eat it unless it be a dead animal or blood poured out or the flesh of swine - for indeed, it is impure - or defilement offered to other than Allāh.'"

(276) 9 - As for what Muhammad ibn Ya'qub narrated from al-Husayn ibn Muhammad from Mu'alla ibn Muhammad from Bistam ibn Qurra from Ishaq ibn Hassan from al-Haytham ibn Waqid from Ali ibn al-Hasan al-Abdi from Abi Harun from Abi Sa'id al-Khudri who said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and his family, ordered Bilal to announce that the Messenger of God, may God bless him and his family, has forbidden the al-jirri fish, the lizard, and domestic donkeys.

The explanation for this report is that we interpret it as taqiyya (dissimulation), because it was narrated by the men of the general populace according to what they believe and narrate from the Prophet, may God bless him and his family, that he forbade that. We only act upon what has preceded of the reports.

48 - Chapter on the Prohibition of Eating Sheep Meat if it Drinks from the Milk of a Sow (277) 1 - Muhammad ibn Yahya from al-Abbas ibn Ma'ruf from al-Hasan ibn Mahbub from Hanan ibn Sudair from Abi Abdillah, peace be upon him, that he was asked, and I was present, about my grandfather who suckled from a sow until he grew up and his bones became strong, then a man used him as a stud in his sheep, and he produced offspring. What do you say about his offspring?

He said: "As for what you know of his offspring specifically, do not approach it. As for what you do not know, it is like cheese; eat and do not ask about it."

(278) 2 - Muhammad ibn Ya'qub from Humayd ibn Ziyad from Abdullah ibn Ahmad al-Nahiki from Ibn Abi Umayr

عن بشر بن مسلمة عن أبي الحسن عليه السلام في جدي رضع من خنزيرة ثم ضرب في الغنم فقال: هو بمنزلة الجبن فما عرفت أنه ضربة فلا تأكله وما لم تعرفه فكله.
(279) 3 - عنه عن محمد بن يحيى عن أحمد بن محمد عن الوشا عن عبد الله بن سنان عن أبي حمزه رفعه قال: لا تأكل من لحم حمل رضع من لبن خنزيرة.
قال محمد بن الحسن هذه الأخبار كلها محمولة على أنه إذا رضع من الخنزيرة رضاعا تاما نبت عليه لحمه ودمه وتشتد بذلك قوته، فأما إذا كان دفعة أو دفعتين أو ما لا ينبت اللحم ويشد العظم فلا بأس بأكل لحمه بعد استبرائه بما سنذكره إنشاء الله، وقد صرح في الحديث الأول بذلك حين سأله السائل فقال: رضع من خنزيرة حتى شب واشتد عظمه فأجابه حينئذ بما ذكرناه، والذي يدل على ذلك:
(280) 4 - ما رواه محمد بن يعقوب عن علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن النوفلي عن السكوني عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام أن أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام سئل عن حمل غذي لبن خنزير فقال: قيدوه واعلفوه الكسب (1) والنوى والشعير والخبز إن كان استغنى عن اللبن وإن لم يكن استغنى عن اللبن فيلقى على ضرع شاة سبعة أيام ثم يؤكل لحمه.
49 - باب كراهية لحوم الجلالات (281) 1 - أحمد بن محمد عن علي بن الحكم عن هشام بن سالم عن أبي حمزة عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: لا تأكلوا لحوم الجلالة وإن أصابك من عرقها فاغسله.

From Bishr ibn Muslimah, from Abi al-Hasan (peace be upon him), regarding a kid that suckled from a sow and then was put out to pasture with sheep, he said: "It is like cheese. If you know that it suckled, then do not eat it, and if you do not know, then eat it."
(279) 3 - From him, from Muhammad ibn Yahya, from Ahmad ibn Muhammad, from al-Washa, from Abdullah ibn Sinan, from Abi Hamza, who raised it [the hadith], saying: "Do not eat the meat of a lamb that suckled from the milk of a sow."
Muhammad ibn al-Hasan said: "All these narrations are to be understood as applying to a case where it suckled from the sow to such an extent that its flesh and blood grew from it, and its strength became dependent on it. As for if it was only once or twice, or not to the extent that flesh grows and bones strengthen, then there is no harm in eating its meat after testing it in the manner that we shall mention, Allah willing. This is clearly stated in the first hadith when the questioner asked him, saying: 'It suckled from a sow until it grew up and its bones became strong.' He then answered him with what we mentioned. What indicates this is:
(280) 4 - What Muhammad ibn Ya'qub narrated from Ali ibn Ibrahim, from his father, from al-Nawfali, from al-Sakuni, from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him), that Amir al-Mu'minin (peace be upon him) was asked about a kid that was nourished with the milk of a pig, so he said: "Tie it up and feed it oil-cake (1), date stones, barley, and bread if it no longer needs milk. And if it still needs milk, then let it suck from the udder of a sheep for seven days, then its meat may be eaten."
49 - Chapter on the Dislike of Eating the Meat of Animals that Eat Filth
(281) 1 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad, from Ali ibn al-Hakam, from Hisham ibn Salim, from Abi Hamza, from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him), who said: "Do not eat the meat of *al-jallalah* (animals that eat filth), and if its sweat touches you, then wash it off."

text:
فلا ينافي هذا الخبر ما قدمناه من الاخبار لأنه ليس في الخبر انها تكون جلالة بل فيها انها تمر على العذرة وانها لا تصد عن شئ وكل ذلك لا يفيد كونها جلالة، على أنه لو كان في الخبر صريح بأنها جلالة لجاز لنا أن نقول قوله عليه السلام لا بأس به يحتمل أن يكون أراد بعد أن تستبرأ ثلاثة أيام حسب ما قدمناه، لأنا لم نقل ان لحم الجلالات حرام على كل حال، على أنه قد روي أن الذي يراعى فيه الاستبراء الذي قدمناه إذا لم تخلط غذاءها بغير العذرة، فأما إذا كانت تخلط فلا بأس بأكل لحمها، يبين ذلك:
(287) 7 - ما رواه محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن بعض أصحابه عن علي بن حسان عن علي ابن عقبة عن موسى بن أكيل عن بعض أصحابنا عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام في شاة شربت بولا ثم ذبحت فقال: يغسل ما في جوفها ثم لا بأس به، وكذلك إذا اعتلفت العذرة ما لم تكن جلالة، والجلالة التي يكون ذلك غذاؤها.
(288) 8 - محمد بن يعقوب عن محمد بن يحيى عن أحمد بن محمد عن الخشاب عن علي بن أسباط عمن روى في الجلالات لا بأس بأكلهن إذا كن يخلطن.
50 - باب لحم البخاتي (289) 1 - محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن موسى بن عمر عن جعفر بن بشير عن داود بن كثير الرقي قال: كتبت إلى أبي الحسن عليه السلام أسأله عن لحوم البخت وألبانها فقال: لا بأس به.
ولا ينافي هذا الخبر:
(290) 2 - ما رواه محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن أحمد بن محمد عن بكر بن صالح عن سليمان

This report does not contradict the reports we presented earlier, because it does not state that it (the animal) is a *jallalah*, but rather that it passes by filth and that it does not prevent anything. All of this does not imply that it is a *jallalah*. Moreover, even if the report explicitly stated that it is a *jallalah*, we could still say that his (peace be upon him) statement "there is nothing wrong with it" could mean after it has been quarantined for three days, as we mentioned earlier, because we did not say that the meat of *jallalah* animals is forbidden in every case. Furthermore, it has been reported that the quarantine period we mentioned is observed when their food is not mixed with anything other than filth, but if they mix it, then there is nothing wrong with eating their meat. This is clarified by:
(287) 7 - What Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya narrated from some of his companions, from Ali ibn Hassan, from Ali ibn Uqba, from Musa ibn Ukayl, from some of our companions, from Abi Jaafar (peace be upon him) regarding a sheep that drank urine and then was slaughtered, he said: "Wash what is inside it, then there is nothing wrong with it. Likewise, if it feeds on filth, as long as it is not a *jallalah*, and the *jallalah* is that which has that as its food."
(288) 8 - Muhammad ibn Yaqub, from Muhammad ibn Yahya, from Ahmad ibn Muhammad, from al-Khashab, from Ali ibn Asbat, from someone who narrated about *jallalah* animals: "There is nothing wrong with eating them if they mix (their food)."

50 - Chapter on the Meat of *Bukhti* Camels (289) 1 - Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya, from Musa ibn Umar, from Jaafar ibn Bashir, from Dawood ibn Kathir al-Raqqi, who said: "I wrote to Abi al-Hasan (peace be upon him) asking him about the meat and milk of *bukht* camels, and he said: 'There is nothing wrong with it.'"
This report does not contradict:
(290) 2 - What Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad, from Bakr ibn Salih, from Sulayman

text:
الجعفري عن أبي الحسن عليه السلام قال: سمعته يقول: لا آكل لحوم البخاتي ولا آمر أحدا بأكلها في حديث طويل.
لان قوله عليه السلام لا آكله إخبار عن امتناعه من اكله وقوله: لا آمر إنما نفى أن يكون ذلك مأمورا به، ولو كان كذلك لوجب أكله وليس ذلك قولا لاحد وليس في الخبر ان ذلك حرام أو ليس بمباح فينا في الخبر الأول على أن تحريم لحم البخاتي شئ كان يقوله أبو الخطاب لعنه الله وأصحابه فيجوز أن يكون سليمان الجعفري سمع بعض أصحابه يقول ذلك ويسنده إليه فرواه عن أبي الحسن عليه السلام ظنا منه لصدقه وحسن اعتقاده فيه، يدل على ذلك:
(291) 3 - ما رواه أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن الحسن بن علي عن داود بن كثير الرقي قال: قلت لأبي عبد الله عليه السلام جعلت فداك إن رجلا من أصحاب أبي الخطاب نهاني عن أكل البخت وعن أكل الحمام المسرول (1) فقال أبو عبد الله عليه السلام لا بأس بركوب البخت وشرب ألبانها وأكل لحومها وأكل الحمام المسرول.
51 - باب انه لا يجوز الذبح الا بالحديد (292) 1 - أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن علي بن الحكم عن سيف بن عميرة عن أبي بكر الحضرمي عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام أنه قال: لا يؤكل ما لم يذبح بالحديد.
(293) 2 - محمد بن يعقوب عن عدة من أصحابنا عن أحمد بن محمد بن خالد عن عثمان ابن عيسى عن سماعة قال: سألته عن الذكاة فقال: لا يذكى إلا بحديدة نهى عن ذلك أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام.
(294) 3 - عنه عن علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن ابن أبي عمير عن عمر بن أذينة

T Text:

Al-Ja'fari from Abi al-Hasan (peace be upon him) who said: "I heard him say: 'I do not eat the meat of al-Bukhti camels, nor do I order anyone to eat it,'" in a long hadith.
Because his saying (peace be upon him), "I do not eat it," is an expression of his abstention from eating it, and his saying, "I do not order," only negates that it is something commanded. If it were, it would be obligatory to eat it, but that is not a statement for anyone. And there is nothing in the report that it is haram (forbidden) or not permissible. It appears in the first report that the prohibition of al-Bukhti camel meat was something that Abu al-Khattab (may Allah curse him) and his companions used to say. It is possible that Sulaiman al-Ja'fari heard some of his companions say that and attribute it to him, so he narrated it from Abi al-Hasan (peace be upon him) thinking that he was truthful and had good faith in him. This is indicated by:
(291) 3 - What Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Isa narrated from al-Hasan ibn Ali from Dawud ibn Kathir al-Raqqi who said: "I said to Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him), 'May I be your ransom, a man from the companions of Abi al-Khattab forbade me from eating al-Bukht and from eating al-hamam al-musarwal (1).'" Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) said: "There is nothing wrong with riding al-Bukht, drinking its milk, eating its meat, and eating al-hamam al-musarwal."
51 - Chapter on it not being permissible to slaughter except with iron.
(292) 1 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Isa from Ali ibn al-Hakam from Saif ibn Umayrah from Abi Bakr al-Hadrami from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) who said: "What is not slaughtered with iron should not be eaten."
(293) 2 - Muhammad ibn Yaqub from a number of our companions from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Khalid from Uthman ibn Isa from Sama'ah who said: "I asked him about dhakat (ritually slaughtered meat), and he said: 'Nothing should be slaughtered except with iron. Amir al-Mu'minin (peace be upon him) forbade that.'"
(294) 3 - From him, from Ali ibn Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abi Umayr, from Umar ibn Udhaynah

text:
عن محمد بن مسلم قال: سألت أبا جعفر عليه السلام عن الذبيحة بالليطة (1) وبالمدرة (2) فقال لا ذكاة إلا بالحديدة.
(295) 4 - عنه عن علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن ابن أبي عمير عن حماد عن الحلبي عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: سألته عن ذبيحة العود والقصبة والحجر قال: فقال علي عليه السلام: لا يصلح الذبح إلا بحديدة.
(296) 5 - فأما ما رواه الحسن بن محبوب عن زيد الشحام قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن رجل لم يكن بحضرته سكين أفيذبح بقصبة؟ فقال:
إذبح بالحجر وبالعظم وبالقصبة والعود إذا لم تصب الحديد إذا قطع الحلقوم وخرج الدم فلا بأس.
(297) 6 - محمد بن يعقوب عن علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن ابن أبي عمير عن عبد الرحمن ابن الحجاج قال: سألت أبا إبراهيم عليه السلام عن المروة والقصبة والعود يذبح بهن إذا لم يجدوا سكينا؟ قال: إذا فرى الأوداج فلا بأس.
(298) 7 - محمد بن يحيى عن عبد الله بن محمد عن علي بن الحكم عن أبان عن محمد بن مسلم قال: قال أبو جعفر عليه السلام في الذبيحة بغير حديدة إذا اضطررت إليها فإن لم تجد حديدة فاذبحها بحجر.
فالوجه في هذه الأخبار أن نخصها بحال الضرورة التي لا يقدر فيها على الحديدة فأما مع وجود الحديدة فلا يجوز على حال الذبح إلا به.

From Muhammad ibn Muslim, who said: I asked Abu Ja'far, peace be upon him, about slaughtering with al-laytah (1) and al-midrah (2). He said: There is no valid slaughter except with iron.
(295) 4 - From him, from Ali ibn Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abi Umayr, from Hammad, from al-Halabi, from Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, who said: I asked him about slaughtering with wood, reed, and stone. He (Imam Ali) said: Slaughter is not valid except with iron.
(296) 5 - As for what al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Zayd al-Shahham, who said: I asked Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, about a man who did not have a knife present, so could he slaughter with a reed? He said:
Slaughter with stone, bone, reed, and wood if you cannot find iron. If it cuts the throat and blood flows, then there is no problem.
(297) 6 - Muhammad ibn Ya'qub, from Ali ibn Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abi Umayr, from Abd al-Rahman ibn al-Hajjaj, who said: I asked Abu Ibrahim, peace be upon him, about al-marwah, the reed, and the wood, can they be used for slaughtering if they do not find a knife? He said: If it severs the jugular veins, then there is no problem.
(298) 7 - Muhammad ibn Yahya, from Abdullah ibn Muhammad, from Ali ibn al-Hakam, from Aban, from Muhammad ibn Muslim, who said: Abu Ja'far, peace be upon him, said regarding slaughtering with something other than iron: If you are forced to do so, and you cannot find iron, then slaughter with a stone.
The interpretation of these narrations is that we restrict them to a state of necessity in which iron is not available. But when iron is available, slaughtering is not permissible in any case except with it.

(320) 22 - عنه عن فضالة بن أيوب عن القاسم بن يزيد عن محمد بن مسلم عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام قال: كل ذبيحة المشرك إذا ذكر اسم الله عليه وأنت تسمع، ولا تأكل ذبيحة نصارى العرب.
(321) 23 - عنه عن محمد بن أبي عمير عن جميل ومحمد بن حمران انهما سألا أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن ذبائح اليهود والنصارى والمجوس؟ فقال: كل، فقال بعضهم انهم لا يسمون فقال: فإن حضرتموهم فلم يسموا فلا تأكلوا وقال: إذا غاب فكل.
(322) 24 - عنه عن صفوان عن ابن مسكان عن محمد الحلبي قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن ذبيحة أهل الكتاب ونسائهم؟ فقال: لا بأس به.
(323) 25 - عنه عن القاسم بن محمد عن جميل بن صالح عن عبد الملك بن عمرو قال:
قلت لأبي عبد الله عليه السلام ما تقول في ذبائح النصارى؟ فقال: لا بأس بها قلت:
فإنهم يذكرون عليها المسيح؟ فقال: إنما أرادوا بالمسيح الله.
(324) 26 - عنه عن الحسن عن القاسم بن محمد عن علي عن أبي بصير قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن ذبيحة اليهودي؟ فقال: حلال قلت: فإن سمى المسيح؟
قال: وإن سمى فإنه إنما أراد به الله.
(325) 27 - عنه عن فضالة عن سيف بن عميرة عن أبي بكر الحضرمي عن أبي الورد ابن زيد قال: قلت لأبي جعفر عليه السلام: حدثني حديثا وأمله علي حتى اكتبه فقال أين حفظكم يا أهل الكوفة؟ قال قلت: حتى لا يرده علي أحد ما تقول في مجوسي قال بسم الله ثم ذبح؟ قال: كل، قلت: مسلم ذبح ولم يسم قال: لا تأكله إن الله تعالى يقول " فكلوا مما ذكر اسم الله عليه ولا تأكلوا مما لم يذكر اسم الله عليه ".

(320) 22 - From him, from Faḍālah b. Ayyūb, from al-Qāsim b. Yazīd, from Muḥammad b. Muslim, from Abī Ja’far (peace be upon him) who said: "Every offering of a polytheist is permissible if the name of Allah is mentioned upon it, and you hear it. But do not eat the offering of the Christians of the Arabs."
(321) 23 - From him, from Muḥammad b. Abī ‘Umair, from Jamīl and Muḥammad b. Ḥumrān, that they asked Abū ‘Abdillāh (peace be upon him) about the offerings of the Jews, the Christians, and the Magians? He said: "Eat." Then some of them said: "They do not mention the name of Allah." He said: "If you are present and they do not mention the name, then do not eat. But if you are absent, then eat."
(322) 24 - From him, from Ṣafwān, from Ibn Miskān, from Muḥammad al-Ḥalabī who said: "I asked Abū ‘Abdillāh (peace be upon him) about the offering of the People of the Book and their women?" He said: "There is no harm in it."
(323) 25 - From him, from al-Qāsim b. Muḥammad, from Jamīl b. Ṣāliḥ, from ‘Abdul-Malik b. ‘Amr who said:
"I said to Abū ‘Abdillāh (peace be upon him), 'What do you say about the offerings of the Christians?' He said: 'There is no harm in it.' I said: 'But they mention the Messiah upon it?' He said: 'They only mean Allah by the Messiah.'"
(324) 26 - From him, from al-Ḥasan, from al-Qāsim b. Muḥammad, from ‘Alī, from Abū Baṣīr who said: "I asked Abū ‘Abdillāh (peace be upon him) about the offering of the Jew?" He said: "It is lawful." I said: "Even if he mentions the Messiah?"
He said: "Even if he mentions, for he only means Allah by it."
(325) 27 - From him, from Faḍālah, from Saif b. ‘Umairah, from Abū Bakr al-Ḥaḍramī, from Abū al-Ward Ibn Zaid who said: "I said to Abū Ja’far (peace be upon him): 'Tell me a ḥadīth and dictate it to me so I may write it down.' He said: 'Where is your memory, O people of Kūfah?' He said: I said: 'So that no one may reject it to me. What do you say about a Magian who says 'In the name of Allah' and then slaughters?' He said: 'Eat.' I said: 'A Muslim slaughtered and did not mention the name of Allah?' He said: 'Do not eat it, for Allah the Exalted says: "So eat of that upon which the name of Allah has been mentioned, and do not eat that upon which the name of Allah has not been mentioned."'

(326) 28 - عنه عن حماد بن عيسى عن حريز عن أبي عبد الله (ع)، وزرارة عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام انهما قالا: في ذبائح أهل الكتاب فإذا شهدتموهم وقد سموا اسم الله فكلوا ذبائحهم، وإن لم تشهدهم فلا تأكل، وإن أتاك رجل مسلم فأخبرك انهم سموا فكل.
(327) 29 - عنه عن النضر بن سويد عن القاسم بن سليمان عن حريز قال: سئل أبو عبد الله عليه السلام عن ذبائح اليهود والنصارى والمجوس؟ فقال: إذا سمعتهم يسمون أو شهد لك من رآهم يسمون فكل، وإن لم تسمعهم ولم يشهد عندك من رآهم فلا تأكل ذبيحتهم.
(328) 30 - الصفار عن أحمد بن محمد عن البرقي عن أحمد بن محمد عن يونس بن بهمن قال: قلت لأبي الحسن عليه السلام: اهدى إلي قرابة لي نصراني دجاجا وفراخا قد شواها وعمل لي فالوذجة (1) فآكله؟ قال: لا بأس به.
(329) 31 - أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن سعد بن إسماعيل عن أبيه إسماعيل بن عيسى قال:
سألت الرضا عليه السلام عن ذبائح اليهود والنصارى وطعامهم؟ قال: نعم.
فأول ما في هذه الأخبار أنها لا تعارض الاخبار الأولة لان الأولة أكثر، وأيضا فممن روى هذه الأخبار من روى ما ذكرناه أولا من الحظر منهم الحلبي وأبو بصير ومحمد بن مسلم، ولو سلمت بعد ذلك من هذا كله لاحتملت وجهين، أحدهما: أن نحملهما على حال الضرورة دون حال الاختيار لان عند الضرورة تحل الميتة فكيف ذبيحة من خالف الاسلام، والذي يدل على ذلك:
(330) 32 - ما رواه محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن أحمد بن أبي حمزة القمي عن زكريا بن آدم قال قال لي أبو الحسن عليه السلام: إني أنهاك عن ذبيحة كل من كان على خلاف الذي أنت عليه وأصحابك إلا في وقت الضرورة إليه.

(326) 28 - From him, from Ḥammad ibn ʿĪsā, from Ḥurayz, from Abī ʿAbdillāh (peace be upon him), and Zurārah, from Abī Jaʿfar (peace be upon him), that they both said: "Regarding the sacrifices of the People of the Book, if you witness them mentioning the name of Allah, then eat from their sacrifices. But if you do not witness them, then do not eat. And if a Muslim comes to you and informs you that they mentioned (Allah's name), then eat."
(327) 29 - From him, from al-Naḍr ibn Suwayd, from al-Qāsim ibn Sulaymān, from Ḥurayz, who said: "Abū ʿAbdillāh (peace be upon him) was asked about the sacrifices of the Jews, Christians, and Magians? He said: 'If you hear them mentioning (Allah's name) or someone who saw them mentioning (Allah's name) testifies to you, then eat. But if you do not hear them and no one who saw them testifies to you, then do not eat their sacrifice.'"
(328) 30 - Al-Ṣaffār, from Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad, from al-Barqī, from Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad, from Yūnus ibn Bahman, who said: "I said to Abī al-Ḥasan (peace be upon him): 'A Christian relative gifted me chicken and chicks that he roasted, and he made fālūdhaj (1) for me, so can I eat it?' He said: 'There is no harm in it.'"
(329) 31 - Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʿĪsā, from Saʿd ibn Ismāʿīl, from his father Ismāʿīl ibn ʿĪsā, who said: "I asked al-Riḍā (peace be upon him) about the sacrifices and food of the Jews and Christians? He said: 'Yes.'"

The first thing about these narrations (akhbār) is that they do not contradict the earlier narrations, because the earlier ones are more numerous. Also, among those who narrated these narrations are those who narrated what we mentioned earlier about prohibition, including al-Ḥalabī, Abū Baṣīr, and Muḥammad ibn Muslim. Even if we were to consider them safe from all of this, they could be interpreted in two ways. One of them is: that we interpret them as applying to a state of necessity, not a state of choice, because in a state of necessity, carrion is permissible, so how about the sacrifice of someone who opposes Islam? What indicates that is:
(330) 32 - What Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn Yaḥyā narrated, from Aḥmad ibn Abī Ḥamzah al-Qummī, from Zakariyyā ibn Ādam, who said: "Abū al-Ḥasan (peace be upon him) said to me: 'I forbid you from the sacrifice of everyone who is contrary to what you and your companions are upon, except in times of necessity to it.'"

(331) 33 - ما رواه محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن سهل بن زياد عن أحمد بن بشير عن ابن أبي غفيلة الحسن بن أيوب عن داود بن كثير الرقي عن بشير بن أبي غيلان الشيباني قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن ذبائح اليهود والنصارى والنصاب قال فلوى شدقه (1) وقال: كلها إلى يوم ما.
53 - باب ذبائح من نصب العداوة لآل محمد عليهم السلام (332) 1 - الحسين بن سعيد عن النضر بن سويد عن زرعة عن أبي بصير قال: سمعت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام يقول: ذبيحة الناصب لا تحل.
(333) 2 - عنه عن حماد بن عيسى عن الحسين بن المختار عن أبي بصير عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام أنه قال: لم تحل ذبائح الحرورية.

والقرن والناب والحافر وكل شئ يفصل من الدابة والشاة فهو ذكي، وإن أخذته منه بعد أن يموت فاغسله وصل فيه.
(339) 2 - الحسن بن محبوب عن علي بن رئاب عن زرارة عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: سألته عن الإنفحة (1) يخرج من الجدي الميت قال: لا بأس به، قلت: اللبن يكون في ضرع الشاة وقد ماتت قال: لا بأس به، قلت: والصوف والشعر والعظام وعظام الفيل والجلد والبيض يخرج من الدجاجة فقال: كل هذا لا بأس به.
(340) 3 - فأما ما رواه محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن أبي جعفر عن وهب عن جعفر عن أبيه عليهما السلام أن عليا عليه السلام سئل عن شاة ماتت فحلب منها لبن؟ فقال: علي عليه السلام: ذلك الحرام محضا.
فهذه رواية شاذة وراويها وهب بن وهب وهو ضعيف على ما بيناه فيما مضى ويحتمل مع تسليم الخبر أن نحمله على ضرب من التقية لأنه مذهب بعض العامة.
55 - باب تحريم جلود الميتة.

And the horn, the canine tooth, the hoof, and everything that is separated from an animal or a sheep is pure even if you take it from it after it dies, wash it and pray in it.
(339) 2 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub from Ali ibn Ri'ab from Zurara from Abi Abdullah, peace be upon him, who said: I asked him about the rennet (1) that comes out of a dead kid, he said: There is nothing wrong with it. I said: The milk that is in the udder of the sheep and it has died? He said: There is nothing wrong with it. I said: And the wool, hair, bones, elephant bones, skin, and eggs that come out of the chicken? He said: All of this is fine.
(340) 3 - As for what Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya narrated from Abi Jaafar from Wahb from Jaafar from his father, peace be upon them, that Ali, peace be upon him, was asked about a sheep that died and milk was milked from it? Ali, peace be upon him, said: That is purely haram (forbidden).
This is a rare narration and its narrator is Wahb ibn Wahb, and he is da'īf (weak) according to what we have explained in the past, and it is possible, while acknowledging the report, to interpret it as a form of taqiyya (dissimulation), because it is the opinion of some of the common people.
55 - Chapter on the Prohibition of the Skins of Dead Animals.
(341) 1 - Muhammad ibn Yaqub from Ali ibn Ibrahim from his father from al-Mukhtar ibn Muhammad ibn al-Mukhtar, and Muhammad ibn al-Hasan (2) from Abi al-Hasan, peace be upon him, who said: I wrote to him asking him about the skins of dead animals whose meat is eaten, are they pure? He wrote: No benefit should be taken from the dead animal's skin (3) or sinew, and all that the lambs have of wool that is sheared, and hair, and fur, and rennet, and horn, and it should not extend to anything else.

قال قال رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله: من أكل هذا الطعام فلا يقرب مسجدنا يعني الثوم ولم يقل انه حرام.
(350) 2 - عنه عن محمد بن أبي عمير عن عمر بن أذينة عن محمد بن مسلم عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام قال: سألته عن الثوم فقال: إنما نهى رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله لريحه، وقال: من أكل هذه البقلة الخبيثة فلا يقرب مسجدنا، فأما من أكله ولم يأت المسجد فلا بأس.
(351) 3 - عنه عن حماد بن عيسى عن شعيب عن أبي بصير قال: سئل أبو عبد الله عليه السلام عن الثوم والبصل والكراث فقال: لا بأس بأكله نيا وفي القدر، ولا بأس بأن يتداوى بالثوم ولكن إذا أكل ذلك أحدكم فلا يخرج إلى المسجد.
(352) 4 - فأما ما رواه الحسين بن سعيد عن ابن أبي عمير عن عمر بن أذينة عن زرارة قال: حدثني من أصدق من أصحابنا أنه قال سألت أحدهما عليهما السلام عن الثوم فقال: أعد كل صلاة صليتها ما دمت تأكله فالوجه في هذا الخبر أن نحمله على ضرب من التغليظ في كراهته دون الحظر الذي يكون من أكل ذلك يقتضي استحقاقه الذم والعقاب بدلالة الاخبار الأولة والاجماع الواقع على أن أكل هذه الأشياء لا يوجب إعادة الصلاة.

He said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said: "Whoever eats this food should not approach our mosque," meaning garlic, but he did not say it is forbidden.
(350) 2 - From him, from Muhammad ibn Abi Umayr, from 'Umar ibn Udhayna, from Muhammad ibn Muslim, from Abi Ja'far, peace be upon him, who said: "I asked him about garlic, and he said: 'The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, only forbade it because of its smell.' (351) 3 - From him, from Hammad ibn 'Isa, from Shu'ayb, from Abi Basir, who said: "Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, was asked about garlic, onions, and leeks, and he said: 'There is nothing wrong with eating them raw or cooked. (352) 4 - As for what Al-Husayn ibn Sa'id narrated from Ibn Abi Umayr, from 'Umar ibn Udhayna, from Zurara, who said: "One of the most truthful of our companions told me that he said: I asked one of them, peace be upon them, about garlic, and he said: 'Repeat every prayer that you prayed while you were eating it.'" The interpretation of this report is that we should take it as a form of strong emphasis in its dislike, not as a prohibition that eating it would entail deserving blame and punishment, based on the earlier reports and the consensus that eating these things does not necessitate repeating the prayer.

He said: I asked Abu al-Hasan (peace be upon him) about a man who gives some of his wealth as charity to some of his children, then it occurs to him later to include others of his children with them. He said: There is nothing wrong with that. And regarding a man who gives some of his wealth as charity to some of his children and makes it clear to them, does he have the right to include others of his children with them after he has made the charity clear to them? He said: He does not have that right, unless he stipulates that whoever is born is like the one who received the charity, then that is for him.

(390) 6 - What Al-Hussein bin Saeed narrated from Al-Nadr bin Suwaid from Al-Qasim bin Sulaiman from Ubaid bin Zurara from Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him), that he said: Regarding a man who gives charity to his child who has reached maturity, he said: If they do not take possession of it until he dies, then it is an inheritance. But if he gives charity to one of his children who has not reached maturity, then it is permissible because the father is the one who manages his affairs. And he said: The charity cannot be taken back if it is given seeking the face of God.
(391) 7 - Muhammad bin Ali bin Mahboub from Ali bin Al-Sindi from Ibn Abi Umair from Jamil bin Darraj, he said: I said to Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him): A man gave charity to his children when they were young, does he have the right to take it back? He said: No, the charity is for God.
(392) 8 - Ahmad bin Muhammad from Safwan bin Yahya from Abu al-Hasan (peace be upon him), he said: I asked him about a man who endows a property, then it occurs to him to make a change in that. He said: If he endowed it for his children and others, then appointed a guardian for it, he does not have the right to take it back. And if they were young, and he stipulated guardianship over it for them until they reach maturity and take possession of it, he does not have the right to take it back. And if they were adults and he did not hand it over to them, and they did not dispute until they ratified it, then he has the right to take it back, because they do not take possession of it, even though they have reached maturity.

64 - Chapter on whether someone who donates a dwelling to another is allowed to live with them or not.

(393) 1 - Aban, from Abi al-Jarud, who said: Abu Ja'far (peace be upon him) said: "A man should not buy what he has given in charity. If he donates a dwelling to a relative, he may live with them if he wishes. And if he donates a servant to a relative, they may serve him if they wish."

(394) 2 - As for what Ali ibn al-Hasan ibn Faddal narrated from Amr ibn Uthman from Abdullah ibn al-Mughira from Talha ibn Zayd from Abi Abdullah from his father (peace be upon them) that a man donated his house while he was living in it, so he (the Imam) said: "Now get out of it."

This does not contradict the first report, because the reason for ordering him to leave the house was only to validate the *waqf* (endowment), because we have explained that part of its validity is handing over the *waqf* to the one for whom it was endowed. The intention was not that it is forbidden or prohibited for him, and that does not contradict:

(395) 3 - What Ali ibn al-Hasan narrated from Yaqub ibn Yazid al-Katib from Ibn Abi Umayr from Abi al-Muza from Abi Basir from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) who said: "I asked him about charity that has not been taken possession of or divided." He said: "It is permissible."

Because the meaning of this report is that it is permissible to give as charity what has not been taken possession of, and we did not say that this is not permissible. Rather, we said that it is not obligatory to fulfill it, and its owner has a choice in that.

65 - Chapter on *Sukna* (right of dwelling) and *Umra* (life grant).

(396) 1 - Al-Hasan ibn Muhammad ibn Sama'a from more than one, from Aban, from Abd al-Rahman ibn Abi Abd Allah, from Humran, who said: "I asked him about *sukna* and *umra*, and he said: 'People are bound by their conditions concerning it.'"

I said: What about a man who allows someone to reside in his house for his lifetime? He said: That is permissible. I said: What about a man who allows someone to reside in his house and does not specify a time? He said: It is permissible, and he can evict him whenever he wishes.
(399) 4 - Ali ibn Ibrahim from his father from Ibn Abi Umayr from Husayn ibn Nu’aym from Abu al-Hasan Musa, peace be upon him, who said: I asked him about a man who designated a house as a residence for another man for the days of his life, or designated it for him and his descendants after him, is it for him and his descendants as stipulated? He said: Yes. I said: If he needs to sell it? He said: Yes. I said: Does his selling of the house invalidate the residence agreement? He said: Selling does not invalidate the residence agreement. That is how I heard my father, peace be upon him, say, Abu Jaafar, peace be upon him, said: Selling does not invalidate a lease or a residence agreement, but he sells it on the condition that the one who buys it does not own what he bought until the residence agreement expires according to what was stipulated, and the same applies to a lease. I said: If he returns to the tenant his money and all that he spent on maintenance and repairs in what he leased, he said: If it is with a willing heart and the tenant is content with that, then there is no problem.

(400) 5 - As for what Al-Ḥasan ibn Maḥbūb narrated from Khālid ibn Nāfiʻ Al-Bajalī from Abī ʻAbdillāh (peace be upon him), who said: I asked him about a man who granted another man the right to reside in his house for the life of the owner of the house. The one who granted the residence died, and the one who was granted the residence remained. If the heirs wanted to evict him from the house, would they have the right to do so? He said: I believe that the house should be valued at a fair price, and then one-third of the deceased's estate should be considered. If one-third of the estate covers the price of the house, then the heirs do not have the right to evict him. But if one-third of the estate does not cover the price of the house, then they have the right to evict him. It was said to him: What if the man who was granted the residence dies after the death of the owner of the house, does the residence go to the heirs of the one who was granted the residence? He said: No.

The statement in the beginning of this narration, "meaning the owner of the house," is from the words of the narrator, and he was mistaken in his interpretation and erred, because the rulings he mentioned after that are only valid if the residence was granted for the duration of the life of the one who was given residence. In that case, it is valued and considered in relation to one-third of the estate, its increase or decrease. If the matter were as the narrator who misinterpreted the ḥadīth mentioned, that he had granted it for the duration of the life of the owner of the house, then when he died, the residence would have been nullified and there would have been no need to value it or consider it in relation to one-third of the estate. We have clarified what indicates that:

(401) 6 - As for what Al-Ḥusayn ibn Saʻīd narrated from Yūsuf ibn ʻAqīl from Muḥammad ibn Qays from Abī Jaʻfar (peace be upon him) that Amīr al-Mu’minīn (peace be upon him) ruled regarding the ʻumrī (life grant) that it is permissible for the one to whom it is granted. Whoever grants something for life, it belongs to his heirs when he dies.

This does not contradict what we presented, because his statement, "it belongs to his heirs when he dies," means the one who made the ʻumrī, not the one to whom it was made. And Abdullah ibn Sinan said: We asked Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) about a man who gives a gift, is he allowed to take it back if he wishes or not? He said: "Gifts are permissible to relatives and to those who are rewarded for their gifts. He may take it back in other cases if he wishes."

(415) 9 - What Ahmad ibn Muhammad narrated from Uthman ibn Isa from Sama'ah, who said: I asked him about a man who gives charity to a close friend, is it permissible for him to take it back? I asked Abu 'Abd Allah (peace be upon him) about a man who acknowledges a debt to an heir while he is ill. He said:

"She had money that we only see with you, so swear to us that you have nothing of it." So, does he swear to them? He said to them: If the woman was ma'mūnah (trustworthy) in your eyes, then swear to them. لان الخبر الأول إنما تضمن إذا كان الشئ قائما بعينه رد على صاحبه ولا يحاصه الغرماء، والثاني ليس فيه إلا أنه ترك ألف درهم وعليه دين وسلف وغير ذلك فقال:
يقسم بينهم بالحصص ولا تنافي بين الخبرين على أن الذي يجب أن يعول عليه ما أوردناه في كتاب الديون من أنه إنما يجب أن يرد المتاع بعينه على صاحبه إذا خلف الميت. ما يقضي به دين الباقين من غير ذلك فأما إذا لم يخلف غير ذلك المتاع بعينه فصاحبه أسوة للغرماء الباقين يقسم بينهم بالسواء.
72 - باب ان من أوصى إليه بشئ لأقوام فلم يعطهم إياه فهلك المال كان عليه الضمان (444) 1 - الحسين بن سعيد عن فضالة عن أبان عن سليمان بن عبد الله الهاشمي عن أبيه قال: سألت أبا جعفر عليه السلام عن رجل أوصى إلى رجل فأعطاه ألف درهم زكاة ماله فذهبت من الوصي؟ قال: هو ضامن ولا يرجع على الورثة.
(445) 2 - عنه عن فضالة عن أبان عن رجل قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن رجل أوصى إلى رجل أن عليه دينا فقال: يقضي الرجل ما عليه من دينه ويقسم ما بقي بين الورثة، قلت: فسرق ما كان أوصى به من الدين ممن يؤخذ الدين أمن الورثة أو من الوصي؟ قال: لا يؤخذ من الورثة ولكن الوصي ضامن لها.
قال محمد بن الحسن: الوجه في هذين الخبرين إنه إنما يكون الوصي ضامنا للمال إذا تمكن من إيصاله إلى مستحقه فلم يفعل فهلك، فأما إذا لم يتمكن من ذلك ثم هلك من غير تفريط من جهته لم يكن عليه شئ، والذي يدل على ذلك:
(446) 3 - ما رواه الحسين بن سعيد عن ابن أبي عمير عن حماد عن الحلبي عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام أنه قال في رجل توفي فأوصى إلى رجل وعلى الرجل المتوفى

Because the first report only included that if something exists and is identifiable, it should be returned to its owner, and the creditors should not share it. The second report only states that he left a thousand dirhams and had debts, loans, etc. He said: It is divided among them proportionally. There is no contradiction between the two reports, considering that what should be relied upon is what we mentioned in the book of debts: that the goods should only be returned to their owner if the deceased left enough to pay off the debts of the remaining creditors from other assets. However, if he did not leave anything other than the goods themselves, then its owner is equal to the remaining creditors and it is divided among them equally.

(445) 2 - From him from Fadala from Aban from a man said: I asked Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, about a man who entrusted a man that he had a debt, he said: The man pays off what he owes from his debt and divides what remains among the heirs. 73 - Chapter on if someone entrusts (the will) to two people, is it permissible for each of them to independently take half of the money or not? (448) 1 - Muhammad ibn al-Hasan al-Saffar said: I wrote to Abi Muhammad, peace be upon him, regarding a man who entrusted (the will) to two men, is it permissible for one of them to independently take half of the estate and the other the other half? He (peace be upon him) wrote: It is not appropriate for them to go against the deceased and to act according to what he ordered them, God willing.
(449) 2 - Ali ibn al-Hasan, from his two brothers Muhammad and Ahmad, from their father, from Dawud ibn Abi Yazid, from Burayd ibn Muawiyah, who said: A man died and entrusted (the will) to me and to another, or to two men, and one of them said: Take half of what he left and give me half of what he left. But the other refused. So they asked Aba Abdillah, peace be upon him, about that, and he said: That is for him.
Muhammad ibn al-Hasan said: Abu Jaafar Muhammad ibn Ali ibn al-Hussein ibn Babawayh, may God have mercy on him, mentioned that he does not act upon this report, nor does he issue fatwas based on it. Rather, he acts upon the first report, assuming that they are contradictory, but the matter is not as he assumed, because his saying, peace be upon him, "That is for him" does not explicitly mean that it is for the applicant who requested the exclusivity of half of the estate. And it is not impossible that what is meant by his saying "That is for him" means the one who refused his companion's submission to what he wants, so the summary of the statement is that he has the right to refuse him and not answer his request, and in this way, there is no contradiction between them at all.

(450) 3 - As for what was narrated by Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn ‘Īsā from Muḥammad ibn ‘Īsā from Ṣafwān ibn Yaḥyā who said:
I asked Abū al-Ḥasan (peace be upon him) about a man who was owed money by another man who died and had two guardians. Is it permissible to pay one of the guardians without the other? He said: It is not proper unless the ruler has divided the money between them, placing half in the hand of this one and half in the hand of that one, or they both gather by order of the ruler.
The interpretation of this report is that if the just ruler divided it, it is permissible, but if the ruler is unjust, it is permissible to dispose of it as a form of taqiyya (precautionary dissimulation).
74 - Chapter: It is not permissible to bequeath more than one-third (451) 1 - ‘Alī ibn Ibrāhīm from his father from Ibn Abī ‘Umayr from Hishām ibn Sālim and Ḥafṣ ibn al-Bakhtarī and Ḥammād ibn ‘Uthmān from Abū ‘Abdillāh (peace be upon him) who said: Whoever bequeaths a third has harmed the heirs, and bequeathing a fifth or a quarter is better than bequeathing a third, and whoever bequeaths a third has not left much.
(452) 2 - Al-Ḥusayn ibn Sa‘īd from Ḥammād ibn ‘Īsā from Shu‘ayb ibn Ya‘qūb who said: I asked Abū ‘Abdillāh (peace be upon him) about a man who dies, from whose wealth is the woman’s inheritance? He said: He has a third of his wealth, and so does the woman.
(453) 3 - ‘Alī ibn Ibrāhīm from his father from Ibn Abī Najrān from ‘Āṣim ibn Ḥumayd from Muḥammad ibn Qays from Abū Ja‘far (peace be upon him) who said: Amīr al-Mu’minīn (peace be upon him) used to say: That I bequeath a fifth of my wealth is more beloved to me than that I bequeath a quarter, and that I bequeath a quarter is more beloved to me than that I bequeath a third. And whoever bequeaths a third has not left much and has reached the limit. And Amīr al-Mu’minīn (peace be upon him) ruled concerning a man who died and bequeathed all or most of his wealth, saying: The bequest should be returned to what is reasonable.

(455) 5 - عنه عن أحمد بن الحسن عن أبيه عن علي بن عقبة عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام في رجل حضره الموت فاعتق مملوكا له ليس له غيره فأبى الورثة أن يجيزوا ذلك كيف القضا فيه؟ قال ما يعتق منه إلا ثلثه وسائر ذلك " للورثة (1) " والورثة أحق بذلك ولهم ما بقي.
(456) 6 - عنه عن عمرو بن عثمان عن الحسن بن محبوب عن الحسن بن صالح الثوري عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام في رجل أوصى لمملوك له بثلث ماله قال فقال: يقوم المملوك ثم ينظر ما بلغ ثلث الميت فإن كان الثلث أقل من قيمة العبد بقدر ربع القيمة استسعي العبد في ربع قيمته، وإن كان الثلث أكثر من قيمة العبد أعتق العبد ودفع إليه ما يفضل من الثلث بعد القيمة.

ابن جبلة عن سماعة عن أبي بصير عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: قلت له: الرجل له الولد يسعه أن يجعل ماله لقرابته؟ فقال: هو ماله يصنع به ما يشاء إلى أن يأتيه الموت إن لصاحب المال أن يعمل بماله ما شاء ما دام حيا إن شاء وهبه وإن شاء تصدق به وإن شاء تركه إلى إن يأتيه الموت فان أوصى به فليس له إلا الثلث إلا أن الفضل أن لا يضيع من يعوله ولا يضر بورثته.
(463) 13 - الحسن بن محمد بن سماعة عن ابن أبي عمير عن مرازم عن عمار الساباطي عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: الميت أحق بماله ما دام فيه الروح يبين به فإن قال بعدي فليس له إلا الثلث.
والوجه الآخر: في الخبر المتضمن للوصية بأكثر من الثلث أن نحمله على أنه إذا كان بمحضر من الورثة وأجازوه كان ذلك جائزا، يدل على ذلك:
(464) 14 - ما رواه علي بن إبراهيم عن حماد عن حريز عن محمد بن مسلم عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام في رجل أوصى بوصية وورثته شهود فأجازوا ذلك فلما مات الرجل نقضوا الوصية هل لهم أن يردوا ما أقروا به؟ فقال: ليس لهم ذلك، الوصية جائزة عليهم إذا أقروا بها في حياته.
(465) 15 - أبو علي الأشعري عن محمد بن عبد الجبار عن صفوان بن يحيى عن منصور ابن حازم عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام مثله.
(466) 16 - علي بن الحسن بن فضال عن العباس بن عامر عن داود بن الحصين عن أبي أيوب عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال سئل عن رجل أوصى بوصية وورثته شهود فأجازوا ذلك فلما مات الرجل نقضوها ألهم ان يردوا ما قد أقروا به؟ قال:

Ibn Jabala from Simā'a from Abū Baṣīr from Abū 'Abd Allāh (peace be upon him) who said: I said to him: A man has children, can he give his money to his relatives? He said: It is his money, he can do with it as he pleases until death comes to him. Indeed, the owner of the money can do with his money as he wishes as long as he is alive. If he wishes, he can give it as a gift, or if he wishes, he can give it in charity, or if he wishes, he can leave it until death comes to him. But if he bequeaths it, then he is only entitled to a third, unless it is preferable not to neglect those he supports and not harm his heirs.
(463) 13 - Al-Ḥasan ibn Muḥammad ibn Simā'a from Ibn Abī 'Umayr from Murāzim from 'Ammār al-Sābāṭī from Abū 'Abd Allāh (peace be upon him) who said: The deceased has more right to his money as long as the soul is in him, clarifying with it, but if he says [something to take effect] after me, then he is only entitled to a third.
Another interpretation: Regarding the report that includes a bequest of more than a third, we should interpret it as meaning that if it is in the presence of the heirs and they permit it, then that is permissible, which is indicated by:
(464) 14 - What 'Alī ibn Ibrāhīm narrated from Ḥammād from Ḥarīz from Muḥammad ibn Muslim from Abū 'Abd Allāh (peace be upon him) regarding a man who made a will and his heirs were witnesses and they permitted it, but when the man died, they nullified the will. Do they have the right to reject what they acknowledged? He said: They do not have that right. The will is permissible for them if they acknowledged it during his lifetime.
(465) 15 - Abū 'Alī al-Ash'arī from Muḥammad ibn 'Abd al-Jabbār from Ṣafwān ibn Yaḥyā from Manṣūr ibn Ḥāzim from Abū 'Abd Allāh (peace be upon him) similarly.

(469) 19 - علي بن الحسن بن فضال عن أخيه أحمد بن الحسن عن عمرو بن سعيد قال أوصى أخو رومي بن عمر أن جميع ماله لأبي جعفر عليه السلام قال عمرو:
فأخبرني رومي أنه وضع الوصية بين يدي أبي جعفر عليه السلام فقال: هذا ما أوصى لك أخي فجعلت اقرأ عليه فيقول لي قف ويقول أحمل كذا ووهبت لك كذا حتى أتيت على الوصية فنظرت فإذا إنما أخذ الثلث، قال فقلت له: أمرتني أن أحمل إليك الثلث ووهبت إلي الثلثين فقال: نعم قلت أبيعه وأحمله إليك؟ قال: لا على الميسور منك من غلتك لا تبع شيئا.
(470) 20 - محمد بن يحيى عن عبد الله بن جعفر عن الحسين بن مالك قال: كتبت إلى أبي الحسن عليه السلام اعلم سيدي ان ابن أخ لي توفي وأوصى لسيدي بضيعة وأوصى أن يدفع كل ما في داره حتى الأوتاد تباع ويحمل الثمن إلى سيدي وأوصى بحج وأوصى للفقراء من أهل بيته وأوصى لعمته وأخته بمال، قال فنظرت فإذا ما أوصى به أكثر من الثلث فلعله يقارب النصف مما ترك وخلف ابنا لثلاث سنين وترك دينا فرأي سيدي؟ فوقع عليه السلام: يقتصر من وصيته على الثلث من ماله ويقسم ذلك بين من أوصى له على قدر سهامهم إن شاء الله.
(471) 21 - محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن الحسين بن مالك قال: كتبت إليه رجل مات وترك كل شئ له في حياته لك ولم يكن له ولد ثم إنه أصاب بعد ذلك ولدا ومبلغ ماله ثلاثة آلاف درهم وقد بعثت إليك بألف درهم فإن رأيت جعلني الله فداك أن تعلمني فيه رأيك لاعمل به؟ فكتب اطلق لهم.

(469) 19 - Ali bin al-Hasan bin Faddal from his brother Ahmad bin al-Hasan from ‘Amr bin Sa’eed, who said: The brother of Rumi bin ‘Umar bequeathed all of his wealth to Abi Ja’far (peace be upon him). ‘Amr said:

These reports are in agreement with the previous reports and with what we included as additions in our larger book, so acting upon them is more appropriate. Even if the previous reports were free from contradiction, they could be interpreted in several ways: First, the owner of the wealth was instructed to deliver the money to them (peace be upon them) not as a will, but as a gift to them during their lifetime. If this was the case, it would be permissible, as we explained in the earlier reports. Only what was designated as a will should be limited to one-third. Second, the heirs of these individuals may have disagreed with them in belief, so it was permissible to deny them that and deliver the money to the Imam. Third, this was only permissible because he made the will before he had an heir, and then he had an heir, but his will was not invalidated, and his will remained in effect for everything, and it was not necessary to invalidate it. Indicating this is:
(472) 22 - What Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Isa narrated: Muhammad ibn Ishaq al-Mutayyib wrote to him:
And after, may God Almighty prolong your life, we inform you, O our master, that we are in doubt regarding this will that Muhammad ibn Yahya Durayyab made. That is because the followers of our master and his righteous servants mentioned that it is not permissible for the deceased to bequeath more than one-third of his wealth if he has a child. Muhammad ibn Yahya bequeathed more than half of what he left behind. If our master and master, may God prolong his life, sees fit to dispel the obscurity of this darkness that we have complained about and explain it to us, we will act upon it, God willing? He replied:
If he bequeathed it before he had a child, his will is permissible.
This confirms what we presented earlier, that it is not permissible to bequeath more than one-third:

Muhammad bin Muslim said: I asked Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) about making a will for an heir, and he said: It is permissible.
(477) 2 - From him, from Ibn Abi Umair, from Abi al-Muza, from Abi Basir who said: I said to Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him): Is it permissible for the heir to make a will? He said: Yes.
(478) 3 - Ahmad bin Muhammad from Ibn Mahbub from Abi Walad al-Hannat who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) about a deceased person who bequeaths something to his daughter? He said: It is permissible.
(479) 4 - As for what Al-Hussein bin Saeed narrated from al-Qasim bin Suleiman who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) about a man who confessed to owing a debt to an heir during his illness, and he said: A will to an heir or a confession is not permissible.
The interpretation of this report is that we should consider it as a form of taqiyya (dissimulation), because it agrees with the doctrines of all the common people, and what we have adopted conforms to the apparent meaning of the Qur’an. God Almighty said: “Prescribed for you, when death approaches [any] one of you if he leaves wealth [is that he should make] a bequest for parents and relatives, according to what is acceptable - a duty upon the righteous." 76 - Chapter on a Father’s Gift to His Child During Illness (480) 1 - Al-Hussein bin Saeed from Al-Nadr from Al-Qasim from Jarrah Al-Madaini who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) about a father’s gift to his child clarifying it, he said: If he gives it to him when he is healthy, it is permissible.
(481) 2 - As for what Al-Hussein bin Saeed narrated from Al-Hasan from Zur'ah from Sama'ah who said: I asked him about a father’s gift to his child, and he said: As for when he is healthy, it is his to do with as he pleases, but during illness, it is not valid.

اجعله في سبيل الله فقال أبو عبد الله عليه السلام اجعل في سبيل الله كما أمرت قلت:
مرني كيف اجعله؟ قال: اجعله كما أمرتك إن الله تعالى يقول: " فمن بدله بعد ما سمعه فإنما إثمه على الذين يبدلونه إن الله سميع عليم " أرأيتك لو أمرتك أن تعطيه يهوديا كنت تعطيه نصرانيا؟ قال: فمكثت بعد ذلك ثلاث سنين ثم دخلت عليه فقلت له:
مثل الذي قلت أول مرة فسكت هنيئة ثم قال: هاتها فقلت: من اعطيها؟ قال: عيسى شلقان (1).

So they said to her: So we give it to the family of Muhammad, peace be upon them? She said: Spend it in the way of Allah. So Abu Abdillah, peace be upon him, said: Spend it in the way of Allah as you ordered. I said: Order me how to spend it? He said: Spend it as I ordered you. Indeed, Allah the Almighty says: "Then whoever changes it after hearing it - then the sin is only upon those who change it. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing." Do you see if I ordered you to give it to a Jew, would you give it to a Christian? So I said: Who do I give it to? He said: Isa Shalqan (1).
So it does not contradict the first two reports because it is not impossible that he ordered him to hand that over to Isa to perform Hajj with it on behalf of the one who ordered that or hand it over to someone else, for he is more knowledgeable about the place of entitlement than others.

في رجل أوصى عند موته بمال لذوي قرابته وأعتق مملوكا فكان جميع ما أوصى به يزيد على الثلث كيف يصنع؟ قال يبدأ بالعتق فينفذه.
فلا ينافي الخبرين لأنه إذا بدأ بالعتق وما بقي صرفه في الصدقة فقد جعل طائفة من المال في العتق وطائفة في الصدقة حسب ما تضمنه الخبران الأولان، وليس في الخبرين الأولين أنه يجعل ذلك سواء، ولا يمتنع أيضا أن يجعل مال الصدقة والعتق سواء ويبدأ في انفاذه بالعتق ثم بالصدقة، ويجوز أيضا أن يكون إنما تجب البدأة بالعتق لأنه يستغرق أكثر المال وما يبقى بعد ذلك يجعل للصدقة وكل ذلك محتمل على ما قلناه.
83 - باب من خلف جارية حبلى ومملوكين فشهدا على الميت انه الولد منه (511) 1 - البزوفري عن أحمد بن إدريس عن أحمد بن محمد عن ابن أبي عمير عن حماد عن الحلبي عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام في رجل مات وترك جارية ومملوكين فورثهما أخ له فاعتق العبدين وولدت الجارية غلاما قال: فشهدا بعد العتق أن مولاهما كان أشهدهما أنه كان ينزل على الجارية وان الحبل منه قال: تجوز شهادتهما ويردان (1) عبدين كما كانا.
(512) 2 - فأما ما رواه أحمد بن محمد عن ابن فضال عن داود بن فرقد قال: سئل أبو عبد الله عليه السلام عن رجل كان في سفر ومعه جارية له وغلامان مملوكان فقال لهما أنتما حران لوجه الله واشهدا أن ما في بطن جاريتي هذه مني فولدت غلاما فلما قدموا على الورثة أنكروا ذلك واسترقوهم ثم إن الغلامين عتقا بعد ذلك فشهدا بعد ما أعتقا أن مولاهما الأول اشهدهما ان ما في بطن جاريته منه قال: تجوز شهادتهما للغلام

Regarding a man who, upon his death, bequeathed wealth to his relatives and freed a slave, and the total of what he bequeathed exceeded one-third, what should be done? He said: "Begin with the manumission, thus execute it."

This does not contradict the two narrations because if he begins with the manumission and spends what remains on charity, then he has allocated a portion of the wealth to manumission and a portion to charity, as the first two narrations imply. The first two narrations do not state that they must be equal. It is also not impossible for the wealth allocated to charity and manumission to be equal. He begins implementing it with manumission, then with charity. It is also permissible that the obligation to begin with manumission is only because it consumes most of the wealth, and what remains after that is allocated to charity. All of that is possible as we have stated.

83 - Chapter on Someone Who Leaves Behind a Pregnant Slave-Girl and Two Slaves, and They Testify that the Child is His (511) 1 - Al-Bazufari from Ahmad ibn Idris from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ibn Abi Umayr from Hammad from al-Halabi from Abi Abdullah, peace be upon him, regarding a man who died and left behind a slave-girl and two slaves, and his brother inherited them, and he freed the two slaves, and the slave-girl gave birth to a boy. He said: "If they testify after the manumission that their master had made them witness that he used to have intercourse with the slave-girl and that the pregnancy was from him, he said: Their testimony is permissible, and the two slaves are returned as they were."

(512) 2 - As for what Ahmad ibn Muhammad narrated from Ibn Faddal from Dawud ibn Farqad, who said: Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, was asked about a man who was on a journey with a slave-girl and two slave boys. He said to them: "You are both free for the sake of Allah, and bear witness that what is in the womb of this slave-girl is from me." Then she gave birth to a boy. When they came to the heirs, they denied that and enslaved them. Then the two slave boys were freed after that, and they testified after they were freed that their first master had made them witness that what was in the womb of his slave-girl was from him. He said: "Their testimony for the boy is permissible."

87 - باب انه يجوز أن يوصى إلى امرأة (522) 1 - أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن محمد بن عيسى بن عبيد عن أخيه جعفر بن عيسى عن علي بن يقطين قال: سألت أبا الحسن عليه السلام عن رجل أوصى إلى امرأة وشرك في الوصية معها صبيا فقال: يجوز ذلك وتمضي المرأة الوصية ولا تنتظر بلوغ الصبي فإذا بلغ الصبي فليس له ألا بأن يرضى إلا بما كان من تبديل أو تغيير فان له فان له أن يرد إلى ما أوصى به الميت.
(523) 2 - فأما ما رواه السكوني عن جعفر بن محمد عن أبيه عن آبائه عليهم السلام قال:
قال أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام: المرأة لا يوصى إليها لان الله تعالى يقول: " ولا تؤتوا السفهاء أموالكم ".
فالوجه في هذا الخبر أحد شيئين، أحدهما: أن نحمله على ضرب من الكراهية دون الحظر، والثاني أن نحمله على التقية لأنه مذهب كثير من العامة وإنما قلنا ذلك لاجماع علماء الطائفة على الفتوى بما تضمنه الخبر الأول.

This does not contradict the first hadith, as this ruling is limited to this specific case and cannot be extended to others. It is not permissible to exclude a man from his rightful inheritance based on common lineage due to the will and command of the testator. No attention should be paid to the testator's statement; rather, the man should inherit according to what he is entitled to by lineage, and his share should not be reduced under any circumstances.
87 - Chapter on the permissibility of entrusting a will to a woman (522)
1 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Isa from Muhammad ibn Isa ibn Ubayd from his brother Ja'far ibn Isa from Ali ibn Yaqtin, who said: I asked Abu al-Hasan (peace be upon him) about a man who entrusted his will to a woman and included a young boy in the will with her. He said: "That is permissible. The woman carries out the will and does not wait for the boy to reach puberty. When the boy reaches puberty, he has no recourse except to agree, except for any substitution or alteration; in that case, he has the right to revert to what the deceased had willed."
(523) 2 - As for what al-Sakuni narrated from Ja'far ibn Muhammad from his father from his forefathers (peace be upon them), who said:
Amir al-Mu'minin (peace be upon him) said: "A woman should not be entrusted with a will, because God Almighty says: 'And do not entrust the fools with your property.'"
The explanation for this hadith is one of two things: either we interpret it as a form of disapproval rather than prohibition, or we interpret it as taqiyya (dissimulation), because it is the opinion of many of the common people (Sunnis). We say this because of the consensus of the scholars of the sect on issuing fatwas (religious edicts) based on what the first hadith contained.

Book of Inheritance 88 - Chapter on how the mother's share is reduced from one-third to one-sixth by four sisters.

(524) 1 - Ali ibn Ibrahim from his father from Ibn Abi Umair from Sa'd ibn Abi Khalaf from Abi al-Abbas from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) who said: "If the deceased leaves behind two brothers, they are considered brothers with the deceased and they reduce the mother's share. But if there is only one brother, he does not reduce the mother's share." And he said: "If there are four sisters, they reduce the mother's share from one-third because they are considered like two brothers. But if there are three, they do not reduce the mother's share."

(525) 2 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Muhsin ibn Ahmad from Aban ibn Uthman from Fadl Abi al-Abbas who said: "I asked Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) about parents and two sisters from the same father and mother. Do they reduce the mother's share from one-third?" He said: "No." I said: "What about three?" He said: "No." I said: "What about four?" He said: "Yes."

(526) 3 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ibn Faddal from Abdullah ibn Bukair from Fadl Abi al-Abbas al-Baqbaq from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) who said: "Nothing reduces the mother's share from one-third except two brothers or four sisters from the same father and mother or from the same father only."

(527) 4 - Abu Ali al-Ash'ari from Muhammad ibn Abd al-Jabbar from Safwan ibn Yahya from Abu Ayyub al-Khazzaz from Muhammad ibn Muslim from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) who said: "Nothing reduces the mother's share from one-third if there is no child except two brothers or four sisters."

(528) 5 - As for what al-Hasan ibn Muhammad ibn Sama'a narrated from Ibn Ribat from Ibn Muskan from Abi al-Abbas al-Baqbaq from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) regarding parents and two sisters, he said: "The mother gets one-third with the sisters, for Allah Almighty said: 'If he has brothers...' and He did not say: 'If he has sisters.'"

The first thing in this narration is that its narrator, Abu al-Abbas al-Buqbaq, has narrated in accordance with the earlier narrations. Therefore, one should act upon his narration that conforms to the narration of others and not act upon his narration in which he is alone. Then, even if it were free from that, it would be interpreted in one of two ways: The first is that it is interpreted as referring to sisters from the mother's side because these are not excluded at all, no matter how many they are, whether male or female. It is permissible that what is meant by it is when there are not four, but three, for they are not excluded even if they are from the father's side. The other interpretation: that we interpret the narration as a form of taqiyya (precautionary dissimulation), because that is the doctrine of all the common people (the Sunnis), and none of them agrees with us on it.

And he said regarding a wife and parents, he said: "For the wife is a quarter, for the mother is a third, and what remains is for the father."
(530) 2 - Ali ibn Ibrahim from his father from Ibn Abi Umayr from Jamil ibn Darraj from Ismail ibn Abd al-Rahman al-Ju'fi from Abi Ja'far (peace be upon him) regarding a husband and parents, he said: "For the husband is half, for the mother is a third, and what remains is for the father."

'Ubayd ibn Zurara from Abi Basir from Abi Ja'far, peace be upon him, who said: "How many people have a right they do not know about?" I said: "What is that, may Allah set you right?" He said: "The owners of the wall had a treasure beneath it that they did not know about. But it was not gold or silver." I said: "What was it?" He said: "It was knowledge." I said: "Which of them is more entitled to it?" He said: "The elder. That is what we say."
Muhammad ibn al-Hasan said: These narrations are general in that the eldest son gets his clothes, his saddle, and his clothing. We should specify this to the clothes on his skin. As for other clothes, he and the heirs are equal in them. This is indicated by:
(544) 7 - What Ali ibn al-Hasan ibn Faddal narrated from Ahmad ibn al-Hasan from his father from Hammad ibn 'Isa from Shu'ayb al-'Aqraqufi, who said: "I asked Abu 'Abdillah, peace be upon him, about a man who dies, what of his household goods remains?" He said: "The sword." And he said: "When the deceased dies, his son gets the sword, the saddle, and the clothes, the clothes on his skin."
91 - Chapter: That brothers and sisters of different lineages do not inherit anything with the parents or with one of them. (545) 1 - Ali ibn Ibrahim from his father from Ibn Abi Umayr and Muhammad ibn 'Isa from Yunus, all from 'Umar ibn Udhayna from Zurara from Abi 'Abdillah and Abi Ja'far, peace be upon them, that they said: "If a man dies and leaves his mother, brothers and sisters from both father and mother, brothers and sisters from the father, and brothers and sisters from the mother, and the father is not alive, then they do not inherit and do not prevent her [from inheriting] because he did not leave *kalala* (no direct descendants)."

عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: في امرأة توفيت وتركت زوجها وأمها وأباها واخوتها قال: هي من ستة أسهم للزوج النصف ثلاثة أسهم وللأب الثلث سهمان وللأم السدس سهم وليس للاخوة والأخوات شئ نقصوا الام وزادوا الأب لان الله تعالى قال: " فإن كان له اخوة فلأمه السدس ".
(547) 3 - عنه عن علي بن مسكين عن مشمعل بن سعد عن أبي بصير عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام في رجل ترك أبويه واخوته قال: للأم السدس وللأب خمسة أسهم وسقط الاخوة وهي من ستة أسهم.
(548) 4 - علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن ابن أبي عمير ومحمد بن عيسى عن يونس جميعا عن عمر ابن أذينة عن بكير عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام أنه قال: ليس للاخوة من الأب والام ولا للاخوة من الأب مع الأب شئ ولا مع الام شئ.
(549) 5 - فاما ما رواه أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن الحسن بن علي الخراز وعلي بن الحكم عن مثنى الحناط عن زرارة بن أعين عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال قلت: امرأة تركت زوجها وأمها واخوتها لامها واخوة لامها وأبيها فقال: لزوجها النصف ولأمها السدس وللاخوة من الام الثلث وسقط الاخوة من الأب والام.
(550) 6 - وما رواه أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن الحسن بن علي الخزاز وعلي بن الحكم عن مثنى الحناط عن زرارة بن أعين عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: قلت له: امرأة تركت أمها وأخواتها لأبيها وأمها وإخوة لأم وأخوات لأب قال: لأخواتها لأبيها وأمها الثلثان ولأمها السدس ولاخوتها من أمها السدس.
(551) 7 - عنه عن الحسن بن علي الخزاز وعلي بن الحكم عن مثنى الحناط عن زرارة
footnote: * - ٥٤٧ - التهذيب ج ٢ ص ٤١٤. - ٥٤٨ - التهذيب ج ٢ ص ٤١٦ في ذيل حديث طويل الكافي ج ٢ ص ٢٦٤ في ذيل حديث طويل الفقيه ص ٤٢٦. - ٥٤٩ - ٥٥٠ - ٥٥١ - التهذيب ج ٢ ص ٤٢٤.

From Abi Abdillah (peace be upon him) who said: Regarding a woman who died and left behind her husband, her mother, her father, and her siblings, he said: "It is from six shares. For the husband is half, three shares, and for the father is one-third, two shares, and for the mother is one-sixth, one share. And the brothers and sisters get nothing. They reduced the mother's share and increased the father's because Allah Almighty said: 'But if he has brothers [or sisters], for his mother is one-sixth.'"
(547) 3 - From him, from Ali bin Miskeen, from Mishma'il bin Sa'd, from Abi Basir, from Abi Abdillah (peace be upon him) regarding a man who left behind his parents and his siblings, he said: "For the mother is one-sixth, and for the father is five shares, and the siblings get nothing. It is from six shares."
(548) 4 - Ali bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abi Umair and Muhammad bin Isa, from Yunus all together, from Umar ibn Udhaynah, from Bukair, from Abi Ja'far (peace be upon him) that he said: "The brothers from the father and the mother, nor the brothers from the father with the father, nor with the mother get anything."
(549) 5 - As for what was narrated by Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Isa, from Al-Hasan bin Ali Al-Khazzaz and Ali bin Al-Hakam, from Muthanna Al-Hannat, from Zurarah bin A'yun, from Abi Abdillah (peace be upon him) who said: I said: "A woman left behind her husband, her mother, her siblings from her mother, and siblings from her mother and her father," he said: "For her husband is half, and for her mother is one-sixth, and for the siblings from the mother is one-third, and the siblings from the father and the mother get nothing."
(550) 6 - And what was narrated by Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Isa, from Al-Hasan bin Ali Al-Khazzaz and Ali bin Al-Hakam, from Muthanna Al-Hannat, from Zurarah bin A'yun, from Abi Abdillah (peace be upon him) who said: I said to him: "A woman left behind her mother, her sisters from her father and her mother, and brothers from her mother, and sisters from her father," he said: "For her sisters from her father and her mother is two-thirds, and for her mother is one-sixth, and for her brothers from her mother is one-sixth."
(551) 7 - From him, from Al-Hasan bin Ali Al-Khazzaz and Ali bin Al-Hakam, from Muthanna Al-Hannat, from Zurarah

text:
ابن أعين عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: قلت امرأة تركت أمها وأخواتها لأبيها وأمها وإخوة لأم وأخوات لأب قال: لأخواتها لامها وأبيها الثلثان ولأمها السدس ولاخوتها من أمها السدس.
فهذه الأخبار الثلاثة الأصل فيها زرارة والطريق إليها واحد ومع ذلك فقد أجمعت الطائفة على العمل بخلافها لأنه لا خلاف بينهم أن مع الام لا يرث أحد من الاخوة والأخوات من أي جهة كانوا، فالوجه في هذه الأخبار أن نحملها على ضرب من التقية، ويجوز أن نقول فيها وجها من التأويل وهو انها (1) وردت الرخصة في جواز الاخذ منهم على ما يعتقدونه كما يأخذونه منا وإنما نحرم الاخذ بها لمن يعتقد بطلانها والذي يدل على هذه الرخصة:
(552) 8 - ما رواه علي بن الحسن بن فضال عن جعفر بن محمد بن حكيم عن جميل بن دراج عن عبد الله بن محرز عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: قلت له: رجل ترك ابنته وأخته لأبيه وأمه قال: المال كله لابنته وليس للأخت من الأب والام شئ فقلت:
انا قد احتجنا إلى هذا والرجل الميت من هؤلاء الناس وأخته مؤمنة قال: فخذ لها النصف خذوا منهم كما يأخذون منكم في سنتهم وقضائهم وأحكامهم، قال: فذكرت ذلك لزرارة فقال: إن على ما جاء به ابن محرز لنورا خذهم بحقك في أحكامهم وسنتهم وقضائهم كما يأخذون منكم فيه.
(553) 9 - عنه عن أيوب بن نوح قال: كتبت إلى أبي الحسن عليه السلام أسأله هل نأخذ في أحكام المخالفين ما يأخذون منا في أحكامهم أم لا؟ فكتب يجوز لكم ذلك إن كان مذهبكم فيه التقية منهم والمداراة.

T Text:

Ibn A‘yān from Abū ‘Abd Allāh (peace be upon him) who said: A woman left behind her mother, sisters from her father and mother, brothers from her mother, and sisters from her father. He said: For her sisters from her mother and father, two-thirds, for her mother one-sixth, and for her brothers from her mother, one-sixth.

The origin of these three narrations is Zurarah, and the path to them is one. However, the group has unanimously agreed to act contrary to them, because there is no disagreement among them that with the mother, none of the brothers and sisters inherit, from whatever side they may be. The explanation for these narrations is that we interpret them as a form of taqiyyah (dissimulation), and it is permissible for us to say a form of interpretation about them, which is that (1) they were narrated as a permission to take from them according to what they believe, just as they take from us, and we only forbid taking according to them for those who believe in their falsehood. What indicates this permission is:

(552) 8 - What ‘Alī ibn al-Ḥasan ibn Faḍḍāl narrated from Ja‘far ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥakīm from Jamīl ibn Darrāj from ‘Abd Allāh ibn Muḥriz from Abū ‘Abd Allāh (peace be upon him) who said: I said to him: A man left behind his daughter and his sister from his father and mother. He said: All the money is for his daughter, and the sister from the father and mother gets nothing. I said:

We need this, and the dead man is from these people, and his sister is a believer. He said: Then take half for her. Take from them as they take from you in their sunnah (practice), their judgments, and their rulings. He said: So I mentioned that to Zurarah, and he said: Indeed, what Ibn Muḥriz brought is a light. Take from them with your right in their rulings, their sunnah (practice), and their judgments, just as they take from you in it.

(553) 9 - From him, from Ayyūb ibn Nūḥ who said: I wrote to Abū al-Ḥasan (peace be upon him) asking him whether we take in the rulings of the مخالفين (opponents) what they take from us in their rulings or not? So he wrote: It is permissible for you to do that if your doctrine in it is taqiyyah (dissimulation) from them and conciliation.

text:
قال: سألت أبا جعفر عن امرأة ماتت وتركت زوجها لا وارث لها غيره قال: إذا لم يكن غيره فله المال والمرأة لها الربع وما بقي فللامام.
(565) 2 - الحسن بن محمد بن سماعة عن محمد بن الحسن بن زياد العطار عن محمد بن نعيم الصحاف قال: مات محمد بن أبي عمير وأوصى إلي وترك امرأة ولم يترك وارثا غيرها فكتبت إلى عبد صالح عليه السلام فكتب إلي بخطه: للمرأة الربع وأحمل الباقي إلينا.
(566) 3 - أحمد بن محمد عن علي بن مهزيار قال: كتب محمد بن حمزة العلوي إلى أبي جعفر الثاني عليه السلام مولى لك أوصى إلي بمائة درهم وكنت أسمعه يقول كل شئ لي فهو لمولاي فمات وتركها ولم يأمر فيها بشئ وله امرأتان أما الواحدة فلا اعرف لها موضعا الساعة والأخرى بقم ما الذي تأمرني في هذه المائة درهم؟ فكتب إلي انظر أن تدفع هذه الدراهم إلى زوجتي الرجل وحقهما من ذلك الثمن إن كان له ولد فإن لم يكن له ولد فالربع وتصدق بالباقي على من تعرف أن له إليه حاجة إن شاء الله.
(567) 4 - سهل بن زياد عن علي بن أسباط عن خلف بن حماد عن موسى بن بكر عن محمد بن مروان عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام في زوج مات وترك امرأة قال: لها الربع ويدفع الباقي إلى الامام.
(568) 5 - فأما ما رواه أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن محمد بن أبي عمير عن ابن مسكان عن أبي بصير عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: قلت: له رجل مات وترك امرأته قال: المال لها، قال: قلت: المرأة ماتت وتركت زوجها قال: المال له.
فلا ينافي الاخبار الأولة لأنه يحتمل وجهين، أحدهما: أن نحمله على ما ذكره

He said: I asked Abu Ja'far (Imam al-Baqir, peace be upon him) about a woman who died and left her husband, and he had no other heir besides him. He said: If there is no one else, then he gets the money, and the woman gets a quarter, and the remainder goes to the Imam.
(565) 2 - Al-Hasan ibn Muhammad ibn Sama'ah from Muhammad ibn al-Hasan ibn Ziyad al-'Attar from Muhammad ibn Nu'aym al-Sahhaf who said: Muhammad ibn Abi 'Umair died and entrusted me with his will, and he left a wife and did not leave an heir other than her. So I wrote to 'Abd Salih (Imam Musa al-Kazim or Imam al-Rida, peace be upon them) and he wrote to me in his handwriting: The woman gets a quarter, and send the remainder to us.
(566) 3 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ali ibn Mahziyar who said: Muhammad ibn Hamza al-'Alawi wrote to Abu Ja'far al-Thani (Imam al-Jawad, peace be upon him): A client of yours bequeathed one hundred dirhams to me, and I used to hear him say, "Everything I have belongs to my master." Then he died and left it without giving any instructions regarding it, and he has two wives. As for one, I do not know her location at the moment, and the other is in Qom. What do you instruct me to do with these one hundred dirhams? He wrote to me: See to it that you give these dirhams to the man's two wives, and their right to that is an eighth if he had a child, and if he had no child, then a quarter, and give the remainder as charity to whomever you know is in need of it, God willing.
(567) 4 - Sahl ibn Ziyad from Ali ibn Asbat from Khalaf ibn Hammad from Musa ibn Bakr from Muhammad ibn Marwan from Abi Ja'far (Imam al-Baqir, peace be upon him) regarding a husband who died and left a wife: He said: She gets a quarter, and the remainder is given to the Imam.
(568) 5 - As for what Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn 'Isa narrated from Muhammad ibn Abi 'Umair from Ibn Muskan from Abi Basir from Abi 'Abd Allah (Imam al-Sadiq, peace be upon him) who said: I said to him: A man died and left his wife. He said: The money is hers. He said: I said: A woman died and left her husband. He said: The money is his.
This does not contradict the earlier reports because it can be interpreted in two ways, one of which is that we interpret it as what he mentioned
