أبو جعفر محمد بن علي بن الحسين بن بابويه رحمه الله فإنه قال: هذا الخبر يختص حال الغيبة لان لها الربع إذا كان هناك امام ظاهر يأخذ الباقي فإذا لم يكن ظاهرا كان الباقي لها، والوجه الآخر: أن نحمله على أنها إذا كانت قريبة له فإنها تأخذ الربع بالتسمية والباقي بالقرابة، يدل على ذلك:
(569) 6 - ما رواه أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن البرقي عن محمد بن القاسم عن الفضل ابن يسار البصري قال: سألت أبا الحسن عليه السلام عن رجل مات وترك امرأة قرابة ليس له قرابة غيرها قال: يدفع المال كله إليها.
94 - باب ان المرأة لا ترث من العقار والدور والأرضين شيئا من تربة الأرض ولها نصيبها من قيمة الطوب والخشب والبنيان (570) 1 - علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن ابن أبي عمير عن ابن أذينة عن زرارة وبكير وفضيل وبريد ومحمد بن مسلم عن أبي جعفر وأبي عبد الله عليهما السلام منهم من رواه عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام، ومنهم من رواه عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام، ومنهم من رواه عن أحدهما عليه السلام ان المرأة لا ترث من تركة زوجها من تربة دار وأرض إلا أن يقوم الطوب (1) والخشب قيمة فتعطى ربعها أو ثمنها إن كانت من قيمة الطوب والجذوع والخشب.
(571) 2 - أحمد بن محمد عن الحسن بن محبوب عن علي بن رئاب عن زرارة عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام إن المرأة لا ترث مما ترك زوجها من القرى والدور والسلاح والدواب شيئا وترث من المال والفرش والثياب ومتاع البيت مما ترك ويقوم النقض (2) والأبواب والجذوع والقصب فتعطى حقها منه.
footnote:

Abu Ja'far Muhammad ibn Ali ibn al-Husayn ibn Babawayh, may Allah have mercy on him, said: This narration pertains specifically to the state of occultation (ghayba), because she (the wife) receives a quarter if there is a visible Imam who takes the rest. If he is not visible, then the rest is for her. Another interpretation is: that we construe it to mean that if she is a relative of his, then she takes the quarter by designation, and the remainder by kinship. Supporting this is:
(569) 6 - What Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Isa narrated from al-Barqi from Muhammad ibn al-Qasim from al-Fadl ibn Yasar al-Basri who said: I asked Abu al-Hasan (peace be upon him) about a man who died and left behind a female relative as his wife, and has no other relatives besides her. He said: The entire wealth is given to her.
94 - Chapter: That a woman does not inherit from real estate, houses, and lands anything from the soil of the land, but she has her share from the value of bricks, wood, and construction. (570) 1 - Ali ibn Ibrahim from his father from Ibn Abi Umayr from Ibn Udhaynah from Zurarah and Bukayr and Fudayl and Burayd and Muhammad ibn Muslim from Abi Ja'far and Abi Abd Allah (peace be upon them), some of them narrated it from Abi Ja'far (peace be upon him), and some of them narrated it from Abi Abd Allah (peace be upon him), and some of them narrated it from one of them (peace be upon them), that a woman does not inherit from her husband's estate from the soil of a house or land, except that the bricks (1) and wood are valued, so she is given a quarter or an eighth of it, if it is from the value of the bricks, trunks, and wood.
(571) 2 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad from al-Hasan ibn Mahbub from Ali ibn Ri'ab from Zurarah from Abi Ja'far (peace be upon him) that a woman does not inherit from what her husband left behind of villages, houses, weapons, and animals, but she inherits from the money, furnishings, clothes, and household items that he left behind, and the dismantling (2), doors, trunks, and reeds are valued, and she is given her right from it.

(572) 3 - يونس بن عبد الرحمن عن محمد بن حمران عن زرارة ومحمد بن مسلم عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام قال: النساء لا يرثن من الأرض ولا من العقار شيئا.
(573) 4 - سهل بن زياد عن علي بن الحكم عن العلا عن محمد بن مسلم قال: قال أبو عبد الله عليه السلام: ترث المرأة الطوب ولا ترث من الرباع شيئا، قال: قلت: كيف ترث من الفرع ولا ترث من الرباع شيئا؟ فقال: لي ليس لها منهم حسب ترث به وإنما هي دخيل عليهم فترث من الفروع ولا ترث من الأصل ولا يدخل عليهم داخل بسببها.
(574) 5 - الحسين بن محمد عن معلى بن محمد عن الحسن بن علي عن حماد بن عثمان عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: إنما جعل للمرأة قيمة الخشب والطوب لئلا يتزوجن فتدخل عليهم من يفسد مواريثهم.
(575) 6 - علي بن الحسن بن فضال عن معاوية بن حكيم عن علي بن الحسن بن رباط عن مثنى عن يزيد الصايغ قال: سمعت أبا جعفر عليه السلام يقول إن النساء لا يرثن من رباع الأرض شيئا ولكن لهن قيمة الطوب والخشب قال: قلت له إن: الناس لا يأخذون بهذا فقال: إذا ولينا ضربناهم بالسوط فان انتهوا وإلا ضر بناهم بالسيف.
(576) 7 - الحسن بن محمد بن سماعة عن جعفر عن مثنى عن عبد الملك بن أعين عن أحدهما عليهما السلام قال: ليس للنساء من الدور والعقار شئ.
(577) 8 - سهل بن زياد عن علي بن الحكم عن أبان الأحمر قال لا أعلم إلا عن ميسرة بياع الزطي (1) عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: سألته عن النساء مالهن من الميراث

(572) 3 - Yunus ibn Abd al-Rahman from Muhammad ibn Humran from Zurarah and Muhammad ibn Muslim from Abi Ja'far (peace be upon him) who said: Women do not inherit anything from the land or real estate.
(573) 4 - Sahl ibn Ziyad from Ali ibn al-Hakam from al-'Ala from Muhammad ibn Muslim who said: Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) said: A woman inherits the bricks, but does not inherit anything from the estates. He said: I said: How does she inherit from the branches and not inherit from the estates? So he said to me: She does not have any lineage through them by which she inherits, but she is an outsider to them, so she inherits from the branches and does not inherit from the origin, and no outsider enters upon them because of her.
(574) 5 - Al-Husayn ibn Muhammad from Mu'alla ibn Muhammad from al-Hasan ibn Ali from Hammad ibn Uthman from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) who said: Indeed, what was made for the woman is the value of the wood and bricks, lest they marry and bring upon them someone who corrupts their inheritances.
(575) 6 - Ali ibn al-Hasan ibn Faddal from Muawiyah ibn Hakim from Ali ibn al-Hasan ibn Ribat from Muthanna from Yazid al-Sayigh who said: I heard Abu Ja'far (peace be upon him) say: Indeed, women do not inherit anything from the estates of the land, but they have the value of the bricks and wood. He said: I said to him: People do not take this. He said: If we are in power, we will strike them with the whip, and if they desist, otherwise we will strike them with the sword.
(576) 7 - Al-Hasan ibn Muhammad ibn Sama'ah from Ja'far from Muthanna from Abd al-Malik ibn A'yan from one of the two (peace be upon them) who said: Women have nothing from houses and real estate.
(577) 8 - Sahl ibn Ziyad from Ali ibn al-Hakam from Aban al-Ahmar who said: I only know from Maysarah, the seller of al-Zutt (1), from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) who said: I asked him about women, what do they have of the inheritance?

قال: لهن قيمة الطوب والبناء والخشب والقصب فأما الأرضون والعقار فلا ميراث لهن فيه، قال: قلت: فالثياب؟ قال: الثياب لهن، قال: قلت: كيف صار ذا ولهذه الثمن والربع مسمى؟ قال: لأن المرأة ليس لها نسب ترث به وإنما هي دخيل عليهم وإنما صار هذا كذا لئلا تتزوج المرأة فيجئ زوجها أو ولد من قوم آخرين فيزاحموا قوما في عقارهم.
(578) 9 - الحسن بن محمد بن سماعة عن الحسن بن محبوب عن علي بن رئاب عن زرارة عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام، وخطاب بن أبي محمد الهمداني عن طربال بن رجا عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام أن المرأة لا ترث مما ترك زوجها من القري والدور والسلاح والدواب شيئا وترث من المال والرقيق والثياب ومتاع البيت مما ترك ويقوم النقض والجذوع والقصب فتعطى حقها منه.
(579) 10 - عنه عن محمد بن زياد عن محمد بن حمران عن محمد بن مسلم وزرارة عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام أن النساء لا يرثن من الدور ولا من الضياع شيئا إلا أن يكون أحدث بناء فيرثن ذلك البناء، وكتب الرضا عليه السلام إلى محمد بن سنان فيما كتب من جواب مسائله: علة المرأة انها لا ترث من العقار شيئا الا قيمة الطوب والنقض لان العقار لا يمكن تغييره وقلبه والمرأة يجوز أن ينقطع ما بينها وبينه من العصمة ويجوز تغييرها وتبديلها وليس الولد والوالد كذلك، لأنه لا يمكن التفصي بينهما والمرأة يمكن الاستبدال بها فما يجوز أن يجئ ويذهب كان ميراثه فيما يجوز تغييره وتبديله إذا أشبههما وكان الثابت المقيم على حاله كمن كان مثله في الثبات والقيام.
(580) 11 - علي بن الحسن بن فضال عن أحمد بن الحسن عن أبيه عن عبد الله

He said: "They have the value of the bricks, the construction, the wood, and the reeds. As for the lands and real estate, they have no inheritance in them." He said: I said: "What about the clothes?" He said: "The clothes are for them." He said: I said: "How did that become so, while this one has a specified price and a quarter share?" He said: "Because a woman has no lineage through which she inherits; rather, she is an outsider to them. This is so lest a woman marry, and her husband or child from another people come and compete with a people in their real estate."
(578) 9 - Al-Hasan ibn Muhammad ibn Sama'ah from al-Hasan ibn Mahbub from Ali ibn Ri'ab from Zurarah from Abi Ja'far (peace be upon him), and Khattab ibn Abi Muhammad al-Hamadani from Tirbal ibn Raja from Abi Ja'far (peace be upon him) that a woman does not inherit anything from what her husband leaves behind of villages, houses, weapons, and animals, but she inherits from the money, slaves, clothes, and household items that he leaves behind. The demolition material, trunks, and reeds are evaluated, and she is given her right from them.
(579) 10 - From him, from Muhammad ibn Ziyad from Muhammad ibn Humran from Muhammad ibn Muslim and Zurarah from Abi Ja'far (peace be upon him) that women do not inherit from houses or estates anything, unless there is new construction, in which case they inherit that construction. Al-Ridha (peace be upon him) wrote to Muhammad ibn Sinan in what he wrote in response to his questions: "The reason for the woman not inheriting anything from the real estate except the value of the bricks and demolition material is that the real estate cannot be changed or altered. It is permissible for the bond of marriage between her and him to be severed, and it is permissible for her to be changed and replaced. The child and the parent are not like that, because it is not possible to separate between them. A woman can be replaced, so whatever can come and go, its inheritance is in what can be changed and altered if it resembles them, and what is fixed and permanent remains as it is, like one who is like it in steadfastness and permanence."
(580) 11 - Ali ibn al-Hasan ibn Faddal from Ahmad ibn al-Hasan from his father from Abdullah

text:
فلا تنافي الاخبار الأولة من وجهين، أحدهما: أن نحمله على التقية لان جميع من خالفنا يخالف في هذه المسألة وليس يوافقنا عليها أحد من العامة، وما يجرى هذا المجرى يجوز التقية فيه، والوجه الآخر: أن لهن ميراثهن من كل شئ ترك ما عدا تربة الأرض من القرايا والأرضين والرباع والمنازل فنخص الخبر بالاخبار المتقدمة، وكان أبو جعفر محمد بن علي بن الحسين بن بابويه رحمه الله يتأول هذا الخبر ويقول ليس لهن شئ مع عدم الأولاد من هذه الأشياء المذكورة فإذا كان هناك ولد فإنها ترث من كل شئ، واستدل على ذلك:
(582) 13 - بما رواه محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن يعقوب بن يزيد عن ابن أبي عمير عن ابن أذينة في النساء إذا كان لهن ولد أعطين من الرباع.

وقال زرارة: وهذا مما لم يؤخذ علي فيه قد سمعته من ابنه ومن أبيه قبل ذلك وليس

Therefore, there is no contradiction between the earlier reports for two reasons. The first is that we interpret them as taqiyya (dissimulation), because all who oppose us disagree on this issue, and none of the common people agree with us on it. Anything that follows this pattern allows for taqiyya. The second reason is that they inherit their share of everything left behind, except the soil of the land, such as villages, lands, estates, and houses. We specify the report with the earlier reports. Abu Ja'far Muhammad ibn Ali ibn al-Hussein ibn Babawayh, may God have mercy on him, interpreted this report and said that they have nothing with the absence of children from these things mentioned. If there is a child, then she inherits from everything. He argued for this:
(582) 13 - As narrated by Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya from Yaqub ibn Yazid from Ibn Abi Umayr from Ibn Udhaynah regarding women, if they have a child, they are given from the estates.
95 - Chapter on the inheritance of the grandfather with the kalala (relatives other than direct ascendants or descendants) of the father (583) 1 - Ali ibn Ibrahim from his father from Ibn Abi Umayr from Umar ibn Udhaynah from Zurara, Bukayr, al-Fudayl, Muhammad, and Burayd from one of them, peace be upon them, who said: "The grandfather with the brothers from the father becomes like one of the brothers, however many they may be." I said: "A man left his brother from his father and mother and his grandfather for him, or I said: his grandfather and his brother from his father, or his brother from his father and mother." He said: "The money is between them, even if they are two brothers or a hundred thousand, for him is like the share of one of the brothers." I said: "A man left his grandfather and his sister." He said: "For the male is the share of two females, and if they are two sisters, then half is for the grandfather and the other half is for the two sisters. And if there are more than that, then according to this calculation. If he leaves brothers or sisters from the father and mother or from the father and a grandfather, then the grandfather is one of the brothers, so the money is between them, for the male is the share of two females."
Zurara said: "This is something that was not taken against me in it, I heard it from his son and from his father before that, and it is not"

Salim ibn Abi al-Ja'd reported that Ali, peace be upon him, gave the grandmother all the wealth.

This does not contradict the preceding reports, because the meaning of this report is that he gave her the wealth because there was no one else who was more entitled than her, or equal to her, to the inheritance. 96 - Chapter on the Inheritance of the Grandfather with the Uterine Kalala (600) 1 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ibn Mahbub from Ibn Sinan, who said: I asked Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, about a man who left a brother from his mother, and did not leave (1) any other heir. 97 - Chapter: Regarding When Either or Both Parents are Present, the Paternal Grandfather and Grandmother Do Not Inherit.

(608) 1 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub, from al-Hasan ibn Salih, who said: I asked Abu Abdillah, peace be upon him, about a woman who was married but her husband had not consummated the marriage. She died and left behind her mother, two brothers from her father and mother, her maternal grandfather, and her husband. He said: "The husband is given half, and the mother is given the remainder. The grandfather is not given anything because his daughter has prevented him from inheriting. And the brothers are not given anything."

(609) 2 - Ibn Mahbub, from Ali ibn Abi Hamza, from Abu Basir, who said: I asked Abu Jaafar, peace be upon him, about a man who died and left behind his father, his paternal uncle, and his paternal grandfather. He said: "The father excludes the grandfather. The inheritance is for the father, and the uncle and grandfather get nothing."

(610) 3 - Muhammad ibn Yahya al-Attar, from Abdullah ibn Jaafar, who said: I wrote to Abu Muhammad, peace be upon him, that a woman died and left behind her husband, her parents, and her grandfather or grandmother. How should her inheritance be divided?
He, peace be upon him, wrote back: "The husband gets half, and what remains is for the parents."

(611) 4 - As for what al-Hasan ibn Muhammad ibn Sama'a narrated from al-Hasan ibn Mahbub, from Ali ibn Ri'ab, from Fudayl ibn Yasar, from Abu Abdillah, peace be upon him, about a man who died and left behind his mother, his wife, his sister, and his grandfather, he said: "The mother gets one-third, the wife gets one-quarter, and what remains is divided between the grandfather and the sister: the grandfather gets two shares, and the sister gets one share."

(612) 5 - From him, from Ibn Mahbub, from Hammad, from Abu Basir, who said: I asked Abu Jaafar, peace be upon him, about a man who died and left behind his mother, his wife, and two sisters, and his grandfather. He said: "The mother gets one-sixth, the wife gets one-quarter, and half of what remains goes to the grandfather and half to the two sisters."

These two reports are rejected (matrūkān) by the consensus (ijmāʿ) of the Righteous Group (al-Tāʾifa al-Muḥiqqah), because no one inherits when the parents are present, nor when

He said: The grandfather gets one-sixth and the rest is for the daughters of the daughter.
Ali ibn al-Hasan ibn Faddal mentioned that the *'isaba* (group) agreed to abandon acting upon this narration, and I saw some of the later scholars adhering to what the narration implies, and this is a mistake, because it has been established that the offspring of the offspring takes the place of the offspring. So the daughter of the daughter takes the place of the daughter if there is no offspring, and with the presence of offspring, neither of the parents deserves anything from what is taken from the share of the one-sixth. So the grandfather is given on the basis of sustenance, but rather it is taken from their obligatory share of the one-sixth if they are the heirs without the children, and that indicates what Ibn Faddal said.

(643) 4 - As for what Muhammad ibn al-Hasan al-Saffar narrated, from Muhammad ibn Isa, from Ibrahim ibn Muhammad who said:
Muhammad ibn Yahya al-Khurasani wrote: A man bequeathed to me and did not leave behind except paternal cousins (male and female) and a paternal uncle and two paternal aunts. To whom does the inheritance belong? He wrote: The *'asaba* and the paternal cousins are the heirs.
The explanation of this report is one of two things: one of them is that we interpret it as *taqiyya* (dissimulation), because it agrees with the opinion of the *'ammah* (Sunnis), because it is established in the doctrine of the sect that the closer relative is more entitled to the inheritance than the more distant one. If that is established, then the two paternal aunts are more entitled because they are closer than the paternal cousin and the paternal uncle. The other explanation is that this ruling is specific to when the paternal cousins are from the same father and mother, and the paternal uncle or aunt is from the father only. In that case, the money belongs to the paternal cousin from the father and mother, not to the uncle from the father only, by consensus of the rightly guided group, without apparent consideration. And he said: "Regarding a paternal cousin and a maternal uncle," he said, "The money goes to the maternal uncle." 102 - Chapter: That none of the freed slaves inherit with the presence of one of the relatives by blood ties.
(646) 1 - Al-Hasan bin Muhammad bin Sama'a from Muhammad bin Ziyad from Abdullah bin Sinan from Abi Abdullah, peace be upon him, who said: "Ali, peace be upon him, would not take from the inheritance of a freed slave of his if he had a relative, even if they were not among those who receive the prescribed inheritance." أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: مات مولى لحمزة بن عبد المطلب عليه السلام فدفع رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله ميراثه إلى بنت حمزة، قال أبو علي الحسن بن محمد بن سماعة هذه الرواية تدل على أنه لم يكن للمولى بنت كما تروي العامة وأن المرأة أيضا ترث الولاء ليس كما يروون العامة.
قال محمد بن الحسن: هذا الخبر يدل على أن البنت ترث من ميراث المولى كما يرث الابن وهو الأظهر من مذهب أصحابنا، وذلك خلاف ما قدمناه في كتاب العتق من أن الميراث لأولاد المولى للذكور منهم دون الإناث، فإن لم يكونوا ذكورا كان للعصبة، لان في هذا الخبر مع وجود العصبة اعطى المال البنت، والوجه في الاخبار الأولة التي ذكرناها هناك: أن نحملها على التقية لأنها موافقة للعامة، هذا إذا كان المعتق رجلا، فاما إذا كان المعتق امرأة فلا خلاف بين الطائفة ان الميراث للعصبة دون الأولاد ذكورا كانوا أو إناثا، وقد دللنا عليه فيما تقدم.

Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, said: A freed slave of Hamza ibn Abd al-Muttalib, peace be upon him, died, and the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, gave his inheritance to Hamza's daughter. Abu Ali al-Hasan ibn Muhammad ibn Sama'a said: This narration indicates that the freed slave did not have a daughter, as the common people narrate, and that the woman also inherits the wala' (right of patronage), contrary to what the common people narrate.
Muhammad ibn al-Hasan said: This report indicates that the daughter inherits from the inheritance of the freed slave just as the son inherits, and it is the more apparent view of our companions. This is contrary to what we presented in the book of 'Itq (manumission) that the inheritance goes to the children of the freed slave, to the males among them and not the females. If they are not males, then it is for the 'asaba (male relatives on the father's side), because in this report, with the presence of the 'asaba, the money was given to the daughter. The interpretation of the earlier reports that we mentioned there is that we should understand them as taqiyya (dissimulation), because they are in agreement with the common people. This is if the manumitter was a man. But if the manumitter was a woman, then there is no disagreement among the sect that the inheritance is for the 'asaba and not the children, whether male or female, and we have demonstrated this in what preceded.
(653) 8 - As for what Ali ibn al-Hasan ibn Faddal narrated from Muhammad al-Katib from Abdullah ibn Ali ibn Umar ibn Yazid from his uncle Muhammad ibn Umar that he wrote to Abu Jaafar, peace be upon him, asking him about a man who died and was a freed slave of a man, and his master had died before him, and the freed slave had a son and daughters, so he asked him about the inheritance of the freed slave, and he said: It is for the men and not the women.
The interpretation of this report also is that we should understand it as taqiyya (dissimulation), on the basis that they have narrated from Amir al-Mu'minin, peace be upon him, the like of what we said about the freed slave of Hamza.
(654) 9 - Al-Fadl ibn Shadhan narrated, saying that it was narrated from Hanan, who said: I was sitting with Suwaid ibn Ghafla when a man came to him and asked him about a daughter, a wife, and mawali (freed slaves). He said: I will inform you about the judgment of Ali, peace be upon him, regarding this: He gave the daughter half, the wife one-eighth, and what remained was returned to the daughter, and he did not give anything to the mawali.

104 - باب ان ولد الملاعنة يرث أخواله ويرثونه إذا لم يكن هناك أم ولا اخوة من أم ولا جد لها (675) 1 - الحسن بن محمد بن سماعة عن جعفر بن محمد بن سماعة وعلي بن خالد العاقولي عن كرام عن ابن مسكان عن أبي بصير عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام في رجل لاعن امرأته وانتفى من ولدها واكذب نفسه بعد الملاعنة وزعم أن ولدها له هل يرد إليه؟ قال:
نعم يرد إليه ولا أدع (1) ولده ليس له ميراث وأما المرأة فلا تحل له أبدا، فسألته من يرث الولد؟ قال: أخواله، قلت أرأيت إن ماتت أمه فورثها الغلام ثم مات الغلام من يرثه؟ قال: عصبة أمه، قلت له: فهو يرث أخواله؟ قال: نعم.

The Commander of the Believers (peace be upon him) said: If a man dies and his wife is a slave woman whom he bought with his money, then he emancipates her and then she inherits from him.

The explanation of this narration is that the Commander of the Believers (peace be upon him) was doing this as a voluntary act, because we have clarified that if the wife is free and there is no heir, she does not get more than a quarter, and the rest goes to the Imam. And if the one entitled to the money is the Commander of the Believers (peace be upon him), then it is permissible for him to buy the wife, emancipate her, and give her the rest of the money as a donation and recommendation, without his action being obligatory and binding.

104 - Chapter: The child of a woman who has undergone *mulā'anah* inherits from his maternal uncles, and they inherit from him if there is no mother, maternal siblings, or maternal grandfather for him. (675) 1 - Al-Hasan ibn Muhammad ibn Samā'ah from Ja'far ibn Muhammad ibn Samā'ah and 'Ali ibn Khālid al-'Āqūlī from Kirām from Ibn Miskān from Abū Baṣīr from Abū 'Abdillāh (peace be upon him) regarding a man who performed *mulā'anah* with his wife and disavowed her child, then recanted after the *mulā'anah* and claimed that the child was his. وقال: زوجها بعد ذلك الولد ولدي وأكذب نفسه قال: اما المرأة فلا ترجع إليه ولكن أرد إليه (2) الولد ولا ادع ولده ليس له ميراث فإن لم يدعه أبوه فإن أخواله يرثونه ولا يرثهم فإن دعاه أحد بابن الزانية جلد الحد.
(681) 7 - محمد بن الحسن الصفار عن أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن محمد بن سنان عن العلا عن الفضيل قال: سألته عن رجل افترى على امرأته قال: يلاعنها وان أبى ان يلاعنها جلد الحد وردت إليه امرأته، وإن لاعنها فرق بينهما ولم تحل له إلى يوم القيامة فإن كان انتفى من ولدها ألحق بأخواله يرثونه ولا يرثهم إلا أنه يرث أمه وإن سماه أحد ولد زنا جلد الذي يسميه الحد.
(682) 8 - علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن حماد عن الحلبي عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: إذا قذف الرجل امرأته يلاعنها ثم يفرق بينهما فلا تحل له أبدا، فإن أقر على نفسه قبل الملاعنة جلد حدا وهي امرأته، قال: وسألته عن الملاعنة التي يرميها زوجها وينتفي من ولدها ويلاعنها ويفارقها ثم يقول بعد ذلك الولد ولدي ويكذب نفسه؟
فقال: أما المرأة فلا ترجع إليه أبدا، وأما الولد فاني أرده إليه إذا أعاده ولا ادع ولده وليس له ميراث ويرث الابن الأب ولا يرث الأب الابن يكون ميراثه لأخواله، فإن لم يدعه أبوه فان أخواله يرثونه ولا يرثهم فان دعاه أحد ابن الزانية جلد الحد.
فلا تنافي بين هذه الأخبار والاخبار الأولة، لان ثبوت الموارثة بينهم إنما يكون إذا أقربه الوالد بعد انقضاء الملاعنة، لان عند ذلك تبعد التهمة من المرأة ويقوى صحة نسبه فيرث أخواله ويرثونه، والاخبار الأخيرة متناولة لمن لم يقر والده به بعد الملاعنة فإن عند ذلك التهمة باقية فلا تثبت الموارثة بل يرثونه ولا يرثهم لأنه

He said: And I asked him about the one who performs *li'an*, whose husband accuses her and disavows her child, and performs *li'an* with her and separates from her, then says after that, "The child is mine," and contradicts himself?
He said: As for the woman, she never returns to him. As for the child, I return him to him if he reclaims him. And I do not deny his child, but he has no inheritance. The son inherits from the father, but the father does not inherit from the son; his inheritance goes to his maternal uncles. If his father does not claim him, then his maternal uncles inherit him, and he does not inherit them. If someone calls him the son of a fornicatress, he is flogged with the prescribed punishment.
There is no contradiction between these reports and the earlier reports because the establishment of inheritance between them only occurs if the father acknowledges him after the completion of the *li'an*, because at that time the accusation against the woman is removed, and the validity of his lineage is strengthened, so his maternal uncles inherit him, and he inherits them. If that is the case, then his crime is against the Imam, and the mother should take one-third and the remainder belongs to the Imam. text:
في شرع الاسلام إنما تثبت بالأنساب الصحيحة، وإذا كان النسب الصحيح ليس بموجود ههنا ينبغي أن يرتفع التوارث.
(690) 6 - وأما ما رواه محمد بن الحسن الصفار عن الحسن بن موسى الخشاب عن غياث ابن كلوب عن إسحاق بن عمار عن جعفر عن أبيه أن عليا عليه السلام كان يقول:
ولد الزنا وابن الملاعنة ترثه أمه واخوته لامه أو عصبتها.
فالوجه في هذه الرواية أن نقول إنه يجوز أن يكون الراوي سمع هذا الحكم في ولد الملاعنة فظن أن حكم ولد الزنا حكمه فرواه على ظنه دون السماع.
(691) 7 - فأما ما رواه علي بن إبراهيم عن محمد بن عيسى عن يونس عن ابن ثابت عن حنان عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: سألته عن رجل فجر بنصرانية فولدت منه غلاما فأقر به ثم مات ولم يترك ولدا غيره أيرثه؟ قال: نعم.
(692) 8 - وما رواه الحسن بن محبوب عن حنان بن سدير قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن رجل مسلم فجر بامرأة يهودية فأولدها ثم مات ولم يدع وارثا؟ قال:
فقال: يسلم لولده الميراث من اليهودية، قلت: فنصراني فجر بامرأة مسلمة فأولدها غلاما ثم مات النصراني وترك مالا لمن يكون ميراثه؟ قال: يكون ميراثه لابنه من المسلمة.
فهاتان الروايتان الأصل فيهما حنان بن سدير ولم يروهما غيره، فالوجه فيهما ما تضمنته الرواية الأولى وهو انه إذا كان الرجل مقرا بالولد وألحقه به مسلما كان أو نصرانيا فإنه يلزمه نسبه ويرثه وإن كان مولودا من الفجور لاعترافه به، فاما إذا لم يعترف به وعلم أنه ولد زنا فلا ميراث له على حال.

In Islamic law, lineage is only established through correct ancestral lines. If a correct ancestral line does not exist here, inheritance should be suspended.
(690) 6 - As for what Muhammad ibn al-Hasan al-Saffar narrated from al-Hasan ibn Musa al-Khashab from Ghiyath ibn Kallub from Ishaq ibn Ammar from Ja'far from his father, that Ali (peace be upon him) used to say:
The child of fornication and the child of *mulāʿana* (mutual cursing) are inherited from by his mother and his maternal siblings or her *ʿaṣaba* (male relatives on the father's side).
The explanation for this narration is that the narrator may have heard this ruling regarding the child of *mulāʿana* (mutual cursing) and assumed that the ruling for the child of fornication is the same, so he narrated it based on his assumption without actually hearing it.
(691) 7 - As for what Ali ibn Ibrahim narrated from Muhammad ibn Isa from Yunus from Ibn Thabit from Hanan from Abi Abdillah (peace be upon him) who said: I asked him about a man who committed fornication with a Christian woman and she bore him a boy, and he acknowledged him, then he died and left no other child besides him. Does he inherit from him? He said: Yes.
(692) 8 - And what al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Hanan ibn Sudayr, who said: I asked Abu Abdillah (peace be upon him) about a Muslim man who committed fornication with a Jewish woman and she bore him a child, then he died and left no heir? He said:
The inheritance from the Jewish woman is given to his child. I said: What if a Christian committed fornication with a Muslim woman and she bore him a boy, then the Christian died and left wealth, to whom does his inheritance belong? He said: His inheritance belongs to his son from the Muslim woman.
In these two narrations, the primary source is Hanan ibn Sudayr, and no one else narrated them. The explanation for them is what the first narration implies, which is that if a man acknowledges the child and attributes him to himself, whether he is Muslim or Christian, then the child's lineage is binding on him and he inherits from him, even if he was born from fornication, because of his acknowledgment. But if he does not acknowledge him and it is known that he is a child of fornication, then he has no inheritance under any circumstances.

106 - Chapter: Regarding one who acknowledges a child and then disowns him, no attention is paid to his denial.

(693) 1 - Al-Hussein bin Saeed from Ibn Abi Umair from Hammad from al-Halabi from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) who said: "Any man who has intercourse with a slave girl of a people unlawfully, then buys her and claims her child, he shall not inherit anything from him, for the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family) said: 'The child is for the bed, and for the adulterer is the stone.' The child of fornication does not inherit except a man who claims the son of his slave girl. So any man who acknowledges his child and then disowns him, that is not for him, and there is no honor for him. His child is affiliated to him if he is from his wife or his slave girl."

(694) 2 - From him, from al-Qasim bin Muhammad from Ali bin Abi Hamza from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) similar to it.

(695) 3 - From him, from Ibn Abi Umair from Hammad from al-Halabi from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) who said: "If a man acknowledges a child and then disowns him, he is bound by it."

These narrations do not contradict each other.

(696) 4 - What Muhammad bin Ahmad bin Yahya narrated from Muhammad bin Isa from Safwan bin Yahya from Ibn Miskan from Yazid bin Khalil who said: "I asked Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) about a man who disowned his son's crime and inheritance before the Sultan, then the son died and left wealth, who inherits it?" He said: "His inheritance is for the closest people to his father."

(697) 5 - And Safwan bin Yahya narrated from Ibn Miskan from Abi Basir who said: "I asked him about the *makhlu'* (1) whose father disowned him before the Sultan and from his inheritance and his crime, to whom does his inheritance go?" He said: "Ali (peace be upon him) said: It is for the closest people to him."

Because in these two reports, it is not mentioned that he disowned the child after he had acknowledged him, because if it included

107 - باب ميراث الحميل (698) 1 - الحسن بن محبوب عن عبد الرحمن بن الحجاج قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن الحميل فقال: وأي شئ الحميل؟ فقلت: المرأة تسبي من أرضها ومعها الولد الصغير فتقول هو ابني والرجل يسبى فيلقاه أخوه فيقول هو أخي ويتعارفان وليس لهما على ذلك بينة إلا قولهما قال فقال: فما يقول من قبلكم؟ قلت لا يورثونه لأنه لم يكن لها على ذلك بينة إنما كانت ولادة في الشرك قال: سبحان الله إذا جاءت بابنها أو بابنتها معها لم تزل مقرة به، وإذا عرف أخاه وكان ذلك في صحة من عقولهما لا يزالان مقرين بذلك ورث بعضهم بعضا.
(699) 2 - أبو علي الأشعري عن محمد بن عبد الجبار عن محمد بن إسماعيل عن علي ابن النعمان عن سعيد الأعرج عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: سألته عن رجلين حميلين جيئ بهما من ارض الشرك فقال: أحدهما لصاحبه أنت أخي فعرفا بذلك ثم أعتقا ومكثا مقرين بالإخاء، ثم إن أحدهما مات قال: الميراث للآخر يصدقان.
(700) 3 - فأما ما رواه علي بن الحسن بن فضال عن محمد بن علي عن الحسن بن محبوب عن طلحة بن زيد عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام عن أبيه عليه السلام قال: لا يرث الحميل إلا ببينة.

Therefore, no attention is paid to its negation. Even if he "acknowledged" before his denial, his inheritance would not be attached to his 'asaba (male relatives on the father's side), because the 'asaba are only confirmed if his lineage from him is proven. But if it is not proven, how can they be confirmed? So, it is not impossible that the meaning in the two reports is that the father, insofar as he disavowed the child's crime and responsibility, is deprived of the inheritance and attachment to his 'asaba, even if his lineage is proven and correct.
107 - Chapter on the Inheritance of al-Ḥamīl (Those of Unknown Lineage)

(698) 1 - Al-Ḥasan ibn Maḥbūb from 'Abd al-Raḥmān ibn al-Ḥajjāj who said: I asked Abu 'Abd Allāh, peace be upon him, about al-ḥamīl, so he said: "And what is al-ḥamīl?" I said: A woman is taken captive from her land, and with her is a small child, and she says, "He is my son." And a man is taken captive, and his brother meets him and says, "He is my brother," and they recognize each other, and they have no proof of that except their words. He said: "What do those before you say?" I said, "They do not allow them to inherit because there is no proof of that, it was only a birth in shirk (polytheism)." He said: "Subḥān Allāh (Glory be to God)! If she comes with her son or her daughter with her, she will always be affirming him. And if he recognizes his brother, and that is in the soundness of their minds, they will always be affirming that, they will inherit from each other."

(699) 2 - Abu 'Ali al-Ash'ari from Muḥammad ibn 'Abd al-Jabbār from Muḥammad ibn Ismā'īl from 'Ali ibn al-Nu'mān from Sa'īd al-A'raj from Abu 'Abd Allāh, peace be upon him, who said: I asked him about two men, ḥamīl, brought from the land of shirk (polytheism). One of them said to his companion, "You are my brother," and they recognized each other by that. Then they were freed and remained affirming the brotherhood. Then one of them died. He said: "The inheritance is for the other, they are believed."

(700) 3 - As for what 'Ali ibn al-Ḥasan ibn Faḍḍāl narrated from Muḥammad ibn 'Ali from al-Ḥasan ibn Maḥbūb from Ṭalḥah ibn Zayd from Abu 'Abd Allāh, peace be upon him, from his father, peace be upon him, who said: "Al-Ḥamīl does not inherit except with proof."

جامعها ربها في قبل طهرها ثم باعها من آخر قبل أن تحيض فجامعها الآخر ولم تحض فجامعها الرجلان في طهر واحد فولدت غلاما فاختلفا فيه فسئلت أم الغلام فقالت:
انهما أتياها في طهر واحد ولا أدري أيهما أبوه فقضى في الغلام أنه يرثهما كليهما ويرثانه سواء.
قال محمد بن الحسن قد بينا فيما تقدم من الكتاب أن الجارية إذا وطئها جماعة في طهر واحد بعد أن تنتقل من الأول إلى الآخر بالبيع فان الولد لاحق بمن عنده الجارية ومتى كانوا شركاء ووطؤها في طهر واحد فان الولد يخرج بالقرعة فمن خرج عليه لحق به وضمن للباقين قيمة نصيبهم، والوجه في هذا الخبر أن نحمله على ضرب من التقية لأنه موافق لبعض مذاهب العامة.
109 - باب ميراث المجوس اختلف أصحابنا في ميراث المجوس إذا تزوج بواحدة من المحرمات في شريعة الاسلام فقال يونس بن عبد الرحمن ومن تبعه من المتأخرين: انه لا يورث إلا من جهة النسب والسبب الذين يجوزان في شريعة الاسلام، فأما ما لا يجوز في شريعة الاسلام فإنه لا يورث منه على كل حال، وقال الفضل بن شاذان وقوم من المتأخرين ممن يتبعوه على قوله: انه يورث من جهة النسب على كل حال وإن كان حاصلا عن سبب لا يجوز في شريعة الاسلام، فاما السبب فلا يورث منه إلا ما يجوز في شريعة الاسلام، والصحيح انه يورث المجوسي من جهة السبب والنسب معا سواءا كانا مما يجوز في شريعة الاسلام أو لا يجوز وهو مذهب جماعة من المتقدمين، والذي يدل على ذلك:
(704) 1 - ما رواه محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن بنان بن محمد عن أبيه عن ابن المغيرة
footnote: * - ٧٠٤ - التهذيب ج ٢ ص ٤٣٦ الفقيه ص 445.

Her Lord had intercourse with her during a time of purity, then sold her to another before she menstruated. The latter had intercourse with her, and she did not menstruate. Then both men had intercourse with her during one period of purity, and she gave birth to a boy. They disputed over him, and the boy's mother was asked. She said: "They both came to me in one period of purity, and I do not know which of them is his father." It was judged that the boy should inherit from both of them, and they should inherit from him equally.
Muhammad ibn al-Hasan said: We have explained in the preceding part of the book that if a group of people have intercourse with a slave girl in one period of purity after she has been transferred from the first to the last by sale, then the child belongs to the one who has the slave girl. And whenever they are partners and have intercourse with her in one period of purity, then the child is determined by lot. Whoever is chosen, the child belongs to him, and he guarantees the value of the others' shares to them. The explanation of this report is that we interpret it as a form of taqiyya (precautionary dissimulation), because it is in accordance with some of the doctrines of the common people (i.e., Sunnis).
109 - Chapter on the Inheritance of the Magians. Our companions differed regarding the inheritance of the Magians if they marry one of the prohibited degrees in Islamic law. Yunus ibn Abd al-Rahman and those who followed him from the later scholars said: He only inherits through kinship and legal causes that are permissible in Islamic law. As for what is not permissible in Islamic law, he does not inherit from it under any circumstances. Al-Fadl ibn Shadhan and a group of later scholars who followed him in his opinion said: He inherits through kinship in all cases, even if it results from a cause that is not permissible in Islamic law. As for the legal cause, he only inherits from what is permissible in Islamic law. The correct view is that the Magian inherits through both legal cause and kinship, whether they are permissible in Islamic law or not, and it is the doctrine of a group of the early scholars. What indicates that is:
(704) 1 - What Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya narrated from Banan ibn Muhammad from his father from Ibn al-Mughira

أما علمت أن ذلك عندهم النكاح.
(705) 2 - وقد روي أيضا أنه قال: عليه السلام أن كل قوم دانوا بدين يلزمهم حكمه وإذا كان المجوس معتقدين صحة ذلك فينبغي أن يكون نكاحهم جائزا، وأيضا لو كان ذلك غير جائز لوجب ألا يجوز أيضا إذا عقدوا على غير المحرمات وجعلوا المهر خمرا أو خنزيرا أو غير ذلك من المحرمات لان ذلك غير جائز في الشرع وقد أجمع أصحابنا على جواز ذلك فعلم بجميع ذلك صحة ما اخترناه.
110 - باب انه يرث المسلم الكافر ولا يرثه الكافر (706) 1 - علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن ابن أبي عمير عن جميل وهشام عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام أنه قال: فيما روى الناس عن رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله أنه قال:

From al-Sakūnī, from Ja'far, from his father, from 'Alī (peace be upon them), that he would allow a Magian to inherit if he married his mother or his daughter, from two perspectives: one, that she is his mother, and the other, that she is his wife.

As for what we mentioned that contradicts this from the sayings of our companions, there is no narration about it from al-Sādiqayn (the two truthful Imams) (peace be upon them), nor is there any evidence for it from the apparent meaning of the Quran. Rather, they only said it for a kind of consideration that is rejected by us by consensus. This is also indicated by the fact that these lineages and causes, even if they are invalid in the law of Islam, are permissible according to them. They permit intimacy through them, establish lineages through them, and differentiate between these lineages and causes and pure fornication. Thus, it is like a contract in the law of Islam. Do you not see that a man cursed a Magian in the presence of Abū 'Abd Allāh (peace be upon him), so he rebuked him and forbade him from doing so, and he said: "He has married his mother." He said: "Did you not know that this is marriage according to them?"

(705) 2 - It has also been narrated that he (peace be upon him) said: "Every people who follow a religion are bound by its rules. If the Magians believe in the validity of that, then their marriage should be permissible." Also, if that were not permissible, then it should also not be permissible if they contract on other than forbidden women and make the dowry wine or pork or other forbidden things, because that is not permissible in the law. But our companions have unanimously agreed on the permissibility of that, so it is known by all of that the correctness of what we have chosen.

110 - Chapter: That the Muslim inherits the disbeliever, but the disbeliever does not inherit him (706) 1 - 'Alī ibn Ibrāhīm, from his father, from Ibn Abī 'Umayr, from Jamīl and Hishām, from Abū 'Abd Allāh (peace be upon him), that he said: Concerning what people narrated from the Messenger of God (peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family), that he said: "Those of two religions do not inherit from each other." He said: "We inherit from them, but they do not inherit from us. Indeed, Islam only increases him in honor in his right."

text:
(715) 10 - عنه عن حنان عن أبي الصيرفي أو بينه وبينه رجل عن عبد الملك بن عمر القبطي عن أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام أنه قال: للنصراني الذي أسلمت زوجته بضعها في يدك ولا ميراث بينكما.
فالوجه في هذه الأخبار أنه لا ميراث بينهما على وجه يرث كل واحد منهما صاحبه كما يتوارث المسلمان، وليس ينافي ذلك أن يرث المسلم الكافر وان لم يرثه الكافر، وقد صرح بذلك أبو عبد الله عليه السلام في رواية جميل وهشام التي ذكرناها، ويزيد ذلك بيانا:
(716) 11 - ما رواه الحسن بن محمد بن سماعة قال: حدثهم عبد الله بن جبلة عن أبي بكر عن عبد الرحمن بن أعين قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن قوله لا يتوارث أهل ملتين فقال: قال: أبو عبد الله عليه السلام: يرثهم ولا يرثونه إن الاسلام لم يزده في ميراثه إلا شدة.
(717) 12 - علي بن الحسن بن فضال عن محمد بن عبد الله بن زرارة عن القاسم ابن عروة عن أبي العباس قال: سمعت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام يقول: لا يتوارث أهل ملتين يرث هذا هذا وهذا هذا إلا إن المسلم يرث الكافر والكافر لا يرث المسلم.
(718) 13 - فأما ما رواه الحسن بن محمد بن سماعة عن جعفر بن سماعة عن أبان عن عبد الرحمن البصري قال قال أبو عبد الله عليه السلام: قضى أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام في نصراني اختارت زوجته الاسلام ودار الهجرة أنها في دار الاسلام لا تخرج منها وأن بضعها في يد زوجها النصراني وانها لا ترثه ولا يرثها.
فالوجه في هذا الخبر أن نحمله على ضرب من التقية لأنه موافق لمذهب العامة وأجمعت الطائفة على خلاف متضمنه.

(715) 10 - From him, from Ḥanān, from Abī al-Ṣayrafī—or between him and him is a man—from ʿAbd al-Malik b. ʿUmar al-Qibṭī, from Amīr al-Muʾminīn (peace be upon him), that he said: "For the Christian whose wife has embraced Islam, her intimacy is in your hand, but there is no inheritance between you two."

The interpretation of these narrations is that there is no inheritance between them in a way that each of them inherits from the other as Muslims inherit from each other. This does not contradict the fact that the Muslim inherits from the disbeliever, even if the disbeliever does not inherit from him. Abū ʿAbd Allāh (peace be upon him) has explicitly stated this in the narration of Jamīl and Hishām that we mentioned, and what further clarifies this is:

(716) 11 - What al-Ḥasan b. Muḥammad b. Samāʿah narrated, saying: ʿAbd Allāh b. Jablah narrated to them, from Abī Bakr, from ʿAbd al-Raḥmān b. Aʿyun, who said: I asked Abū ʿAbd Allāh (peace be upon him) about his saying, "The people of two religions do not inherit from each other." He said: Abū ʿAbd Allāh (peace be upon him) said: "He inherits from them, but they do not inherit from him. Indeed, Islam only increases his inheritance in strength."

(717) 12 - ʿAlī b. al-Ḥasan b. Faḍḍāl, from Muḥammad b. ʿAbd Allāh b. Zurārah, from al-Qāsim b. ʿUrwah, from Abī al-ʿAbbās, who said: I heard Abū ʿAbd Allāh (peace be upon him) say: "The people of two religions do not inherit from each other. This one inherits from this one, and this one inherits from this one, except that the Muslim inherits from the disbeliever, but the disbeliever does not inherit from the Muslim."

(718) 13 - As for what al-Ḥasan b. Muḥammad b. Samāʿah narrated from Jaʿfar b. Samāʿah, from Abān, from ʿAbd al-Raḥmān al-Baṣrī, who said: Abū ʿAbd Allāh (peace be upon him) said: "Amīr al-Muʾminīn (peace be upon him) ruled regarding a Christian whose wife chose Islam and the abode of emigration, that she is in the abode of Islam and does not leave it, and that her intimacy is in the hand of her Christian husband, and that she does not inherit from him, nor does he inherit from her."

The interpretation of this narration is that we should interpret it as a form of taqiyyah (dissimulation), because it is in accordance with the madhhab (doctrine) of the ʿĀmmah (Sunnis), and the [Shi'i] community has unanimously agreed upon what contradicts its content.

فالاستثناء الذي في هذا الخبر من حديث الزوج والزوجة متروك باجماع الطائفة، وبالخبر الذي قدمناه عن أبي ولاد، ويزيد ذلك بيانا:
(720) 15 - ما رواه أحمد بن محمد عن الحسن بن محبوب عن ابن رئاب عن أبي حمزة عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام قال: إن عليا عليه السلام كان يقضي في المواريث فيما أدرك الاسلام من مال مشرك تركه لم يكن قسم قبل الاسلام انه كان يجعل للنساء والرجال حظوظهم منه على كتاب الله وسنة نبيه صلى الله عليه وآله.
(721) 16 - علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن ابن أبي نجران عن عاصم بن حميد عن محمد ابن قيس عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام قال: قضى علي عليه السلام في المواريث ما أدرك الاسلام من مال مشرك لم يقسم، فان للنساء وللرجال حظوظهم منه.
(722) 17 - وأما ما رواه علي بن إبراهيم عن ابن أبي نجران عن غير واحد عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام في يهودي أو نصراني يموت وله أولاد مسلمون وأولاد غير مسلمين فقال: هم على مواريثهم.
فالوجه في هذا الخبر أحد شيئين، أحدهما: التقية لان ذلك مذهب العامة على ما تقدم القول فيه، والثاني: أن يكون معنى قوله هم على مواريثهم أي على ما يستحقونه من الميراث وقد بينا ان المسلمين إذا اجتمعوا مع الكفار كان الميراث للمسلمين دونهم وأوردنا ذلك في كتابنا الكبير، ويزيد ذلك بيانا:

عن حماد بن عثمان، ورواه محمد بن يعقوب عن الحسين بن محمد عن معلى بن محمد عن بعض أصحابه عن حماد بن عثمان عن فضيل بن يسار عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: لا يقتل الرجل بولده ويقتل الولد بوالده إذا قتل والده ولا يرث الرجل الرجل إذا قتله وإن كان خطأ.
فلا ينافي الخبرين الأولين لشيئين، أحدهما: أن نحمله على ضرب من التقية لان في العامة من يقول بذلك ويقول القاتل لا يرث على كل حال عمدا كان أو خطأ، والوجه الآخر: أن نحمله على ما كان يذهب إليه شيخنا رحمه الله في الجمع بين هذه الأخبار من أن القاتل خطأ لا يرث من نفس الدية ويرث مما عداها وهذا وجه قريب، فأما الاخبار التي أوردناها في كتابنا الكبير من أن القاتل لا يرث فينبغي أن نخصها بالخبرين الأولين ونقول القاتل لا يرث إلا إذا كان خطأ ليكون العمل على جميع الروايات ولا يسقط شئ منها.
112 - باب الزوج والزوجة يرث كل واحد منهما من دية صاحبه ما لم يقتل أحدهما الاخر (728) 1 - علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن ابن أبي نجران عن عاصم بن حميد عن محمد ابن قيس عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام قال: المرأة ترث من دية زوجها ويرث من ديتها ما لم يقتل أحدهما صاحبه.
(729) 2 - محمد بن يعقوب عن الحسين بن محمد عن معلى بن محمد عن الحسن بن علي عن أبان بن عثمان عن عبد الله بن يعفور قال: قلت لأبي عبد الله عليه السلام: هل للمرأة من دية زوجها شئ؟ وهل للرجل من دية امرأته شئ؟ قال: نعم ما لم يقتل أحدهما الآخر.

From Ḥammad ibn ‘Uthmān, and Muḥammad ibn Ya’qūb narrated it from al-Ḥusayn ibn Muḥammad from Mu’allā ibn Muḥammad from some of his companions from Ḥammad ibn ‘Uthmān from Fuḍayl ibn Yasār from Abī ‘Abd Allāh (peace be upon him) who said: "A man is not killed for (killing) his son, but a son is killed for (killing) his father if he kills his father. And a man does not inherit from a man if he kills him, even if it was by mistake."

This does not contradict the first two narrations for two reasons: one is that we interpret it as a form of taqiyya (dissimulation), because among the common people there are those who say this and say that the killer does not inherit in any case, whether intentional or unintentional. The other reason is that we interpret it according to what our Shaykh, may Allah have mercy on him, used to reconcile these narrations, which is that the one who kills by mistake does not inherit from the diya (blood money) itself, but inherits from what is other than it. This is a plausible interpretation. As for the narrations that we mentioned in our large book that the killer does not inherit, we should specify them to the first two narrations and say that the killer does not inherit except if it was by mistake, so that the action is based on all the narrations and none of them are dropped.
112 - Chapter: The Husband and Wife, Each Inherits from the Blood Money of the Other, Unless One of Them Kills the Other (728) 1 - ‘Alī ibn Ibrāhīm from his father from Ibn Abī Najrān from ‘Āṣim ibn Ḥumayd from Muḥammad ibn Qays from Abī Ja’far (peace be upon him) who said: "A woman inherits from the blood money of her husband, and he inherits from her blood money, unless one of them kills the other."
(729) 2 - Muḥammad ibn Ya’qūb from al-Ḥusayn ibn Muḥammad from Mu’allā ibn Muḥammad from al-Ḥasan ibn ‘Alī from Abān ibn ‘Uthmān from ‘Abd Allāh ibn Ya’fūr who said: I said to Abī ‘Abd Allāh (peace be upon him): "Does a woman get anything from the blood money of her husband? ابن مسلم عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: سألته عن رجل طلق امرأته واحدة ثم توفي عنها وهي في عدتها قال: ترثه ثم تعتد عدة المتوفي عنها زوجها، وإن ماتت ورثها فان قتل أو قتلت وهي في عدتها ورث كل واحد منهما من دية صاحبه.
(731) 4 - فاما ما رواه محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن إبراهيم بن هاشم عن النوفلي عن السكوني عن جعفر عن أبيه أن عليا عليه السلام كان لا يورث المرأة من دية زوجها ولا يورث الرجل من دية امرأته شيئا، ولا الاخوة من الام من الدية شيئا.
فالوجه في هذا الخبر أحد شيئين، أحدهما: التقية لموافقته لمذهب بعض العامة لأنهم يقولون لا يرث الدية إلا من كان يعقل عنه لو قتل خطأ، والوجه الثاني:
ما قلناه في تأويل الخبر المقدم من أنه لا يرث القاتل خطأ من نفس الدية وإن ورث مما عداه، فنحمل هذا الخبر على أنه ما كان يورثهما من دية كل واحد منهما إذا كانا قاتلين خطأ لئلا يناقض ما تقدم.
113 - باب ميراث من لا وارث له من ذوي الأرحام والموالي (732) 1 - الحسن بن محمد بن سماعة عن الحسين بن هاشم عن ابن مسكان عن الحلبي عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: يسألونك عن الأنفال قال قال: من مات وليس له مولى فماله من الأنفال.
(733) 2 - عنه عن محمد بن زياد عن رفاعة عن أبان بن تغلب قال قال أبو عبد الله عليه السلام: من مات لا مولى له ولا ورثة فهو من أهل هذه الآية (يسئلونك عن الأنفال قل الأنفال لله والرسول).

Ibn Muslim from Abi Abdillah (peace be upon him) said: I asked him about a man who divorced his wife once, then died while she was in her waiting period ('iddah). He said: "She inherits from him, then observes the 'iddah of a woman whose husband has died. And if she dies, he inherits from her. If he kills her or she kills him while she is in her 'iddah, each of them inherits from the diya (blood money) of the other."
(731) 4 - As for what Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya narrated from Ibrahim ibn Hashim from al-Nawfali from al-Sakuni from Ja'far from his father that Ali (peace be upon him) did not grant the woman inheritance from the diya of her husband, nor did he grant the man inheritance from the diya of his wife, nor the maternal siblings anything from the diya.
The explanation for this report is one of two things. The first: taqiyya (dissimulation) because it conforms to the opinion of some of the common people, because they say that no one inherits the diya except one who would pay the 'aql (ransom) for him if he were killed by mistake. The second explanation:
is what we said in the interpretation of the preceding report, which is that the one who kills by mistake does not inherit from the diya itself, even if he inherits from what is other than it. So we interpret this report to mean that he would not grant them inheritance from the diya of each of them if they were killers by mistake, so as not to contradict what preceded.
113 - Chapter on the inheritance of one who has no heir from among the relatives by blood (dhawi al-arham) and mawali (freed slaves/clients).
(732) 1 - Al-Hasan ibn Muhammad ibn Sama'a from al-Husayn ibn Hashim from Ibn Miskan from al-Halabi from Abi Abdillah (peace be upon him) said: "They ask you about the Anfal." He said: "Whoever dies and has no mawla (patron/client), then his wealth is from the Anfal."
(733) 2 - From him, from Muhammad ibn Ziyad from Rifa'a from Aban ibn Taghlib, he said: Abu Abdillah (peace be upon him) said: "Whoever dies and has no mawla (patron/client) nor heirs, then he is from the people of this verse: 'They ask you about the Anfal. Say, 'The Anfal are for Allah and the Messenger.'"

(735) 4 - As for what Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Abī ‘Umayr narrated from Khallād from al-Sirrī, who raised it to Amīr al-Mu’minīn (peace be upon him), regarding a man who dies and leaves wealth but has no heir, Amīr al-Mu’minīn (peace be upon him) said: "Give it to his hamsharīj (compatriots)."
(736) 5 - It was also narrated from Dāwūd from someone who mentioned it from Abī ‘Abdillāh (peace be upon him) who said: "A man died during the time of Amīr al-Mu’minīn (peace be upon him) and had no heir, so Amīr al-Mu’minīn (peace be upon him) gave his inheritance to his hamsharīj."
These two narrations are mursal (interrupted) and shādhdh (anomalous), and what is like this cannot be opposed to the musnad (supported) narrations agreed upon as authentic. Moreover, there is nothing in them that contradicts what preceded, because what they contain is a narration of an action, which is that Amīr al-Mu’minīn (peace be upon him) gave his estate to his hamsharīj. Perhaps that was done for some reform, because if the money belonged solely to him, as we have mentioned, it was permissible for him to do with it as he pleased and give it to whomever he pleased. There is nothing in the narrations that says: "This is the ruling for every wealth that has no heir," so it would not contradict what preceded of the narrations.

He said: Seek him. He said: We have sought him and did not find him. He said: So he said: To the poor, and he moved his hands. He said: So he repeated it to him. He said: Seek and strive, and if you can find him, otherwise it is like the way of your money until a claimant comes to him, and if something happens to you, then entrust it if a claimant comes to him to pay it to him.
The aspect in this report is that it is only like the way of his money if he guarantees the money and the will is binding upon him at the time of death.
(740) 4 - As for what Yunus narrated from Fayd ibn Habib, the owner of the khan, he said: I wrote to 'Abd Salih (peace be upon him): Two hundred and forty dirhams have fallen into my possession, and I am the owner of a hotel, and its owner died, and I did not know any heirs for him. What is your opinion in informing me of its condition and what I should do with it, for I have become weary of it? So he wrote: Work with it and give it out as charity little by little until it is gone.
The aspect in this report is one of two things, one of which is: that he gives it in charity and is responsible for its owner if he comes like a lost item, and the second is: that if this is money that has no heir, then it is from the Anfal (spoils).

الله الأصغر فإذا زنى الرجل المحصن رجم ولم يجلد.
فلا ينافي ما قدمناه من الاخبار من وجوب الجمع بين الجلد والرجم لأنه يحتمل شيئين، أحدهما: أن نحمله على التقية لأنه مذهب جميع العامة وما هذا حكمه تجوز التقية فيه، والثاني: أن يكون المراد به من لم يكن شيخا أو شيخة بل يكون حدثا لان الذي يوجب عليه الرجم والجلد معا إذا كان شيخا أو شيخة محصنا وقد فصل ذلك عليه السلام في رواية عبد الله بن طلحة، وعبد الرحمن بن الحجاج، والحلبي، وعبد الله بن سنان وقد قدمنا ذلك عنهم ولا ينافي ذلك:
(759) 10 - ما رواه علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن ابن أبي نجران عن عاصم بن حميد عن محمد بن قيس عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام قال: قضى أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام في الشيخ والشيخة أن يجلدا مائة، وقضى في المحصن الرجم، وقضى في البكر والبكرة إذا زنيا جلد مائة ونفي سنة في غير مصرهما، وهما اللذان قد أملكا ولم يدخل بها.
لان قوله عليه السلام الشيخ والشيخة يجلدان مائة ولم يذكر الرجم لا يمتنع انه إنما لم يذكره لأنه لا خلاف في وجوبه على المحصن وذكر الجلد الذي يختص بايجابه عليه مع الرجم فاقتصر على ذلك لعلم المخاطب بوجوب الجمع بينهما، على أنه يحتمل أن تكون الرواية مقصورة على أنهما إذا كانا غير محصنين، ألا ترى أنه قال بعد ذلك وقضى في المحصن الرجم مع أن وجوب الرجم على المحصن مجمع عليه سواء كان شيخا أو شابا.

...the lesser punishment from Allah. So, if a married man commits adultery, he is stoned, and not flogged.

This does not contradict what we have presented of the reports regarding the obligation to combine flogging and stoning, because it can be interpreted in two ways. The first: that we interpret it as taqiyya (dissimulation), because it is the opinion of all the common people [Sunnis], and whatever this is its ruling, taqiyya (dissimulation) is permissible regarding it. The second: that what is meant by it is one who is not a *shaykh* (elder) or *shaykha* (elder woman), but is young, because the one upon whom both stoning and flogging are obligatory is when he is a *shaykh* (elder) or *shaykha* (elder woman) who is *muhsan* (married). This was detailed by him, peace be upon him, in the narration of 'Abd Allah ibn Talha, 'Abd al-Rahman ibn al-Hajjaj, al-Halabi, and 'Abd Allah ibn Sinan, and we have already presented that from them. And that does not contradict:

(759) 10 - What was narrated by 'Ali ibn Ibrahim from his father from Ibn Abi Najran from 'Asim ibn Humayd from Muhammad ibn Qays from Abi Ja'far, peace be upon him, who said: The Commander of the Believers, peace be upon him, ruled regarding the *shaykh* (elder) and *shaykha* (elder woman) that they should be flogged one hundred times, and he ruled regarding the *muhsan* (married) that he should be stoned, and he ruled regarding the unmarried man and woman, if they commit adultery, that they should be flogged one hundred times and exiled for a year to a place other than their own, and they are the ones who have contracted marriage but have not consummated it.

Because his saying, peace be upon him, "The *shaykh* (elder) and *shaykha* (elder woman) are flogged one hundred times" and he did not mention stoning, it is not impossible that he only did not mention it because there is no disagreement regarding its obligation upon the *muhsan* (married), and he mentioned the flogging, which is specifically obligated upon him along with the stoning, so he limited it to that because the addressee knows about the obligation to combine the two. Furthermore, it is possible that the narration is limited to the case where they are not *muhsan* (married). Do you not see that he said after that, "And he ruled regarding the *muhsan* (married) stoning," even though the obligation of stoning upon the *muhsan* (married) is agreed upon, whether he is a *shaykh* (elder) or a young man.

Peace be upon him, was stoned in Kufa and flogged, but Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, denied that, saying: "We do not know this." Yunus said: "We did not find a man punished twice for one sin."

Muhammad ibn al-Hasan said: "What Yunus mentioned is not apparent in the report, nor does it indicate it. Rather, it says that he said, 'We do not know this,' and it is possible that he only meant, 'We do not know that the Messenger of God, may God bless him and his family, stoned and did not flog,' because two rulings have already been mentioned by the questioner, one about the Messenger of God, may God bless him and his family, and the other about the Commander of the Believers, peace be upon him. كما لا تحصنه الأمة والنصرانية واليهودية إن زنى بحرة فكذلك لا يكون عليه حد المحصن إن زنى بيهودية أو نصرانية أو أمة وتحته حرة.

(769) 7 - فقد روى علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن عبد الرحمن بن حماد عن عمر بن يزيد قال: قلت لأبي عبد الله عليه السلام اخبرني عن الغائب عن أهله يزني هل يرجم

(767) 5 - As for what Al-Hussein bin Saeed narrated from Ibn Abi Umair from Hammad from Al-Halabi, who said that Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, said: "A free man does not protect a female slave, nor does a male slave protect a free woman."

This does not contradict the earlier reports stating that a female slave can be protected because the interpretation of this report is that the free man does not protect her to the extent that if she commits adultery, she must be stoned as if she were married to a free woman. This is because the punishment for a male or female slave who commits adultery is half the punishment for a free person, which is fifty lashes, and they are not to be stoned under any circumstances. Similarly, his saying, "nor does a male slave protect a free woman," means that the free woman does not protect him to the extent that he must be stoned. With this interpretation, it does not contradict the preceding reports.

(768) 6 - As for what Muhammad bin Ahmad bin Yahya narrated from Ahmad bin Muhammad from Al-Hasan bin Mahbub from Al-Ala from Muhammad bin Muslim from Abu Jaafar, peace be upon him, regarding a man who has intercourse with his wife's slave girl without her permission: he receives the same punishment as an adulterer, one hundred lashes. He said: "He is not to be stoned if he commits adultery with a Jewish woman, a Christian woman, or a slave girl." But if he commits adultery with a free woman and he has a free wife, he is to be stoned. He said:

Just as a slave girl, a Christian woman, or a Jewish woman does not protect him if he commits adultery with a free woman, likewise, he is not subject to the punishment of a *muhsan* (protected, married person) if he commits adultery with a Jewish woman, a Christian woman, or a slave girl while he has a free wife.

His saying, peace be upon him, "Just as a slave girl, a Jewish woman, or a Christian woman does not protect him if he commits adultery with a free woman, likewise, he is not subject to the punishment of a *muhsan* (protected, married person) if he commits adultery..." may mean that these women do not protect him if they are with him by way of *mut'ah* (temporary marriage) and not by way of a permanent contract because a permanent contract is not permissible with a Jewish or Christian woman; only *mut'ah* is permissible, and *mut'ah* does not provide *ihsan* (protection from the hadd punishment for adultery). We have explained this in the narration of Ishaq bin Ammar, which we mentioned earlier. And also:

(769) 7 - Ali bin Ibrahim narrated from his father from Abd al-Rahman bin Hammad from Omar bin Yazid, who said: I said to Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him: Inform me about a man who is absent from his family and commits adultery; is he to be stoned?

If he has a wife and is absent from her?” He said: “The one absent from his family is not to be stoned, nor the married man who has not yet consummated the marriage with his family, nor the one who practices mut'ah.” I said: “At what distance of travel does he cease to be *muhsan* (protected by marriage)?” He said: “If he shortens his prayers and breaks his fast, then he is not *muhsan*.”
(770) 8 - Ali bin Ibrahim from his father from Ibn Abi Umayr from Hisham from Hafs bin al-Bakhtari from someone he mentioned from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) regarding a man who engages in *mut'ah* marriage: "Does it make him *muhsan*?" He said, "No, that only applies to permanent marriage."
As for what the report implies, that if he commits adultery with his wife’s slave girl without her permission, he is to be flogged like any adulterer, this does not contradict the fact that stoning may also be obligatory for him for two reasons: The first: that this is specific to a slave girl with whom he has not had intercourse, for if he has not had intercourse with his wife and commits adultery, he is not to be stoned, but is to be flogged. The second: that he mentioned the ruling of flogging and relied on the establishment of the ruling of stoning based on consensus, and that his saying (peace be upon him), "He is to receive the same as the adulterer," indicates the obligation of stoning upon him, and this is further clarified by:
(771) 9 - What Ahmad bin Muhammad narrated from Muhammad bin Sahl from Zakariya bin Adam, who said: I asked al-Ridha (peace be upon him) about a man who had intercourse with his wife’s slave girl, and she did not gift her to him. He said: “He is an adulterer and is to be stoned.”
(772) 10 - Muhammad bin Ahmad bin Yahya from Abi Jaafar from his father from Wahb from Jaafar from his father that Ali (peace be upon him) was brought a man who had intercourse with his wife’s slave girl and she became pregnant. The man said: “She was gifted to me”, and the woman denied it. He said: “Either you bring witnesses to that, or I will stone you with stones.” When the woman saw that, she confessed, and Ali (peace be upon him) flogged her with the prescribed punishment.
As for what the report implies from his saying, "He is not to be stoned if he commits adultery with a Jewish, Christian, or slave woman," it is possible that this applies if he is not *muhsan*, because with the establishment of *ihsan* (marital status that makes one liable to stoning for adultery) there is no difference between whether he commits adultery

(773) 11 - What Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Isa narrated from Muhammad ibn Isa from Abdullah ibn al-Mughira from Ismail ibn Abi Ziyad from Jaafar from his father from his forefathers, peace be upon them, that Muhammad ibn Abi Bakr wrote to Ali, peace be upon him, asking him about a man who commits adultery with a Jewish or Christian woman. He wrote to him: If he is *muhsan* (married), then stone him, and if he is a virgin, then flog him one hundred lashes and then exile him. As for the Jewish woman, send her back to her people, and let them do with her as they please.

(774) 12 - As for what Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya narrated from Ahmad ibn al-Hasan ibn Ali ibn Faddal from Amr ibn Saeed from Musaddiq ibn Sadaqa from Ammar al-Sabatī from Abi Abdullah, peace be upon him, about a man who had a wife and divorced her or she died, and then he committed adultery, he said: He is to be stoned. And about a woman who had a husband and he divorced her or died and then she committed adultery, is she to be stoned? He said: Yes.

As for what this report implies, that if a man divorces his wife and then he or she commits adultery, then they are to be stoned, the way to understand this is to interpret it as applying if the divorce was revocable. If that is the case, then they are to be stoned, and we have demonstrated this in our large book. As for what it implies after that, that if she dies and then he commits adultery, then he should be stoned, this may only be if he was *muhsan* (married) with another woman. But as for a woman if her husband dies and then she commits adultery, then she is not obligated to be stoned, but rather she is obligated to be flogged. It seems that the mention of stoning in this instance is a mistake from the narrator.

119 - Chapter on one who commits adultery with a Mahram relative.
(775) 1 - Sahl ibn Ziyad from Ibn Abi Nasr from Abdullah ibn Bukayr from his father who said: Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) said: "Whoever has intercourse with a Mahram relative is struck once with the sword, it takes from him what it takes."
(776) 2 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Khalid from his father from Ibn Bukayr from a man who said: I said to Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him): "A man has intercourse with a Mahram relative?" He said: "He is struck once with the sword." Ibn Bukayr said: Hariz narrated to me from Bukayr about that.
(777) 3 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub from Abi Ayyub who said: I heard Bukayr ibn A'yun narrate from one of them (peace be upon them): "Whoever commits adultery with a Mahram relative to the point of intercourse is struck once with the sword, it takes from him what it takes. If she complied with him, she is struck once with the sword, it takes from her what it takes." It was said to him: "Then who strikes them when they have no claimant?" He said: "That is up to the Imam if they are brought to him."
(778) 4 - Sahl ibn Ziyad from Ali ibn Asbat from al-Hakam ibn Miskeen from Jamil ibn Darraj who said: I said to Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him): "Where is this strike administered, meaning on one who has intercourse with a Mahram relative?" He said: "His neck is struck," or he said, "His neck is struck."
(779) 5 - Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya from some of his companions from Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Mehran from someone who mentioned it from Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) who said: I asked him about a man who had intercourse with his sister. He said: "He is struck once with the sword." I said: "Then he is released?" He said: "He is imprisoned forever until he dies."
(780) 6 - As for what Muhammad ibn Ali ibn Mahbub narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from al-Hussain from Safwan ibn Yahya from Ishaq ibn Ammar from Abi Basir from Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) who said: "If a man commits adultery with a Mahram relative, he receives the ḥadd (prescribed punishment) of the adulterer, except that his sin is greater."

text:
وعلى هذا يحمل ما حكاه أبو بصير في آخر الخبر الأخير عن جعفر بن محمد من حكايته قضية أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام وأنه إنما فعل ذلك بمن علم أن لها زوجا فضربه الحد ويمكن أن يحمل الخبر على أنه إنما ضربه الحد الذي هو التعزيز دون الحد الكامل وذلك إذا غلب في ظنه أن لها زوجا ففرط في التفتيش عن ذلك فاستحق لهذا التفريط التعزير، ويكون قوله عليه السلام: لو علمت أنك علمت لفضخت رأسك بالحجارة المراد به انك لو علمت علم يقين ان لها زوجا لفعلت ذلك، ويجوز أن يكون ذلك مختصا بمتهم ادعى انه لم يعلم ذلك ولم يقم له بينة بالزوجية فكان عليه الحد، يدل على ذلك:
(783) 3 - ما رواه الحسين بن سعيد عن ابن أبي عمير عن حماد عن الحلبي عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام في امرأة تزوجت ولها زوج فقال: ترجم المرأة وإن كان للذي تزوجها بينة على تزويجها وإلا ضرب الحد.
121 - باب المكاتبة التي أدت بعض مكاتبتها ثم وقع عليها مولاها (784) 1 - علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن صالح بن سعيد عن الحسين بن خالد عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: سئل عن رجل كانت له أمة فكاتبها فقالت الأمة ما أديت من مكاتبتي فأنا به حرة على حساب ذلك فقال لها: نعم ثم أدت بعض مكاتبتها وجامعها مولاها بعد ذلك فقال عليه السلام: إن كان استكرهها على ذلك ضرب من الحد بقدر ما أدت له من مكاتبتها وادرئ عنه من الحد بقدر ما بقي من مكاتبتها وإن كانت تابعته كانت شريكته في الحد ضربت مثل ما يضرب.
(785) 2 - فأما ما رواه يونس بن عبد الرحمن عن الحلبي قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام

This is how we interpret what Abu Basir narrated at the end of the last report from Ja'far bin Muhammad regarding his account of the case of Amir al-Mu'minin (peace be upon him), that he only did that to someone he knew had a husband, so he applied the ḥadd (prescribed punishment) to him. It is also possible to interpret the report as meaning that he only applied the ḥadd, which is ta'zīr (discretionary punishment), not the full ḥadd, if it was highly probable that she had a husband and he neglected to investigate the matter thoroughly, thus deserving ta'zīr for this negligence. And his saying (peace be upon him): "If I knew that you knew, I would crush your head with stones," means that if you knew with certainty that she had a husband, you would have done that. It is also permissible that this was specific to an accused person who claimed that he did not know that and no evidence of marriage was established for him, so he was subject to the ḥadd, which is indicated by:
(783) 3 - What Al-Hussein bin Saeed narrated from Ibn Abi Umair from Hammad from Al-Halabi from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) regarding a woman who got married while she had a husband. He said: "The woman should be stoned. If the one who married her has proof of her marriage (to another), otherwise he should be lashed with the ḥadd."
121 - Chapter on a Mukataba (slave under contract of manumission) who has paid part of her manumission fee, then her master has intercourse with her.
(784) 1 - Ali bin Ibrahim from his father from Salih bin Saeed from Al-Hussein bin Khalid from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) who said: He was asked about a man who had a female slave whom he contracted to manumit (mukataba), and the female slave said: "What I have paid from my manumission fee, I am free by it, based on that account." He said to her: "Yes." Then she paid part of her manumission fee and her master had intercourse with her after that. He (peace be upon him) said: "If he forced her to do that, he is lashed with the ḥadd in proportion to what she had paid him from her manumission fee, and the ḥadd is waived from him in proportion to what remained of her manumission fee. And if she obeyed him willingly, she is his partner in the ḥadd; she is lashed like he is lashed."
(785) 2 - As for what Yunus bin Abdul Rahman narrated from Al-Halabi who said: I asked Aba Abdullah (peace be upon him)

text:
عن رجل وقع على مكاتبته فقال: ان كانت أدت الربع جلد وإن كان محصنا رجم وإن لم تكن أدت شيئا فليس عليه شئ.
فلا ينافي الخبر الأول لأنه يمكن أن يحمل الخبر الأول على التفصيل الذي تضمنه الخبر الأخير من أنه يضرب بحساب ذلك فيما يكون دون الربع فإذا بلغ الربع من الحرية غلب عليه حكمه فجلد تاما أو رجم على حسب أحواله.
122 - باب المريض المدنف يصيب ما يجب عليه فيه الحد كيف يقام عليه (786) 1 - الحسين بن سعيد عن الحسن عن زرعة عن سماعة عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام عن أبيه عن آبائه عن النبي صلى الله عليه وآله انه أتي برجل كبير البطن قد أصاب محرما فدعا رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله بعرجون (1) فيه ماءة شمراخ (2) فضربه مرة واحدة فكان الحد.
(787) 2 - يونس بن عبد الرحمن عن أبان بن عثمان عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال قال أتي رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله برجل دميم (3) قصير قد سقط بطنه وقد در عروق بطنه قد فجر بامرأة فقالت المرأة ما علمت به الا وقد دخل علي فقال له رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله أزنيت؟ قال: نعم ولم يكن محصنا فصعد رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله بصره وخفضه ثم دعا بعذق (4) فعده ماءة ثم ضربه بشماريخه.
(788) 3 - فاما ما رواه أحمد بن محمد عن أبي همام عن محمد بن سعيد عن السكوني

translation:
T Text:

Concerning a man who had intercourse with his mukātaba (slave who has a contract to purchase his freedom), he (the Imam) said: "If she had paid a quarter (of her value), he is flogged. If he is muḥṣan (married/protected), he is stoned. And if she has not paid anything, then there is nothing upon him."

This does not contradict the first report because it is possible that the first report is to be interpreted in light of the detail contained in the last report, which is that he is struck in proportion to that amount when it is less than a quarter. If (the portion of) freedom reaches a quarter, the rule of freedom overrides, so he is flogged completely or stoned, depending on his circumstances.

122 - Chapter on a Sick, Weak Person Who Commits a Crime for Which Ḥadd (fixed punishment) is Due: How the Ḥadd is to be Carried Out on Him (786) 1 - Al-Ḥusayn ibn Saʿīd from al-Ḥasan from Zurʿa from Samāʿa from Abū ʿAbd Allāh (peace be upon him) from his father from his forefathers from the Prophet (peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family) that a man with a large belly was brought to him, and he had committed a forbidden act. So the Messenger of God (peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family) called for an ʿurjūn (1) with one hundred shamārīkh (2), and he struck him once, and that was the ḥadd.

(787) 2 - Yūnus ibn ʿAbd al-Raḥmān from Abān ibn ʿUthmān from Abū ʿAbd Allāh (peace be upon him) who said: The Messenger of God (peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family) was brought a man who was damīm (3) short, whose belly had fallen, and the veins of his belly had become visible. He had committed fornication with a woman, and the woman said, "I did not know him except when he entered upon me." So the Messenger of God (peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family) said to him, "Did you commit fornication?" He said, "Yes," and he was not muḥṣan (married/protected). So the Messenger of God (peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family) raised his gaze and lowered it, then called for an ʿidhq (4) and counted it as one hundred, then struck him with its shamarikh.

(788) 3 - As for what Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad narrated from Abū Humām from Muḥammad ibn Saʿīd from al-Sakūnī

text:
عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: أتي أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام برجل أصاب حدا وبه قروح في جسده كثيرة فقال أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام: أخروه حتى يبرأ لا تنكؤها عليه فتقتلوه.
(789) 4 - سهل بن زياد عن محمد بن الحسن بن شمون عن عبد الله بن عبد الرحمن الأصم عن مسمع بن عبد الملك عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام عليه السلام أن أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام أتي برجل أصاب حدا وبه قروح ومرض وأشباه ذلك فقال أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام أخروه حتى يبرأ لا تنكأ قروحه عليه فيموت ولكن إذا برأ حددناه.
فلا تنافي بين هذين الخبرين والخبرين الأولين لأنه إذا كان إقامة الحد إلى الامام فهو يقيمها على حسب ما يراه، فان كانت المصلحة تقتضي اقامتها في الحال أقامها على وجه لا يؤدي إلى تلف نفسه كما فعل النبي صلى الله عليه وآله، وإن اقتضت المصلحة تأخيرها إلى أن يبرأ ثم يقيم عليه الحد على الكمال.
123 - باب ان الزاني إذا جلد ثلاث مراث قتل في الرابعة (790) 1 - يونس بن عبد الرحمن عن إسحاق بن عمار عن أبي بصير قال: قال أبو عبد الله عليه السلام: الزاني إذا زنى جلد ثلاثا ويقتل في الرابعة يعني إذا جلد ثلاث مرات.
(791) 2 - فأما ما رواه يونس عن أبي الحسن الماضي عليه السلام قال: أصحاب الكبائر كلها إذا أقيم عليهم الحد قتلوا في الثالثة.
فلا ينافي الخبر الأول لأنا نخصه بما عدا حد الزنا من شرب الخمر وغيره على ما نبينه فيما بعد إن شاء الله.
