عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام قال: قضى أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام في مكاتب قتل قال: يحتسب منه ما أعتق منه فيؤدى به دية الحر ومارق منه دية العبد.
ولا ينافي هذا الخبر:
(1049) 2 - ما رواه محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن محمد بن أحمد العلوي عن العمركي الخراساني عن علي بن جعفر عن أخيه موسى بن جعفر عليهما السلام قال: سألته عن مكاتب فقأ عين مكاتب أو كسر سنه ما عليه؟ قال: إن كان أدى نصف مكاتبته فديته دية حر، وإن كان دون النصف فبقدر ما عتق، وكذلك إذا فقأ عين حر، وسألته عن حر فقأ عين مكاتب أو كسر سنه ما عليه؟ قال: إن كان أدى نصف مكاتبته يفقأ عين الحر أو ديته فإن كان خطأ هو يمنزلة الحر، وإن كان لم يؤد النصف قوم وأدى بقدر ما أعتق منه، وسألته عن المكاتب إذا أدى نصف ما عليه؟ قال: هو بمنزلة الحر في الحدود وغير ذلك من قتل وغيره.
لان الوجه في الجمع بينهما أن يحمل الخبر الأول على التفصيل الذي تضمنه الخبر الأخير فنقول يحسب فيؤدى منه بحسب الحرية ما لم يكن أدى نصف ثمنه فإذا أدى ذلك كان حكمه حكم الأحرار على ما تضمنه الخبر الأخير.
163 - باب المقتول يوجد في قبيلة أو قرية (1050) 1 - أحمد بن محمد بن خالد عن عثمان بن عيسى عن سماعة بن مهران عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: سألته عن الرجل يوجد قتيلا في القرية أو بين قريتين فقال: يقاس ما بينهما فأيهما كانت أقرب ضمنت.
(1051) 2 - علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن ابن أبي عمير عن حماد عن الحلبي

From Abi Ja'far (peace be upon him) who said: Amir al-Mu'minin (peace be upon him) ruled concerning a mukatab (a slave who has a contract of manumission) who killed someone: "What he has paid towards his freedom is calculated, and the diyah (blood money) of a free man is paid with it, and what remains is the diyah of a slave."
This report does not contradict:
(1049) 2 - What Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya narrated from Muhammad ibn Ahmad al-'Alawi from al-'Umraki al-Khorasani from Ali ibn Ja'far from his brother Musa ibn Ja'far (peace be upon them) who said: I asked him about a mukatab who gouged out the eye of another mukatab or broke his tooth, what is due on him? He said: "If he has paid half of his manumission, then his diyah is the diyah of a free man, and if it is less than half, then it is according to what he has paid towards his freedom." And similarly, if he gouged out the eye of a free man. And I asked him about a free man who gouged out the eye of a mukatab or broke his tooth, what is due on him? He said: "If he has paid half of his manumission, then the free man's eye is gouged out or its diyah is paid, if it was unintentional, he is considered like a free man. And if he has not paid half, then it is assessed and he pays according to what he has paid towards his freedom." And I asked him about the mukatab when he has paid half of what is due on him? He said: "He is considered like a free man in hudud (fixed punishments) and other things, such as murder and other matters."
Because the way to reconcile between them is to interpret the first report in light of the detail contained in the last report. So we say that it is calculated and paid from him according to his freedom as long as he has not paid half of his price, but if he has paid that, then his ruling is the ruling of free men, according to what the last report contains.
163 - Chapter: A murdered person is found in a tribe or village
(1050) 1 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Khalid from Uthman ibn Isa from Sama'a ibn Mehran from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) who said: I asked him about a man who is found murdered in a village or between two villages, so he said: "It is measured between them, whichever is closer is responsible."
(1051) 2 - Ali ibn Ibrahim from his father from Ibn Abi Umayr from Hammad from al-Halabi

قال محمد بن الحسن الوجه في هذه الأخبار انه إنما يلزم أهل القرية أو القبيلة إذا وجد القتيل بينهم متى كانوا متهمين بالقتل وامتنعوا من القسامة حسب ما بيناه في كتابنا الكبير، فاما إذا لم يكونوا متهمين بالقتل أو أجابوا إلى القسامة فلا دية عليهم وتؤدى ديته من بيت المال، والذي يدل على ذلك:
(1053) 4 - ما رواه محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن أحمد والعباس والهيثم جميعا عن الحسن ابن محبوب عن علي بن الفضيل عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: إذا وجد رجل مقتول في قبيلة قوم حلفوا جميعا ما قتلوه ولا يعلمون له قاتلا فان أبوا غرموا الدية فيما بينهم في أموالهم سواء بين جميع القبيلة من الرجال المدركين.

(1052) 3 - Al-Hussein bin Saeed from Abd al-Rahman bin Abi Najran from Asim bin Humaid from Muhammad Ibn Qais who said: I heard Abu Jaafar, peace be upon him, say: Amir al-Mu'minin, peace be upon him, ruled regarding a man who was killed in a village or near a village that the people of that village must pay the blood money if no proof is found among the people of that village that they did not kill him.
Muhammad bin al-Hasan said: The rationale behind these reports is that the people of the village or tribe are only obligated if the slain person is found among them when they are accused of the killing and refuse to take the oath, as we have explained in our great book. But if they are not accused of the killing or they agree to the oath, then there is no blood money due from them, and his blood money is paid from the public treasury. What indicates this is:

If they refuse, they pay the blood money among themselves in their wealth equally among all the men of the tribe who have reached puberty.
(1054) 5 - From him, from Harun bin Muslim from Mas'ada bin Ziyad from Jaafar, peace be upon him, who said:
My father, may Allah be pleased with him, if the people claiming [the killing] did not provide proof for the killing of their slain person and did not swear that the accused killed him, the accused would swear fifty oaths by Allah that we did not kill him and we do not know his killer, then the blood money would be paid to the guardians of the slain person. That is if he was killed in one neighborhood. But if he was killed in a camp, market, or city, then his blood money is paid to his guardians from the public treasury.

text:
عليه السلام انه سئل عن رجل أعنف على امرأة فزعم أنها ماتت من عنفه؟ قال:
الدية كاملة ولا يقتل الرجل.
فلا ينافي الخبر الأول لان الخبر الأول نحمله على أنه إنما نفي فيه عنه أن يكون عليهما شئ من القود ولم ينف أن يكون عليهما الدية وإنما تزول التهمة بأن يحلف كل واحد منهما انه ما أراد قتل صاحبه ثم تلزمه الدية.
166 - باب من زلق من فوق على غيره فقتله (1060) 1 - الحسن بن محبوب عن علي بن رئاب عن عبيد بن زرارة قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن رجل وقع على رجل فقتله فقال: ليس عليه شئ.
(1061) 2 - محمد بن يعقوب عن الحسين بن محمد عن معلى بن محمد عن الوشا عن أبان ابن عثمان عن عبيد بن زرارة قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن رجل وقع على رجل من فوق البيت فمات أحدهما قال: ليس على الاعلى شئ ولا على الأسفل شئ.
(1062) 3 - محمد بن علي بن محبوب عن أحمد بن محمد عن الحسين عن صفوان بن يحيى وفضالة عن العلا عن محمد بن مسلم عن أحدهما عليهما السلام قال: في الرجل يسقط على الرجل فيقتله فقال: لا شئ عليه.
قال محمد بن الحسن الوجه في هذه الأخبار أنه لا يلزمه إذا كان زلق خطأ، فاما إذا دفعه دافع كانت الجناية عليه ويرجع هو على الدافع، يدل على ذلك:
(1063) 4 - ما رواه الحسن بن محبوب عن عبد الله بن سنان عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام في رجل دفع رجلا على رجل فقتله قال: الدية على الذي وقع على الرجل لأولياء

167 - باب جواز قتل الاثنين فصاعدا بواحد (1064) 1 - علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن أحمد بن الحسن الميثمي عن أبان عن الفضيل بن يسار قال: قلت لأبي جعفر عليه السلام عشرة قتلوا رجلا فقال: إن شاؤوا أولياؤه قتلوهم جميعا وغرموا تسع ديات، وإن شاؤوا تخيروا رجلا فقتلوه وأدت التسعة الباقون إلى أهل المقتول الأخير عشر الدية كل رجل منهم، قال: ثم الوالي يلي أدبهم وحبسهم.
(1065) 2 - عنه عن محمد بن عيسى عن يونس عن عبد الله بن مسكان عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام في رجلين قتلا رجلا قال: إن أراد أولياء المقتول قتلهما أدوا دية كاملة وقتلوهما وتكون الدية بين أولياء المقتولين، وإن أرادوا قتل أحدهما قتلوه وأدى المتروك نصف الدية إلى أهل المقتول، فإن لم يؤدوا دية أحدهما ولم يقتل أحدهما قبلوا دية صاحبهم من كليهما، وإن قبل أولياؤه الدية كانت عليهما.
(1066) 3 - يونس عن ابن مسكان عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: إذا قتل الرجلان والثلاثة رجلا فأرادوا قتلهم ترادوا فضل الدية وان قبل أولياؤه الدية كانت عليهما وإلا أخذوا دية صاحبهم.
(1067) 4 - أحمد بن محمد عن ابن أبي عمير عن حماد عن الحلبي عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام في عشرة اشتركوا في قتل رجل قال: تخير أهل المقتول فأيهم شاؤوا قتلوه ويرجع أولياؤه على الباقين بتسعة أعشار الدية.

167 - Chapter on the permissibility of killing two or more for one (1064) 1 - Ali ibn Ibrahim from his father from Ahmad ibn al-Hasan al-Mithami from Aban from al-Fudayl ibn Yasar who said: I said to Abu Jaafar, peace be upon him, ten men killed a man, he said: If his guardians wish, they can kill all of them and they would have to pay nine blood monies, and if they wish, they can choose one man and kill him and the remaining nine would pay to the family of the last slain man one-tenth of the blood money each, he said: Then the ruler takes charge of disciplining them and imprisoning them.
(1065) 2 - From him from Muhammad ibn Isa from Yunus from Abdullah ibn Muskan from Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, regarding two men who killed a man, he said: If the guardians of the slain man want to kill them, they pay a full blood money and kill them both, and the blood money will be divided among the guardians of the slain men, and if they want to kill one of them, they kill him and the one who is left pays half the blood money to the family of the slain man, and if they do not pay the blood money for one of them and do not kill one of them, they accept the blood money for their companion from both of them, and if his guardians accept the blood money, it is incumbent upon both of them.
(1066) 3 - Yunus from Ibn Muskan from Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, who said: If two or three men kill a man and they want to kill them, they return the surplus of the blood money, and if his guardians accept the blood money, it is incumbent upon them, otherwise they take the blood money for their companion.
(1067) 4 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ibn Abi Umayr from Hammad from al-Halabi from Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, regarding ten men who participated in killing a man, he said: The family of the slain man chooses whichever of them they want to kill, and his guardians have recourse against the rest for nine-tenths of the blood money.

(1068) 5 - As for what Al-Ḥusayn ibn Saʿīd narrated from Ibn Abī ʿUmayr from al-Qāsim ibn ʿUrwah from al-ʿAbbās and others from Abū ʿAbd Allāh (peace be upon him) who said: "If a group gathers to kill one man, the ruler decrees that whichever of them they wish should be killed. However, they are not allowed to kill more than one, for God Almighty says, 'And whoever is killed wrongfully - We have given his heir authority, but let him not exceed limits in [the matter of] taking life.' (17:33) And if three kill one man, the ruler has the choice to kill whichever of the three he wishes and the others must guarantee two-thirds of the blood money to the heirs of the slain."

This does not contradict the previous reports, because the interpretation of this report is that we understand it in one of two ways: one, that we understand it as taqiyya (precautionary dissimulation), because among the jurists are those who permit that; and the other, that we understand it as not being permissible except on the condition that what exceeds the blood money of his companion is returned, which is contrary to what some of the common people adhere to and is the doctrine of some who preceded Amīr al-Muʾminīn (peace be upon him), because he used to permit the killing of two or more for one without returning the excess of that, and that is not permissible under any circumstances, and what confirms what we have presented.
(1069) 6 - What al-Ḥasan ibn ʿAlī ibn Bint Ilyās narrated from Dāwūd ibn Sarḥān from Abū ʿAbd Allāh (peace be upon him) concerning two men who killed a man, he said: "They are both killed if the slain man's family wishes, and one blood-money is returned to their families."
(1070) 7 - As for what Muḥammad ibn Yaḥyá narrated from some of our companions from Yaḥyá ibn al-Mubārak from ʿAbd Allāh ibn Jabala from Abū Jamīla from Isḥāq ibn ʿAmmār from Abū ʿAbd Allāh (peace be upon him) concerning a slave and a free man who killed a free man, he said: "If he wishes, he kills the free man, and if he wishes, he kills the slave, but if he chooses to kill the free man, the slave's sides are lashed."

قوله عليه السلام: ضرب جنبي العبد لا يدل على أنه لا يجب على مولاه أن يرد على ورثة المقتول الثاني نصف الدية أو يسلم العبد إليهم، لأنه لو كان حرا لكان عليه ذلك على ما بيناه، فحكم العبد حكمه على السواء وإنما يجب عليه مع ذلك التعزير كما يجب على الأحرار على ما رواه الفضيل بن يسار في الرواية التي قدمناها.
168 - باب من أمر غيره بقتل انسان فقتله (1071) 1 - أحمد بن محمد عن الحسن بن محبوب عن علي بن رئاب عن زرارة عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام في رجل أمر رجلا بقتل رجل فقتله فقال: يقتل به الذي قتله ويحبس الامر بقتله في الحبس حتى يموت.
(1072) 2 - فأما ما رواه أحمد بن محمد عن ابن محبوب عن إسحاق بن عمار عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام في رجل أمر عبده أن يقتل رجلا فقتله فقال: يقتل السيد به.
(1073) 3 - علي عن أبيه عن النوفلي عن السكوني عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال قال أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام: في رجل أمر عبده أن يقتل رجلا فقتله فقال:
أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام وهل عبد الرجل إلا كسيفه يقتل السيد ويستودع العبد السجن.
فالوجه في هذين الخبرين أن نحملهما على من يتعود أمر عبيده بقتل الناس ويلجئهم إلى ذلك ويكرههم عليه، فان من هذه صورته وجب عليه القتل لأنه مفسد في الأرض وإنما قلنا ذلك لان الخبر الأول مطابق لظاهر القرآن قال الله تعالى: " أن النفس بالنفس " وقد علمنا أنه أراد النفس القاتلة دون غيرها بلا خلاف، فينبغي أن يكون ما خالف ذلك لا يعمل عليه.

His saying (peace be upon him): Striking the side of the slave does not indicate that his master is not obligated to return half of the blood money to the heirs of the second murdered man, or to hand over the slave to them, because if he were free, that would be required of him, as we have explained. The ruling for the slave is the same, and in addition to that, he must be disciplined (ta'zīr), just as free men must be, according to what al-Fuḍayl ibn Yasār narrated in the tradition that we presented earlier.
168 - Chapter on one who orders another to kill a person, and he kills him.
(1071) 1 - Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad from al-Ḥasan ibn Maḥbūb from ʿAlī ibn Ri’āb from Zurārah from Abī Jaʿfar (peace be upon him) concerning a man who ordered another man to kill a man, and he killed him, he said: "The one who killed him is killed for it, and the one who ordered the killing is imprisoned until he dies."
(1072) 2 - As for what Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad narrated from Ibn Maḥbūb from Isḥāq ibn ʿAmmār from Abī ʿAbdillāh (peace be upon him) concerning a man who ordered his slave to kill a man, and he killed him, he said: "The master is killed for him."
(1073) 3 - ʿAlī from his father from al-Nawfalī from al-Sakūnī from Abī ʿAbdillāh (peace be upon him) who said that Amīr al-Mu’minīn (peace be upon him) said: Regarding a man who ordered his slave to kill a man, and he killed him, Amīr al-Mu’minīn (peace be upon him) said: "Is the man's slave but like his sword? The master is killed, and the slave is placed in custody."
The way to understand these two narrations is to interpret them as referring to one who habitually orders his slaves to kill people, compelling them to do so and forcing them into it. For one who is like this, killing is obligatory upon him because he is a corrupter on earth. We say this because the first tradition is in accordance with the apparent meaning of the Qur'an. God Almighty said: "That the life is for the life." And we know that He intended the killing soul, not any other, without disagreement, so whatever contradicts that should not be acted upon.

169 - باب ضمان الراكب لما تجنيه الدابة (1074) 1 - علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن ابن أبي عمير عن حماد عن الحلبي عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام انه سئل عن الرجل يمر على الطريق من طرق المسلمين فتصيب دابته إنسانا برجلها فقال: ليس عليه ما أصابت برجلها ولكن عليه ما أصابت بيدها لان رجلها خلفه إن ركب وإن كان قادها فإنه يملك بالدابة يدها يضع حيث شاء.
(1075) 2 - علي عن أبيه عن النوفلي عن السكوني عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام انه ضمن القائد والسائق والراكب وقال: ما أصاب الرجل فعلى السائق؟ مما؟ أصابت اليد فعلى الراكب والقائد.
(1076) 3 - الحسين بن سعيد عن النضر عن هشام بن سالم وعلي بن النعمان عن ابن مسكان جميعا عن سليمان بن خالد قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن رجل مر في طريق المسلمين فتصيب دابته برجلها فقال: ليس على صاحب الدابة شئ مما أصابت برجلها ولكن عليه ما أصابت بيدها لان رجلها خلفه إذا ركب، وإن قاد دابة فإنه يملك يدها بإذن الله يضعها حيث شاء.
(1077) 4 - فأما ما رواه الصفار عن الحسن بن موسى الخشاب عن غياث بن كلوب عن إسحاق بن عمار عن جعفر عن أبيه ان عليا عليهم السلام كان يضمن الراكب ما أوطأت بيدها ورجلها إلا أن يعبث بها أحد فيكون الضمان على الذي عبث بها.

169 - Chapter on the liability of a rider for damages caused by the animal (1074) 1 - Ali ibn Ibrahim from his father from Ibn Abi Umair from Hammad from al-Halabi from Abi Abdillah, peace be upon him, that he was asked about a man who passes on the road of the Muslims and his animal injures a person with its leg, so he said: He is not liable for what it injures with its leg, but he is liable for what it injures with its hand, because its leg is behind him if he is riding. But if he is leading it, then he controls the animal's hand, placing it wherever he wishes.
(1075) 2 - Ali from his father from al-Nawfali from al-Sakuni from Abi Abdillah, peace be upon him, that he held the leader, the driver, and the rider liable and said: What the animal injures belongs to the driver? What did the hand injure belongs to the rider and the leader.
(1076) 3 - Al-Hussein ibn Saeed from al-Nadr from Hisham ibn Salim and Ali ibn al-Nu'man from Ibn Muskan all from Sulaiman ibn Khalid who said: I asked Abu Abdillah, peace be upon him, about a man who passes on the road of the Muslims and his animal injures someone with its leg, so he said: The owner of the animal is not liable for anything the animal injures with its leg, but he is liable for what it injures with its hand, because its leg is behind him when he is riding. And if he is leading the animal, then he controls its hand by the permission of Allah, placing it wherever he wishes.
(1077) 4 - As for what al-Saffar narrated from al-Hasan ibn Musa al-Khashab from Ghiyath ibn Kallub from Ishaq ibn Ammar from Jafar from his father that Ali, peace be upon them, held the rider liable for what it trampled with its hand and leg, unless someone interferes with it, in which case the liability falls on the one who interfered with it.
This does not contradict the first narrations because the interpretation of this narration is that we understand it to mean that if the rider is standing on the animal, then he is liable for what it injures with its hand and leg. And the first narrations we interpret them as referring to one who is walking

text:
المرأة والغلام عمد فهو مخالف لقول الله تعالى لان الله عز وجل حكم في قتل الخطأ بالدية دون القود ولا يجوز أن يكون الخطأ عمدا كما لا يجوز أن يكون العمد خطأ إلا ممن ليس بمكلف مثل المجانين ومن ليس بعاقل من الصبيان، وأيضا فقد أوردنا في كتاب تهذيب الأحكام ما يدل على أن العبد إذا قتل خطأ سلم إلى أولياء المقتول أو يفتديه مولاه وليس لهم قتله، وكذلك قد بينا ان الصبي إذا لم يبلغ فان عمده وخطأه يجب فيهما الدية دون القود فكيف يجوز أن نقول في هذه الرواية ان خطأه عمد وإذا كان الخبران على ما قلناه من المنافاة للكتاب والأخبار المتواترة لم ينبغ أن يكون العمل عليهما فيما يتضمنان من جعل الخطأ عمدا، والوجه فيهما أن نحملهما على أن يكون خطأهما عمدا ما يعتقده بعض المخالفين انه خطأ وإن كان عمدا لان فيهم من يقول إن من قتل غيره بغير حديد كان ذلك خطأ ويسقط القود، وقد بينا نحن خلاف ذلك في كتابنا المقدم ذكره، ويكون المعنى في قوله عليه السلام لم يدرك بمعنى حد الكمال لأنا قد بينا ان الصبي إذا بلغ خمسة أشبار اقتص منه أو بلغ عشر سنين، والذي يدل على ذلك ههنا:
(1085) 3 - ما رواه علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن النوفلي عن السكوني عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال قال أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام: في رجل وغلام اشتركا في قتل رجل فقتلاه فقال أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام: إذا بلغ الغلام خمسة أشبار اقتص منه وإذا لم يكن بلغ خمسة أشبار قضى بالدية.

translation:
T Text:
---
If a woman and a boy commit intentional murder, it contradicts the saying of Allah Almighty, because Allah Almighty has ruled in the case of unintentional killing with *diyah* (blood money) instead of *qiṣāṣ* (retaliation). It is not permissible for unintentional to be considered intentional, just as it is not permissible for intentional to be considered unintentional, except from those who are not legally responsible, such as the insane and those who are not sane from among children. Also, we have mentioned in the book *Tahdhīb al-Aḥkām* what indicates that if a slave kills unintentionally, he is handed over to the heirs of the murdered person, or his master ransoms him, and they do not have the right to kill him. Likewise, we have explained that if a child has not reached puberty, then for both his intentional and unintentional acts, *diyah* is required, not *qiṣāṣ*. So how can we say in this narration that his unintentional act is intentional? If the two reports are as we have said, contradicting the Book and the *mutawatir* (massively transmitted) reports, then it is not appropriate to act upon them in what they imply of making the unintentional intentional. The way to understand them is to interpret them as their unintentional act being considered intentional by some of the *mukhalifin* (those who differ), who believe it to be unintentional even if it is intentional. For among them are those who say that if someone kills another with something other than iron, then that is unintentional and *qiṣāṣ* is waived. We have explained our disagreement with that in our aforementioned book. And the meaning in his saying, peace be upon him, " لم يدرك " (*lam yudrik*) "he did not realize" means: has not reached full maturity, because we have explained that if a child reaches five spans in height, *qiṣāṣ* is taken from him, or if he reaches ten years of age. What indicates that here is:
(1085) 3 - What Ali bin Ibrahim narrated from his father, from al-Nawfali, from al-Sakuni, from Abi Abdullah, peace be upon him, who said: Amir al-Mu'minin, peace be upon him, said: Regarding a man and a boy who participated in killing a man and killed him, Amir al-Mu'minin, peace be upon him, said: If the boy reaches five spans in height, *qiṣāṣ* is taken from him, and if he has not reached five spans in height, *diyah* is decreed.

text:
أبواب ديات الأعضاء 171 - باب دية الشفتين (1086) 1 - الحسن بن محبوب عن أبي جميلة عن أبان بن تغلب عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: في الشفة السفلى ستة آلاف وفي العليا أربعة آلاف لان السفلى تمسك الماء.
(1087) 2 - وروى ظريف بن ناصح في كتابه مثل ذلك.
(1088) 3 - فأما ما رواه الحسين بن سعيد عن الحسن عن زرعة عن سماعة قال قال:
أبو عبد الله عليه السلام الشفتان العليا والسفلى سواء في الدية.
فلا ينافي الخبرين الأولين لأنه يمكن أن يكون المراد بالتسوية بينهما في وجوب الدية لا في مقدارها فيكونان متساويين من حيث يجب لكل واحد منهما دية ما وإن تفاضلا في المقدار.

Chapters on the Diyah of Body Parts

171 - Chapter on the Diyah of the Lips

(1086) 1 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub from Abi Jamilah from Aban ibn Taghlib from Abi Abdullah, peace be upon him, who said: "For the lower lip, it is six thousand, and for the upper lip, it is four thousand, because the lower lip holds water."

(1087) 2 - And Zarif ibn Nasih narrated in his book the like of that.

(1088) 3 - As for what Al-Hussein ibn Saeed narrated from Al-Hasan from Zur'ah from Sama'ah who said: Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, said: "The two lips, the upper and lower, are equal in the diyah."

This does not contradict the first two narrations because it is possible that the intention of equality between them is in the obligation of the diyah, not in its amount, so they are equal in terms of the fact that each of them is owed a diyah, even if they differ in the amount.

text:
اثنتا عشرة سنا ستة آلاف درهم، وفي كل سن من المواخير مائتان وخمسون درهما وهي ستة عشرة سنا فديتها أربعة آلاف درهم، فجميع دية المقاديم والمواخير من الأسنان عشرة آلاف، درهم، وإنما وضعت الدية على هذا، فما زاد على ثمانية وعشرين سنا فلا دية له وما نقص فلا دية له هكذا وجدناه في كتاب علي عليه السلام.
(1090) 2 - فاما ما رواه أحمد بن محمد عن الحسن بن محبوب عن عبد الله بن سنان عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: الأسنان كلها سواء في كل سن خمسمائة درهم.
(1091) 3 - وما رواه أحمد بن أبي عبد الله عن عثمان بن عيسى عن سماعة قال: سألته عن الأسنان فقال: هي في الدية سواء.
(1092) 4 - وما رواه محمد بن الحسن الصفار عن أحمد بن محمد عن محمد بن سنان عن العلا ابن الفضيل عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام أنه قال: السن من الثنايا والأضراس سواء نصف العشر.
(1093) 5 - وما رواه الحسن بن علي بن فضال عن ظريف عن علي بن أبي حمزة عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال في السن خمس من الإبل أدناها وأقصاها وهو نصف عشر الدية.
فالوجه في هذه الأخبار أن نحملها على الانسان التي هي المقاديم دون المواخير لأنها هي المتساوية في وجوب الدية في كل واحد منها خمسمائة حسب ما فصل في الرواية الأولى، وينبغي أن يبني المجمل على المفصل لما بيناه في غير موضع، ولو لم يكن المراد ما قلناه لكانت الدية تزيد على الدية الكاملة إذا أوجب في كل سن خمسمائة لان جميعها ثمانية وعشرون سنا وذلك لا يذهب إليه أحد.

translation:

Twelve teeth are six thousand dirhams, and for each tooth of the back teeth, it is two hundred and fifty dirhams, and they are sixteen teeth, so their ransom is four thousand dirhams. The total diyah (wergild) for the front and back teeth is ten thousand dirhams. The diyah is determined this way: anything more than twenty-eight teeth has no diyah, and anything less has no diyah. This is what we found in the book of Ali (peace be upon him).
(1090) 2 - As for what Ahmad ibn Muhammad narrated from al-Hasan ibn Mahbub from Abdullah ibn Sinan from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) who said: "All teeth are equal, for each tooth five hundred dirhams."
(1091) 3 - And what Ahmad ibn Abi Abdullah narrated from Uthman ibn Isa from Sama'a who said: "I asked him about the teeth, and he said: 'They are equal in diyah.'"
(1092) 4 - And what Muhammad ibn al-Hasan al-Saffar narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Muhammad ibn Sinan from al-'Ala ibn al-Fudayl from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) that he said: "A tooth from the incisors and molars are equal, half of one-tenth [of the full diyah]."
(1093) 5 - And what al-Hasan ibn Ali ibn Faddal narrated from Zarif from Ali ibn Abi Hamza from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) who said regarding a tooth: "Five camels, its lowest and highest value, which is half of one-tenth of the diyah."
The way to reconcile these narrations is to interpret them as referring to the front teeth (al-maqādim) and not the back teeth (al-mawākhir), because the front teeth are the ones that are equal in terms of the obligation of diyah, with each one being five hundred, as detailed in the first narration. The general should be based on the specific, as we have explained in more than one place. If the intended meaning were not what we said, then the diyah would exceed the full diyah if five hundred were required for each tooth, since there are twenty-eight teeth in total, and no one accepts that.

(1094) 6 - As for what al-Nawfali narrated from al-Sakuni, from Abi Abdullah, peace be upon him, who said that Amir al-Mu'minin, peace be upon him, said: "The teeth are thirty-one *thaghra* (1), in each *thaghra* there are three camels and five camels."

173 - Chapter on the Tooth that is Struck and Turns Black Without Falling Out (1095) 1 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ibn Mahbub from Abdullah ibn Sinan from Abi Abdullah, peace be upon him, who said: "If a tooth is struck, one waits a year. The interpretation of this narration is that we attribute it to the detail that we mentioned in the first narration, which is the obligation of two-thirds of the *diya* (blood money) for it, without the full *diya* (blood money).

إذا يبست منه الكف فشلت أصابع الكف كلها فان فيها ثلثي الدية دية اليد، وإن شلت بعض الأصابع وبقي بعض فان في كل إصبع شلت ثلثي ديتها، قال:
وكذلك الحكم في الساق والقدم إذا شلت أصابع القدم.
(1098) 2 - فأما ما رواه علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن ابن أبي عمير عن حماد عن الحلبي عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام في الإصبع عشر الدية إذا قطعت من أصلها أو شلت، قال: وسألته عن الأصابع أسواءهن في الدية؟ قال نعم، قال: وسألته عن الأسنان؟
فقال: ديتهن سواء.
فالوجه في هذا الخبر ان نحمله على أنه إذا فعل بالإصبع ما تشل عنده فتستحق بذلك ثلثي ديتها، وإذا قطعت بعد ذلك كان فيها ثلث الدية فيصير دية كاملة لها وذلك لا ينافي التفصيل الذي تضمنه الخبر الأول.
175 - باب دية الأصابع (1099) 1 - علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن ابن أبي عمير عن حماد عن الحلبي عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: سألته عن الأصابع أسواءهن في الدية؟ قال نعم.
(1100) 2 - أحمد بن محمد عن ابن محبوب عن عبد الله بن سنان عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: أصابع اليدين والرجلين سواء في الدية في كل إصبع عشر من الإبل، وفي الظفر خمسة دنانير.
(1101) 3 - الحسين بن سعيد عن الحسن عن زرعة عن سماعة قال: سألته عن الأصابع هل لبعضها على بعض فضل في الدية؟ فقال: هن سواء في الدية.

If the palm becomes dry and all the fingers become paralyzed, then it requires two-thirds of the *diyah* (blood money) of the hand. If some fingers become paralyzed and some remain, then each paralyzed finger requires two-thirds of its *diyah*. He said: The same applies to the leg and foot if the toes become paralyzed.
(1098) 2 - As for what was narrated by Ali bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abi Umair, from Hammad, from al-Halabi, from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) concerning the finger, [for which is] one-tenth of the *diyah* if it is cut off from its base or paralyzed. He said: And I asked him, are the fingers equal in *diyah*? He said: Yes. He said: And I asked him about the teeth?
He said: Their *diyah* is equal.
The interpretation of this report is that we understand it to mean that if something is done to the finger that causes it to become paralyzed, then two-thirds of its *diyah* is warranted. And if it is cut off after that, then it requires one-third of the *diyah*, thus making the complete *diyah* for it. That does not contradict the detail contained in the first report.
175 - Chapter on the *Diyah* of Fingers (1099) 1 - Ali bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abi Umair, from Hammad, from al-Halabi, from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him), who said: I asked him, are the fingers equal in *diyah*? He said: Yes.
(1100) 2 - Ahmad bin Muhammad, from Ibn Mahbub, from Abdullah bin Sinan, from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him), who said: The fingers of the hands and feet are equal in *diyah*; each finger requires one-tenth of [the *diyah* of] camels, and the nail requires five dinars.
(1101) 3 - Al-Hussein bin Saeed, from al-Hasan, from Zur'ah, from Sama'ah, who said: I asked him, do some fingers have precedence over others in *diyah*? He said: They are equal in *diyah*.

(1102) 4 - From him, from al-Qasim, from Ali, from Abi Basir, from Abi Abdillah (peace be upon him) who said:
"For the fingers, each finger is worth ten camels."
Muhammad bin al-Hasan said: "These narrations are in agreement, not different. Zarif bin Nasih narrated in his narration that the fingers are equal except for the thumb, which has an individual diyah (blood money); it has one-third of the diyah of the hand, and two-thirds of the diyah is divided equally among the four fingers. We have included his narration in its entirety in our large book. It is permissible to interpret these narrations according to this detail. As for what the narration of Abi Basir and Abdullah bin Sinan contains, that each finger is worth ten camels, it is permissible that this is from the words of the narrator. When he heard that the fingers are equal in diyah (blood money), he interpreted it as each finger being worth ten camels, not knowing that this ruling is specific to the four fingers. We say this so that action can be taken on all the reports without discarding any of them."

Whatever he cannot articulate of speech, the diyah (blood money) is determined proportionately."
(1104) 2 - From him, from al-Hasan, from Zur'ah, from Sama'ah who said: "Amir al-Mu'minin (peace be upon him) ruled concerning a man who struck a boy on his head, causing him to lose part of his speech and to articulate some words but not others. قال: فإذا ضرب الرجل على رأسه فثقل لسانه عرضت عليه حروف المعجم فما لم يفصح به منها يؤدي منه بقدر ذلك من المعجم يقام أصل الدية على المعجم كله ثم يعطى بحساب ما لم يفصح به منها وهي تسعة وعشرون حرفا.
(1106) 4 - أحمد بن محمد عن الحسن بن محبوب عن سليمان بن خالد عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام في رجل ضرب رجلا في رأسه فثقل لسانه انه يعرض عليه حروف المعجم كلها ثم يعطى ديته بحصته ما لم يفصح به منها.
(1107) 5 - النوفلي عن السكوني عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال اتي أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام برجل ضرب فذهب بعض كلامه وبقي بعض كلامه فجعل ديته على حروف المعجم ثم قال: تكلم بالمعجم فما نقص من كلامه فبحساب ذلك، والمعجم ثمان وعشرون حرفا فجعل ثمانية وعشرين جزءا فما نقص من ذلك فبحساب ذلك.
(1108) 6 - فأما ما رواه محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى والصفار جميعا عن العبيدي عن عثمان ابن عيسى عن سماعة عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: قلت له رجل طرق بغلام طرقة فقطع بعض لسانه فأفصح ببعض ولم يفصح ببعض قال: يقرأ المعجم فما أفصح به طرح من الدية وما لم يفصح به ألزم الدية، قال قلت: فكيف هو؟ قال: على حساب الجمل ألف ديته واحد، والباء ديتها اثنان، والجيم ثلاثة، والدال أربعة، والهاء خمسة، والواو ستة، والزاي سبعة، والحاء ثمانية، والطاء تسعة، والياء عشرة والكاف عشرون، واللام ثلاثون، والميم أربعون، والنون خمسون، والسين ستون والعين سبعون، والفاء ثمانون، والصاد تسعون، والقاف مائة، والراء مائتان، والشين ثلاثمائة، والتاء أربعمائة وكل حرف يزيد بعد هذا من ا ب ت ث له مائة درهم.
فما تضمن هذا الخبر من تفصيل دية الحروف يجوز أن يكون من كلام بعض الرواة

He said: If a man is struck on the head and his tongue becomes heavy, the letters of the alphabet are presented to him. Whatever he cannot pronounce of them, he pays from the *diya* (blood money) according to that amount from the entire alphabet. The basis of the *diya* is established on the entire alphabet, and then he is given according to what he cannot pronounce of them, which are twenty-nine letters.
(1106) 4 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad from al-Hasan ibn Mahbub from Sulayman ibn Khalid from Abi Abdillah, peace be upon him, concerning a man who struck another man in the head and his tongue became heavy: that all the letters of the alphabet are presented to him, and then his *diya* is given in proportion to what he cannot pronounce of them.
(1107) 5 - Al-Nawfali from al-Sakuni from Abi Abdillah, peace be upon him, who said: Amir al-Mu'minin, peace be upon him, was brought a man who was struck and lost some of his speech, and some of his speech remained. So he based his *diya* on the letters of the alphabet. Then he said: "Speak with the alphabet. Whatever is missing from his speech, then it is according to that account." And the alphabet is twenty-eight letters, so he made it twenty-eight parts. Whatever is missing from that, then it is according to that account.
(1108) 6 - As for what Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya and al-Saffar both narrated from al-'Ubadi from Uthman ibn Isa from Sama'a from Abi Abdillah, peace be upon him, who said: I said to him, "A man had intercourse with a young boy, an act of intercourse, and cut off part of his tongue, so he pronounced some and did not pronounce some." He said: "He reads the alphabet. Whatever he pronounces is removed from the *diya*, and whatever he does not pronounce is obligated for the *diya*." He said: I said, "How is it?" He said: "According to the *hisab al-jummal* (numerical value of Arabic letters): one thousand is his *diya* for one, and two is his *diya* for the letter *baa*, and three for *jim*, and four for *dal*, and five for *haa*, and six for *waw*, and seven for *zay*, and eight for *haa*, and nine for *taa*, and ten for *yaa*, and twenty for *kaf*, and thirty for *lam*, and forty for *mim*, and fifty for *nun*, and sixty for *sin*, and seventy for *ayn*, and eighty for *faa*, and ninety for *sad*, and one hundred for *qaf*, and two hundred for *raa*, and three hundred for *shin*, and four hundred for *taa*, and every letter that increases after this from *alif, baa, taa, thaa* has one hundred dirhams."
What this *khabar* (narration) contains of the detailing of the *diya* of the letters may be from the words of some of the narrators.

من حيث سمعوا أنه قال: تفرق ذلك على حروف الجمل ظنوا انه على ما يتعارفه الحساب من ذلك ولم يكن القصد ذلك، إنما كان المراد ان يقسم على الحروف كلها اجزاء متساوية، كل حرف جزءا من جملتها على ما فصل السكوني في روايته وغيره، ولو كان الامر على ما تضمنته هذه الرواية لما استكملت الحروف كلها الدية على الكمال لان ذلك لا يبلغ الدية كاملة ان حسبناها على الدراهم وإن حسبناها على الدنانير تضاعفت الدية وكل ذلك فاسد، فينبغي أن يكون العمل على ما تقدم من الاخبار إن شاء الله.
177 - باب من وطئ جارية فأفضاها (1109) 1 - الحسن بن محبوب عن الحرث بن محمد بن النعمان صاحب الطاق عن بريد العجلي عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام في رجل افتض جاريته يعني امرأته فأفضاها قال:
عليه الدية إن كان دخل بها قبل أن تبلغ تسع سنين قال: فان أمسكها ولم يطلقها فلا شئ عليه، وإن كان دخل بها ولها تسع سنين فلا شئ عليه إن شاء أمسك وإن شاء طلق.
(1110) 2 - فاما ما رواه ابن أبي عمير عن حماد عن الحلبي عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: سألته عن رجل تزويج جارية فوقع بها فأفضاها قال: عليه الاجراء عليها ما دامت حية.
فلا ينافي الخبر الأول لأنا نحمل هذا الخبر على من وطئها بعد التسع سنين فإنه لا يكون عليه الدية وإنما يلزمه الاجراء عليها ما دامت حية لأنها لا تصلح لرجل، ولا ينافي هذا التأويل قوله في الخبر الأول إن شاء طلق وإن شاء أمسك إذا كان الدخول بعد

Regarding what they heard him say—that it is distributed according to the numerical values of the letters—they assumed that it corresponds to the familiar calculation, but that was not the intention. Rather, the intention was to divide it equally among all the letters, each letter a part of the whole, as al-Sakuni detailed in his narration and others. If the matter were as this narration implies, the letters would not fully cover the full diya (blood money), because it would not reach the full diya if we calculated it in dirhams, and if we calculated it in dinars, the diya would be multiplied, and all of that is invalid. Therefore, the action should be based on the preceding reports, Allah willing.
177 - Chapter on someone who has intercourse with a slave girl and causes her to be rendered incapable of intercourse. (1109) 1 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub from al-Harith ibn Muhammad ibn al-Nu'man, the companion of al-Taq, from Burayd al-Ajali, from Abi Ja'far, peace be upon him, concerning a man who deflowers his slave girl, meaning his wife, and renders her incapable of intercourse, he said:
He must pay the diya if he had intercourse with her before she reached nine years of age. He said: If he keeps her and does not divorce her, then there is nothing upon him. And if he had intercourse with her when she was nine years old, then there is nothing upon him; if he wishes, he may keep her, and if he wishes, he may divorce her.
(1110) 2 - As for what Ibn Abi Umayr narrated from Hammad from al-Halabi from Abi Abdillah, peace be upon him, who said: I asked him about a man who marries a slave girl and has intercourse with her, thus rendering her incapable of intercourse. He said: He must provide for her expenses for as long as she lives.
This does not contradict the first report, because we interpret this report as referring to one who had intercourse with her after she reached nine years of age, in which case he is not obligated to pay the diya, but he is obligated to pay her expenses for as long as she lives because she is not fit for a man. This interpretation does not contradict his statement in the first report, "If he wishes, he may divorce her, and if he wishes, he may keep her," if the intercourse occurred after

(1111) 3 - رواه محمد بن يعقوب عن عدة من أصحابنا عن سهل بن زياد عن يعقوب ابن يزيد عن بعض أصحابنا عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: إذا خطب الرجل المرأة فدخل بها قبل أن تبلغ تسع سنين فرق بينهما ولم تحل له أبدا.
فلا ينافي ما تضمنه خبر بريد من قوله: فان أمسكها ولم يطلقها فلا شئ عليه لان الوجه فيه أن نحمله على أن المرأة إذا اختارت المقام معه واختار هو أيضا ذلك ورضيت بذلك عن الدية كان جايزا ولا يجوز له وطؤها على حال على ما تضمنه الخبر الأخير حتى نعمل بالاخبار كلها.
(1112) 4 - وأما ما رواه الصفار عن إبراهيم بن هاشم عن النوفلي عن السكوني عن جعفر عن أبيه عن علي عليهم السلام أن رجلا افضى امرأة فقومها قيمة الأمة الصحيحة وقيمتها مفضاة ثم نظر ما بين ذلك فجعلها من ديتها وجبر الزوج على امساكها.
فالوجه في هذا الخبر أن نحمله على ضرب من التقية لان ذلك مذهب كثير من العامة.
178 - باب دية من قطع رأس الميت (1113) 1 - علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن الحسن بن موسى عن محمد بن الصباح عن بعض أصحابنا قال: أتى الربيع أبا جعفر المنصور وهو خليفة في الطواف فقال:
يا أمير المؤمنين مات فلان مولاك البارحة فقطع فلان مولاك رأسه بعد موته قال:
فاستشاط وغضب قال فقال لابن شبرمة وابن أبي ليلى وعدة من القضاة والفقهاء

(1111) 3 - narrated by Muhammad ibn Ya'qub from several of our companions, from Sahl ibn Ziyad, from Ya'qub ibn Yazid, from some of our companions, from Abi 'Abd Allah, peace be upon him, who said: "If a man proposes to a woman and consummates the marriage with her before she reaches nine years of age, they are separated and she is never lawful for him."

The explanation for this report is that we interpret it as a form of taqiyya (dissimulation), because that is the opinion of many of the common people.

ما تقولون في هذا؟ فكل قال: ما عندنا في هذا شئ قال: فجعل يردد المسألة ويقول أقتله أم لا؟ فقالوا: ما عندنا في هذا شئ ولكن قد قدم رجل الساعة فإن كان عند أحد شئ فعنده الجواب في هذا وهو جعفر بن محمد وقد دخل المسعي فقال: الربيع اذهب إليه فقل له لولا معرفتنا بشغل ما أنت فيه لسألناك أن تأتينا ولكن أجبنا في كذا وكذا قال: فأتاه الربيع وهو على المروة فأبلغه الرسالة فقال أبو عبد الله عليه السلام:
قد ترى شغل ما أنا فيه وعندك الفقهاء والعلماء فسلهم قال فقال: له قد سألتهم ولم يكن عندهم فيه شئ قال: فرده إليه فقال: أسألك إلا ما أجبتنا فيه فليس عند القوم في هذا شئ فقال: له أبو عبد الله عليه السلام: حتى افرغ مما انا فيه، قال: فلما فرغ جلس في جانب المسجد الحرام فقال: للربيع اذهب فقل له عليه مائة دينار، وقال:
فأبلغه ذلك فقالوا له فسله كيف صار عليه مائة دينار؟ فقال أبو عبد الله عليه السلام:
في النطفة عشرون دينارا وفي العلقة عشرون وفي المضغة عشرون دينارا وفي العظم عشرون دينارا وفي اللحم عشرون دينارا ثم أنشأناه خلقا آخر وهذا هو ميت بمنزلته قبل أن ينفخ فيه الروح في بطن أمه جنينا قال: فرجع إليهم فأخبرهم الجواب فأعجبهم ذلك قال: وقالوا ارجع إليه فاسئله الدنانير لمن هي لورثته أم لا؟ فقال أبو عبد الله عليه السلام: ليس لورثته فيها شئ إنما هذا شئ صار إليه في يده بعد موته يحج بها عنه أو تصير في سبيل من سبل الخير قال: فزعم الرجل انهم رددوا الرسول فاجابه فيها أبو عبد الله عليه السلام ستة وثلاثين مسألة ولم يحفظ الرجل إلا قدر هذا الجواب.
(1114) 2 - فأما ما رواه محمد بن أبي عمير عن جميل عن غير واحد من أصحابنا عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: قطع رأس الميت أشد من قطع رأس الحي.

What do you say about this?" Everyone said, "We have nothing to offer on this matter." So, he began repeating the question, saying, "Should I kill him or not?" They said, "We have nothing to offer on this matter, but a man has just arrived, and if anyone has knowledge, he would have the answer. It is Ja'far bin Muhammad, and he has entered the Mas'a." So, al-Rabee' said, "Go to him and tell him, were it not for our knowledge of the task you are engaged in, we would have asked you to come to us, but answer us about such and such." So al-Rabee' came to him while he was on al-Marwa and conveyed the message. Abu 'Abd Allah (peace be upon him) said:
"You see the task I am engaged in, and you have the jurists and scholars with you, so ask them." He said, "I have already asked them, and they had nothing to offer." He sent him back, saying, "I ask you to answer us; the people have nothing to offer in this matter." Abu 'Abd Allah (peace be upon him) said to him, "Until I finish what I am doing." When he finished, he sat on the side of the Masjid al-Haram. He said to al-Rabee', "Go and tell him he owes one hundred dinars." He said:
He conveyed that to them, and they said to him, "Ask him how he owes one hundred dinars?" Abu 'Abd Allah (peace be upon him) said:
"Twenty dinars for the drop (of seed), twenty for the clot, twenty for the lump of flesh, twenty for the bone, and twenty for the meat. Then We produced it as another creation (Qur'an 23:14), and this is like a dead person, in the same state as before the spirit was breathed into him as a fetus in his mother's womb." He said: So he returned to them and informed them of the answer, and they admired it. He said, "Return to him and ask him, to whom do the dinars belong, to his heirs or not?" Abu 'Abd Allah (peace be upon him) said: "His heirs have no claim to it. This is something that came to him in his hand after his death. He can perform Hajj with it on his behalf, or it can be used in a way of goodness." He said: The man claimed that they sent the messenger back and forth, and Abu 'Abd Allah (peace be upon him) answered him in thirty-six questions, but the man only remembered this much of the answer.

text:
ابن مسكان عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام في رجل قطع رأس الميت قال: عليه الدية لان حرمته ميتا كحرمته وهو حي.
فلا تنافي بين هذه الأخبار والخبر الذي قدمناه لأنه ليس في ظاهرها ان عليه الدية التي هي دية النفس أو دية الجنين وإذا لم يكن ذلك فيها حملناها على أن ذلك دية الجنين، والذي يدل على ذلك:
(1121) 9 - ما رواه علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن محمد بن حفص عن الحسين بن خالد، ورواه محمد بن علي بن محبوب عن محمد بن الحسين عن محمد بن أشيم عن الحسين ابن خالد قال: سألت أبا الحسن عليه السلام فقلت إنا روينا عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام حديثا أحب ان أسمعه منك فقال: وما هو؟ فقلت: بلغني أنه قال: في رجل قطع رأس رجل ميت قال قال رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله: إن الله حرم من المسلم ميتا ما حرم منه حيا فمن فعل بميت ما يكون في ذلك اجتياح نفس الحي فعليه الدية فقال:
صدق أبو عبد الله عليه السلام هكذا قال رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله، قلت من قطع رأس رجل ميتا أو شق بطنه أو فعل به ما يكون في ذلك الفعل اجتياح نفس الحي فعليه الدية دية النفس كاملة؟ فقال: لا ثم أشار إلي بإصبعه الخنصر فقال لي: ليس لهذه دية فقلت بلى قال: فتراه دية النفس؟ فقلت لا، قال صدقت، فقلت له: وما دية هذا إذا قطع رأسه وهو ميت؟ فقال: ديته دية الجنين في بطن أمه قبل أن ينشأ فيه الروح وذلك مائة دينار قال: فسكت وسرني ما أجابني فيه فقال لم لا تستوفي مسئلتك؟ فقلت: ما عندي فيها أكثر مما أجبتني به إلا أن يكون شئ لا اعرفه، قال: دية الجنين إذا ضربت أمه فسقط من بطنها قبل أن ينشأ فيه الروح مائة دينار وهي لورثته وإن دية هذا إذا قطع رأسه أو شق بطنه فليس هي لورثته إنما هي له دون الورثة، فقلت وما الفرق بينهما؟ فقال: إن الجنين مستقبل مرجو نفعه وإن

Ibn Miskan from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) regarding a man who cut off the head of a deceased person, he said: He is liable for the diya (blood money) because his sanctity in death is like his sanctity in life.

Thus, there is no contradiction between these narrations and the narration that we presented earlier because it is not apparent in them that he is liable for the diya that is the diya for the soul or the diya for the fetus. And if that is not in them, we interpret it as that being the diya for the fetus, and what indicates that is:

(1121) 9 - What Ali bin Ibrahim narrated from his father from Muhammad bin Hafs from Al-Hussein bin Khalid, and Muhammad bin Ali bin Mahbub narrated from Muhammad bin Al-Hussein from Muhammad bin Ashim from Al-Hussein bin Khalid, who said: I asked Abu Al-Hasan (peace be upon him) and I said, "We narrated from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) a hadith that I would like to hear from you." He said, "What is it?" I said, "It reached me that he said: Regarding a man who cut off the head of a dead man, he said that the Messenger of God (peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family) said: 'Indeed, God has forbidden from the Muslim in death what He has forbidden from him in life. So whoever does to a dead person what would be considered a destruction of the soul of a living person, he is liable for the diya.'" He said:

"Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) spoke the truth. This is what the Messenger of God (peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family) said." I said, "Whoever cuts off the head of a dead man or cuts open his stomach or does to him what would be considered in that act a destruction of the soul of a living person, is he liable for the full diya of the soul?" He said, "No." Then he pointed to me with his little finger and said to me, "This does not have a diya." I said, "Yes, it does." He said, "Do you consider it the diya of the soul?" I said, "No." He said, "You have spoken the truth." So I said to him, "What is the diya for this if his head is cut off while he is dead?" He said, "Its diya is the diya of the fetus in its mother's womb before the soul is breathed into it, and that is one hundred dinars." He said: So I was silent and I was pleased with what he answered me with, so he said, "Why don't you complete your question?" I said, "I don't have more in it than what you answered me with, except that there is something I don't know." He said, "The diya of the fetus if its mother is struck and it falls from her womb before the soul is breathed into it is one hundred dinars, and it is for its heirs, but the diya of this if his head is cut off or his stomach is cut open is not for his heirs; rather, it is for him without the heirs." So I said, "What is the difference between them?" He said, "Indeed, the fetus is an awaited future benefit, and

179 - باب دية الجنين (1122) 1 - محمد بن يحيى عن محمد بن الحسين عن محمد بن إسماعيل عن صالح بن عقبة عن سليمان بن صالح عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام في النطفة عشرون دينارا، وفي العلقة أربعون دينارا، وفي المضغة ستون دينارا وفي العظم ثمانون دينارا فإذا كسى اللحم فمائة دينار ثم هي مائة حتى يستهل فإذا استهل فالدية كاملة.
(1123) 2 - علي بن إبراهيم عن محمد بن عيسى عن يونس عن عبد الله بن مسكان عمن ذكره عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: دية الجنين إذا تم مائة دينار فإذا أنشئ فيه الروح فديته ألف دينار أو عشرة آلاف درهم إن كان ذكرا وإن كان أنثى فخمسمائة دينار، وإن قتلت المرأة وهي حبلى ولم يدر أذكر هو أم أنثى فدية الولد نصفان نصف دية الذكر ونصف دية الأنثى وديتها كاملة.
(1124) 3 - علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن ابن فضال ومحمد بن عيسى عن يونس جميعا قال: عرضنا كتاب الفرائض عن أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام علي أبي الحسن فقال:
هو صحيح فكان مما فيه ان أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام جعل دية الجنين مائة دينار

This has passed, and its benefit is gone. When he was subjected to *muthla* (mutilation) after his death, his *diya* (blood money) is then for that *muthla* done to him, not for anyone else. It can be used to perform Hajj on his behalf and to do acts of righteousness and good, such as charity or other things. I said: If a man wants to dig a hole to wash him in, and a man hurries to what he is digging, and his hoe slips and hits his stomach and cuts it open, what is upon him? He said: If it was like this, then it is a mistake, so its expiation is to free a slave, or to fast for two consecutive months, or to give charity to sixty poor people, giving each poor person a *mudd* according to the *mudd* of the Prophet, peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family.
179 - Chapter on the *Diyya* (blood money) of the Fetus

(1122) 1 - Muhammad ibn Yahya from Muhammad ibn al-Husayn from Muhammad ibn Ismail from Salih ibn Uqba from Sulayman ibn Salih from Abi Abdillah, peace be upon him, regarding the *nutfa* (sperm drop): twenty dinars; for the *alaqa* (clot of blood): forty dinars; for the *mudgha* (lump of flesh): sixty dinars; and for the bone: eighty dinars. When it is covered with flesh, then one hundred dinars. Then it remains one hundred until it cries out. If it cries out, then the *diya* (blood money) is complete.

(1123) 2 - Ali ibn Ibrahim from Muhammad ibn Isa from Yunus from Abdullah ibn Muskan from someone who mentioned it from Abi Abdillah, peace be upon him, who said: The *diya* (blood money) of the fetus, when it is complete, is one hundred dinars. If the soul is breathed into it, then its *diya* (blood money) is one thousand dinars or ten thousand dirhams if it is male, and if it is female, then five hundred dinars. If the woman is killed while she is pregnant and it is not known whether it is male or female, then the *diya* (blood money) of the child is divided in half, half the *diya* (blood money) of the male and half the *diya* (blood money) of the female, and her *diya* (blood money) is complete.

(1124) 3 - Ali ibn Ibrahim from his father from Ibn Faddal and Muhammad ibn Isa from Yunus all of them said: We presented the book of inheritance laws from Amir al-Mu'minin, peace be upon him, to Abi al-Hasan, and he said: It is correct. Among what was in it was that Amir al-Mu'minin, peace be upon him, made the *diya* (blood money) of the fetus one hundred dinars.

They both fell down dead. The woman's husband came to the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, and sought redress against him. The striker said:

"O Messenger of Allah, he did not eat, drink, utter a cry (istahalla), rejoice, or show any sign of life." The Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, said: "You are a man of eloquence," and he ruled that he must pay for a slave.

(1129) 8 - Muhammad bin Ali bin Mahbub from Ahmad bin Muhammad from al-Hasan bin Mahbub from Abi Ayyub from Abi Ubaidah and al-Halabi from Abi Abdullah, peace be upon him, who said: He was asked about a man who killed a woman by mistake while she was over her child, in labor. He said: He owes five hundred thousand dirhams, and he owes the diya (blood money) of what is in her womb, a *ghurrah* (fine) of a male or female slave, or forty dinars.

There is no contradiction between these reports and the previous reports, because the previous reports are understood to refer to a fetus that is complete and perfect, but the soul has not yet entered it. This is understood to refer to a woman who expels a clot (*alaqah*) or a lump of flesh (*mudghah*), so its diya (blood money) is a *ghurrah* (fine) of a male or female slave. That which indicates this is:

(1130) 9 - What al-Hussein bin Saeed narrated from Ibn Mahbub from Ali bin Ri'ab from Abi Ubaidah from Abi Abdullah, peace be upon him, about a woman who drank medicine while she was pregnant to abort her child and she aborted her child. He said: If it has bones upon which flesh has grown and the senses of hearing and sight have sprouted for it, then she owes a *diyah* (blood money) that she hands over to his father. He said: And if it is a fetus, a clot (*alaqah*) or a lump of flesh (*mudghah*), then she owes forty dinars or a *ghurrah* (fine) that she hands over to his father. I said: So she does not inherit from her child from his diya (blood money)? He said: No, because she killed him.

This interpretation does not contradict the narration of al-Halabi and Abi Ubaidah that the woman was in labor, because it is not impossible that she was in labor even if the child was not complete, being a miscarriage, so there is no objection.

text: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم باب ترتيب هذا الكتاب وذكر أسانيده وعدد (1) أبوابه ومسائله قال الشيخ السعيد الورع العالم أبو جعفر محمد بن الحسن بن علي الطوسي مصنف هذا الكتاب رضي الله عنه قد أجبتكم أيدكم الله إلى ما سألتم من تجريد الاخبار المختلفة وترتيبها على ترتيب كتب الفقه التي أولها كتاب الطهارة وآخرها كتاب الديات، وأفردت كل باب منه بما يخصه وأوردت ما فيه ولم أخل فيه بشئ قدرت عليه، وبذلت وسعيي وطاقتي في ذلك، وأنا أرجو من الله تعالى إلا أكون أخللت بأحاديث مختلفة تعرف إلا وقد أوردت إلا شاذا نادرا فاني لا ادعي اني أحيط العلم بجميع ما روي في هذا الفن، لان كتب أصحابنا رضي الله عنهم المصنفة والأصول المدونة في هذا الباب كثيرة جدا، وربما يكون قد شذ منها شئ لم اظفر به فإن وقع عليها انسان لا ينسبني إلى التقصير أو التعمد، فان على كل انسان ما يقدر عليه ويبلغ جهده وطاقته وقدرته، وقد أوردت في كل باب عقدته إما جميع ما روي فيه إن كانت الاخبار قليلة، وإن كان ما يتعلق بذلك الباب كثيرا جدا (2) فقد أوردت منه طرفا مقنعا، وأحلت بالباقي على الكتاب الكبير، وكنت سلكت في أول الكتاب ايراد الأحاديث بأسانيدها وعلى ذلك اعتمدت في الجزء الأول والثاني،
footnote:
(1) في نسخة د (وعدة).
(2) زيادة في نسخة د.

In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Chapter on the Arrangement of this Book, Mentioning its Isnads, and the Number of its (1) Chapters and Issues.

Sheikh Al-Saeed, the Pious, the Scholar, Abu Jaafar Muhammad ibn al-Hasan ibn Ali al-Tusi, the author of this book, may Allah be pleased with him, said: May Allah support you, I have responded to your request to extract the various narrations and arrange them according to the order of the books of jurisprudence, beginning with the Book of Purification and ending with the Book of Diyat (Blood Money). I have devoted each chapter to its specific content and included everything relevant to it, leaving nothing out that I could find. I have exerted my effort and energy in this endeavor, and I hope from Allah Almighty that I have not missed any differing hadiths that are known, except for a rare exception. I do not claim to have encompassed all the knowledge of what has been narrated in this field, because the books of our companions, may Allah be pleased with them, the compiled and codified principles in this area are very numerous, and perhaps something has strayed from them that I have not found. If someone comes across it, let him not attribute negligence or intentionality to me, for every person is responsible for what he is capable of and what his effort, energy, and ability reach. In each chapter I have composed, I have included either all that has been narrated in it if the narrations are few, or if what relates to that chapter is very numerous (2), I have included a convincing portion of it and referred the rest to the larger book. At the beginning of the book, I followed the method of presenting the hadiths with their isnads (chains of narration), and I relied on this in the first and second parts.

text:
ثم اختصرت في الجزء الثالث وعولت على الابتداء بذكر الراوي الذي اخذت الحديث من كتابه أو أصله على أن أورد عند الفراغ من الكتاب جملة من الأسانيد يتوصل بها إلى هذه الكتب والأصول حسب ما عملته في كتاب (تهذيب الأحكام) وأرجو من الله سبحانه أن تكون هذه الكتب الثلاثة التي سهل الله تعالى الفراغ منها لا يحتاج معها إلى شي من الكتب والأصول لان الكتاب الكبير الموسوم (بتهذيب الأحكام) يشتمل على جميع أحاديث الفقه المتفق عليه منه والمختلف فيه، وكتاب النهاية يشتمل على تجريد الفتاوى في جميع أبواب الفقه وذكر جميع ما روي فيه على وجه يصغر حجمه وتكثر فائدته ويصلح للحفظ، وهذا الكتاب يشتمل على جميع ما روي من الاخبار المختلفة وبيان وجه التأويل فيها والجمع بينها، والله تعالى اسأل أن يجعله خالصا لوجهه إنه قريب مجيب، وانا ابتدئ الآن بذكر الأسانيد حسب ما قد وعدت إن شاء الله.
(فما ذكرته) عن محمد بن يعقوب الكليني رحمه الله (1) فقد أخبرنا به الشيخ
footnote:
بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم الحمد لله رب العالمين والصلاة على خاتم النبيين محمد وآله الطاهرين، وبعد فهذا تعريف برجال الأسانيد الذين روى عنهم الشيخ قدس سره في الجزء الثالث من كتابه وذكرهم في مشيخته، وقد اختصرنا القول في تعريفهم وشرح أحوالهم معتمدين في ذلك أصح المصادر، وقد ختمنا ترجمة كل واحد منهم بذكر مصادر تاريخه ليتسنى لمن أراد التفصيل الرجوع إليها والله ولي التوفيق.
(1) محمد بن يعقوب الكليني يكنى أبا جعفر ثقة الاسلام عارف بالاخبار فوق المدح والاطراء من مجددي مذهب الإمامية على رأس المائة الثالثة كما ذكر ذلك كثير من أصحابنا وحكاه بعضهم عن ابن الأثير والطيبي وغيرهما، له كتب أهمها كتاب الكافي وهو أصح الكتب الأربعة المعتمد عليها قال ابن حجر في لسانه: سكن بغداد وحدث بها.. وكان من فقهاء الشيعة والمصنفين على مذهبهم توفى سنة 328 ببغداد اه‍ وقال:
غيره انه مات سنة 329 وهي سنة تناثر النجوم وهي السنة التي مات فيها أبو الحسن علي بن محمد السمري اخر السفراء الأربعة للحجة صاحب الامر (عج) وكانت وفاة ثقة الاسلام الكليني في شعبان وصلى عليه محمد بن جعفر الحسني أبو قيراط ودفن بباب الكوفة في مقبرتها قال ابن عبدون رأيت قبره في مقبرة الطائي وعليه لوح مكتوب فيه اسمه واسم أبيه. وقبره الآن في الجانب الكبير عند سوق الخفافين والسراجين بباب الجسر من الجانب الشرقي.
ترجم له ابن حجر في لسان الميزان وإسماعيل پاشا في هدية العارفين وغيرهما.
translation:

Then I abridged in the third part and relied on beginning by mentioning the narrator from whom I took the hadith from his book or original source, provided that I would include after finishing the book a set of isnads (chains of narration) through which one can access these books and original sources, according to what I did in the book (Tahdhib al-Ahkam). I hope from God, the Most Glorified, that these three books, which God Almighty has facilitated the completion of, will eliminate the need for any other books and original sources, because the large book entitled (Tahdhib al-Ahkam) contains all the hadiths of jurisprudence, both those agreed upon and those disputed. The book al-Nihayah contains an abstract of legal opinions in all chapters of jurisprudence, mentioning everything narrated therein in a way that reduces its size, increases its benefit, and makes it suitable for memorization. And this book contains all that is narrated of the different reports and an explanation of the aspect of interpretation therein and reconciliation between them. I ask God Almighty to make it purely for His sake, for He is near and responsive. And I begin now by mentioning the isnads (chains of narration) as I have promised, God willing.
(What I have mentioned) from Muhammad ibn Ya'qub al-Kulayni, may God have mercy on him (1), was reported to us by al-Shaykh
---

In the name of God, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Praise be to God, Lord of the Worlds, and prayers upon the Seal of the Prophets, Muhammad, and his pure family. To proceed: This is an introduction to the men of the isnads (chains of narration) from whom al-Shaykh (may his secret be sanctified) narrated in the third part of his book and mentioned in his Mashyakha (list of teachers). We have abbreviated the statement in defining them and explaining their circumstances, relying on the most authentic sources. We have concluded the biography of each of them by mentioning the sources of his history, so that whoever wants details can refer to them. And God is the Grantor of Success.
(1) Muhammad ibn Ya'qub al-Kulayni, known as Abu Ja'far, thiqa al-Islam (trustworthy of Islam), knowledgeable of the reports beyond praise and flattery, one of the revivers of the Imamiyyah school at the head of the third century, as many of our companions have mentioned and some of them have narrated from Ibn al-Athir, al-Tibi, and others. He has books, the most important of which is the book al-Kafi, which is the most authentic of the four books on which reliance is placed. Ibn Hajar said in his Lisan: He resided in Baghdad and narrated there... and he was one of the jurists of the Shiites and the authors on their school of thought. He died in the year 328 in Baghdad, end quote. And others said that he died in the year 329, which is the year of the scattering of the stars, which is the year in which Abu al-Hasan Ali ibn Muhammad al-Samarri, the last of the four ambassadors of al-Hujjah, the Sahib al-Amr (may God hasten his appearance), died. The death of thiqa al-Islam (trustworthy of Islam) al-Kulayni was in Sha'ban, and Muhammad ibn Ja'far al-Hasani Abu Qirat prayed over him, and he was buried in Bab al-Kufa in its cemetery. Ibn Abdun said: I saw his grave in the al-Ta'i cemetery, and on it was a tablet written with his name and his father's name. And his grave is now in the large side near the al-Khaffafin and al-Sarrajin market at the Bab al-Jisr on the eastern side.
Ibn Hajar translated for him in Lisan al-Mizan, Ismail Pasha in Hidayat al-Arifin, and others.

text: المفيد أبو عبد الله محمد بن محمد بن النعمان الحارثي البغدادي رحمة الله عليه (1)
footnote:
(١) محمد بن محمد بن النعمان المفيد يكنى أبا عبد الله المعروف بابن المعلم قال: ابن النديم في فهرسته ص ٢٥٢ أبو عبد الله في عصرنا انتهت رياسة متكلمي الشيعة إليه مقدم في صناعة الكلام على مذهب أصحابه دقيق الفطنة ماضي الخاطر شاهدته فرأيته بارعا وقال في ص ٢٧٩ إليه انتهت رياسة أصحابه من الشيعة الإمامية في الفقه والكلام والآثار، وقال ابن حجر: عالم الرافضة.. صاحب التصانيف البديعة له صولة عظيمة بسبب عضد الدولة.. كان كثير التقشف والتخشع والاكباب على العلم تخرج به جماعة وبرع في المقالة الامامية حتى كان يقال له على كل امام منة وكان أبوه معلما بواسط وولد بها وقتل بعكبراء ويقال ان عضد الدولة كان يزوره في داره ويعوده إذا مرض وقال الشريف أبو يعلى الجعفري: وكان قد تزوج بنت المفيد - ما كان المفيد ينام من الليل الا هجعة ثم يقول يصلي أو يطالع أو يدرس أو يتلو القرآن اه‍ ولد سنة ٣٣٨ يعرف علو مقامه من التوقيعات الصادرة لتشريفه من الناحية المقدسة فقد جاء في بعضها للأخ السديد والولي الرشيد الشيخ المفيد أبي عبد الله محمد بن محمد ابن النعمان أدام الله اعزازه.. سلام الله عليك أيها الولي المخلص فينا باليقين..
ونعلمك أدام الله توفيقك لنصرة الحق واجزل مثوبتك عن نطقك عنا بالصدق أنه قد اذن لنا في تشريفك بالمكاتبة الخ توفي 2 شهر رمضان سنة 413 قال اليافعي:
وكانت جنازته مشهودة وشيعة ثمانون ألفا من الرافضة والشيعة اه‍ ودفن عند رجلي الامامين الكاظمين (ع) قبره بالرواق الكاظمي مزار معروف، ترجم له ابن النديم والذهبي والخطيب واليافعي وابن كثير وابن حجر والزركلي وإسماعيل پاشا وغيرهم من اعلام العامة.

T Text:

Al-Mufid Abu Abdullah Muhammad ibn Muhammad ibn al-Nu'man al-Harithi al-Baghdadi, may God have mercy upon him.
---

T Footnote:
---
(1) Muhammad ibn Muhammad ibn al-Nu'man al-Mufid, known as Abu Abdullah, also known as Ibn al-Mu'allim. Ibn al-Nadim said in his *Fihrist*, p. 252: "Abu Abdullah in our time, the leadership of the Shia theologians ended with him. He is preeminent in the art of *kalām* (scholastic theology) according to the doctrine of his companions, of keen wit and quick mind. I witnessed him and found him to be outstanding." And he said on p. 279: "The leadership of his companions from the Imamiyyah Shia in jurisprudence, *kalām*, and *āthār* (traditions) ended with him." Ibn Hajar said: "The scholar of the *Rafida*... the author of wonderful compilations, he had a great influence because of 'Adud al-Dawla... he was very ascetic, humble, and devoted to knowledge. A group graduated under him, and he excelled in the Imami doctrine, so that it was said that he had a favor upon every Imam." His father was a teacher in Wasit, and he was born there, and he was killed in Ukbara. It is said that 'Adud al-Dawla would visit him in his house and visit him when he was sick. Al-Sharif Abu Ya'la al-Ja'fari said, and he had married the daughter of al-Mufid: "Al-Mufid would not sleep at night except for a short nap, then he would get up to pray, study, teach, or recite the Quran." He was born in the year 338 AH. His high status is known from the *tawqīʿāt* (letters/decrees) issued to honor him from the Holy Sanctuary. It came in some of them, "To the wise brother, the rightly guided *wali* (guardian, friend), Sheikh al-Mufid Abu Abdullah Muhammad ibn Muhammad ibn al-Nu'man, may God perpetuate his glory... Peace be upon you, O loyal *wali* (guardian, friend), sincere to us with certainty... We inform you, may God perpetuate your success in supporting the truth and increase your reward for speaking on our behalf with truth, that we have permitted you to be honored by corresponding," etc. He died on the 2nd of Ramadan in the year 413 AH. Al-Yafi'i said: "His funeral was witnessed, and eighty thousand of the *Rafida* and Shia accompanied him." He was buried at the feet of the two Imams al-Kazimayn (peace be upon them). His grave in the Kadhimiya portico is a well-known shrine. He was written about by Ibn al-Nadim, al-Dhahabi, al-Khatib, al-Yafi'i, Ibn Kathir, Ibn Hajar, al-Zarkali, Ismail Pasha, and others from the scholars of the general populace.

text: عن أبي القاسم جعفر بن محمد بن قولويه (1) عن محمد بن يعقوب، وأخبرنا به أيضا الحسين بن عبيد الله (2) عن أبي غالب أحمد بن محمد
footnote:
(١) جعفر بن محمد بن جعفر بن موسى بن قولويه يكنى أبا القاسم القمي قال ابن حجر:
من كبار الشيعة وعلمائهم المشهورين منهم ذكره الطوسي وابن النجاشي وعلي ابن الحكم في شيوخ الشيعة وتلمذ له المفيد وبالغ في اطرائه وحدث عنه أيضا الحسين ابن عبيد الله الغضايري ومحمد بن سليم الصابوني سمع منه بمصر اه‍ كان من ثقات الأصحاب واجلاء مشايخهم في الحديث والفقه ذكره مترجموه بكل جميل له تصانيف في الفقه على عدد أبوابه وفى غير ذلك ذكروها بأسمائها، ومنها كتاب جامع الزيارات وما روي في ذلك من الفضل عن الأئمة عليهم السلام وهو المعروف بكامل الزيارة المزار المعروف المشهور المتداول بين الناس نقل عنه جل من ألف في هذا الباب. كان ره أستاذ المفيد وتلميذ الكليني - كما في رياض العلماء - وصل بغداد سنة ٣٣٧ وهي السنة التي رد القرامطة فيها الحجر إلى مكانه من البيت كما حدث هو بذلك فيما نقله عنه القطب الراوندي في الخرايج والجرايح توفى سنة ٣٦٨ وقبره في الرواق الكاظمي بجنب قبر تلميذه الشيخ المفيد رحمهما الله. ترجم له ابن حجر من العامة والنجاشي والشيخ والعلامة وسيد الأعيان وغيرهم.
(٢) الحسين بن عبيد الله بن إبراهيم الغضائري يكنى أبا عبد الله قال الذهبي: شيخ الرافضة، ونقل ابن حجر قوله كان يحفظ شيئا كثيرا وما أبصر ا ه‍ كان من ثقات أصحابنا واجلائهم في الحديث والفقه كثير السماع عارف بالرجال شيخ الطائفة وكانت له مكانة مرموقة بين أهل زمانه، قال الشيخ (وكان حكمه انفذ من حكم الملوك) له كتب ومصنفات صنف كتاب يوم الغدير. وكتاب أدب العاقل وتنبيه الغافل في فضل العلم وغير ذلك مات رحمه الله في النصف من شهر صفر سنة ٤١١ وهو غير ابن الغضائري المصنف لكتاب الرجال المعروف بنسبته إليه (رجال ابن الغضائري) فان ذاك ولد هذا واسمه أحمد. ترجمة الذهبي وابن حجر وإسماعيل باشا والنجاشي والشيخ والعلامة وغيرهم.
translation:
T Text:
---
From Abu al-Qasim Ja'far ibn Muhammad ibn Qulawayh (1) from Muhammad ibn Ya'qub, and al-Husayn ibn 'Ubayd Allah also informed us of it (2) from Abu Ghalib Ahmad ibn Muhammad
---

T Footnote:
---
(1) Ja'far ibn Muhammad ibn Ja'far ibn Musa ibn Qulawayh, known as Abu al-Qasim al-Qummi. Ibn Hajar said: "He is among the prominent Shi'a and their well-known scholars." Al-Tusi, Ibn al-Najashi, and 'Ali Ibn al-Hakam mentioned him among the Shi'a elders, and al-Mufid was his student and greatly praised him. Al-Husayn Ibn 'Ubayd Allah al-Ghada'iri and Muhammad ibn Salim al-Sabuni also narrated from him; he heard from him in Egypt. He was among the thiqa (trustworthy) companions and eminent shaykhs in hadith and jurisprudence. His biographers mentioned him with all beautiful qualities. He has writings in jurisprudence covering all its chapters and in other fields, which they mentioned by their names, including the book "Jami' al-Ziyarat" (Collection of Pilgrimages) and what was narrated in that regard of the virtue of the Imams, peace be upon them, which is known as "Kamil al-Ziyarah" (The Complete Pilgrimage), the well-known and famous pilgrimage book circulated among the people. Most of those who authored in this field نقل عنه (narrated from him). He was the professor of al-Mufid and the student of al-Kulayni - as mentioned in Riyad al-'Ulama' - He arrived in Baghdad in the year 337, which is the year in which the Qaramatians returned the Stone to its place in the House, as he narrated that in what al-Qutb al-Rawandi نقل عنه (narrated from him) in al-Khara'ij wa al-Jara'ih. He died in the year 368, and his grave is in the al-Kazimi portico next to the grave of his student Shaykh al-Mufid, may God have mercy on them. Ibn Hajar from the common people, al-Najashi, al-Shaykh, al-'Allamah, Sayyid al-A'yan, and others translated for him.
(2) Al-Husayn ibn 'Ubayd Allah ibn Ibrahim al-Ghada'iri, known as Abu 'Abd Allah. Al-Dhahabi said: "Shaykh of the Rafida," and Ibn Hajar نقل (narrated) his saying: "He used to memorize a great deal and did not see." He was among the thiqa (trustworthy) and eminent among our companions in hadith and jurisprudence, with much hearing, knowledgeable in Ilm al-Rijāl (biographical evaluation of narrators), the shaykh of the sect, and he had a prominent position among the people of his time. Al-Shaykh said, "His judgment was more effective than the judgment of kings." He has books and writings; he wrote the book "Yawm al-Ghadir" (The Day of Ghadir) and the book "Adab al-'Aqil wa Tanbih al-Ghafil fi Fadl al-'Ilm" (The Etiquette of the Intelligent and the Awakening of the Negligent in the Virtue of Knowledge) and other works. He died, may God have mercy on him, in the middle of the month of Safar in the year 411. He is not the same as Ibn al-Ghada'iri, the author of the book of Ilm al-Rijāl (biographical evaluation of narrators) known by its attribution to him (Rijal Ibn al-Ghada'iri), for that is the son of this one, and his name is Ahmad. Al-Dhahabi, Ibn Hajar, Ismail Pasha, al-Najashi, al-Shaykh, al-'Allamah, and others translated for him.

footnote:
(1) أحمد بن أبي رافع إبراهيم الصيمري " الضميري خ ل " - يكنى أبا عبد الله أصله من الكوفة وسكن بغداد ثقة في الحديث صحيح الاعتقاد روى عن الشيخ الطوسي وروى عنه الشيخ أيضا وأجاز له جميع مروياته صنف كتبا منها كتاب السرائر وكتاب النوادر وهو كتاب حسن، ترجمه الشيخ المامقاني في تنقيحه وغيره.
(2) محمد بن عبد الله بن محمد بن عبيد الله بن المطلب أبو المفضل الشيباني الكوفي نزل بغداد وحدث بها سافر في طلب الحديث عمره له رحلة إلى مصر والشام. نقل الوحيد في فصل الكنى انه قد أكثر الثقة الجليل علي بن محمد الخزاز من ذكره مترحما عليه في كتابه الكفاية ويظهر منه انه شيخه. قال الخطيب.. وكان يروي غرائب الحديث وسؤالات الشيوخ فكتب الناس عنه بانتخاب الدارقطني ثم بان كذبه فمزقوا حديثه وأبطلوا روايته وكان بعد يضع الأحاديث للرافضة ويملي في مسجد الشرقية اه‍ ومنه يعلم سبب ابطال روايته وتمزيق حديثه، قال أبو العلاء الواسطي كان حسن الهيئة جميل الظاهر نظيف اللبسة وسمعت الدارقطني سئل عنه فقال يشبه الشيوخ، قال أبو ذر الهروي كتبت عنه في المعجم للمعرفة ولم اخرج عنه في تصانيفي شيئا وتركت الرواية عنه لأني سمعت الدارقطني يقول كنت أتوهمه من رهبان هذه الأمة وسألته الدعاء لي فتعوذ بالله من الحور بعد الكور وقال أبو ذر: يعني سبب ذلك أنه قعد للرافضة واملى عليهم أحاديث ذكر فيها مثالب الصحابة ا ه‍ ومنه يعلم ميزان الجرح والتعديل عند القوم ولد سنة 297 وتوفي في بغداد في التاسع والعشرين من شهر ربيع الاخر سنة 387 له كتب ترجم له الخطيب وابن حجر من العامة.
translation:
T Text:
---
Al-Ṣaymarī (1) and Abū al-Mufaḍḍal al-Shaybānī (2) and others, all of them from Muḥammad ibn Ya’qūb. And Aḥmad ibn ‘Abdūn, known as Ibn al-Ḥāshir, may God have mercy on him, also informed us of it.
---

T Footnote:
---
(1) Aḥmad ibn Abī Rāfi’ Ibrāhīm al-Ṣaymarī “al-Ḍumayrī k.l.” - Known as Abū ‘Abd Allāh, originally from Kūfah, he resided in Baghdad, thiqa (trustworthy) in ḥadīth, with sound beliefs. He narrated from al-Shaykh al-Ṭūsī, and al-Shaykh also narrated from him and granted him permission for all his narrations. He authored books, including Kitāb al-Sarā’ir and Kitāb al-Nawādir, which is a good book. Al-Shaykh al-Māmaqānī translated him in his Tanqīḥ and others.
(2) Muḥammad ibn ‘Abd Allāh ibn Muḥammad ibn ‘Ubayd Allāh ibn al-Muṭṭalib Abū al-Mufaḍḍal al-Shaybānī al-Kūfī, settled in Baghdad and narrated there. He traveled in pursuit of ḥadīth, living a long life, and he took a trip to Egypt and the Levant. Al-Waḥīd mentioned in the chapter on kunyas that the thiqa (trustworthy) and esteemed ‘Alī ibn Muḥammad al-Khazzāz mentioned him frequently, invoking mercy upon him in his book al-Kifāyah, which indicates that he was his Shaykh. Al-Khaṭīb said: He used to narrate strange ḥadīth and questions of the Shaykhs, so people wrote from him by selection of al-Dāraquṭnī, then his falsehood became apparent, so they tore up his ḥadīth and invalidated his narration, and afterwards he used to fabricate ḥadīth for the Rāfiḍah and dictate in the al-Sharqīyah mosque, end quote. From this, the reason for invalidating his narration and tearing up his ḥadīth is known. Abū al-‘Alā’ al-Wāsiṭī said: He was of good appearance, beautiful outwardly, and clean in dress. I heard al-Dāraquṭnī being asked about him and he said: He resembles the Shaykhs. Abū Dharr al-Harawī said: I wrote from him in al-Mu’jam lil-Ma’rifah, but I did not include anything from him in my compilations, and I abandoned narrating from him because I heard al-Dāraquṭnī saying: I used to imagine him to be from the monks of this nation, and I asked him to pray for me, so he sought refuge with God from deterioration after improvement. Abū Dharr said: Meaning the reason for that is that he sat for the Rāfiḍah and dictated to them ḥadīth in which the faults of the Companions were mentioned, end quote. From this, the standard of al-jarḥ wa al-taʻdīl (criticism and commendation) among the people is known. He was born in the year 297 and died in Baghdad on the twenty-ninth of the month of Rabī’ al-Ākhir in the year 387. He has books, and al-Khaṭīb and Ibn Ḥajar from the common people translated him.
